story:
Short Summary:

My name is Christopher Lynn and for the past 5 years I have been the Inventory Control Manager at a manufacturing plant in Virginia Beach, Virginia where a lot of our employees are Filipino.  So a few years ago I am talking to a coworker and friend about going vacation somewhere in Asia.  I don't care where yet, just as long as it's somewhere in Asia and his comment is that I should visit the Philippines.  Now at this time my geography is hazy and I am just like ok, sure.  I know the Philippine Islands are somewhere over there and that's about it.  So I go there for vacation alone and just fell in love with the country.  The culture, the beaches (I left my heart in Boracay), the people, just everything about it was amazing to me.  I am also happy to say that my girlfriend of 2 years is a Filapina.  I made up my mind back then that I wanted to live there.  This campaign is my dream.  This will allow me to move to the Philippine Islands and also to provide the locals with gainful employment.  If you have never met a Filipino, let me tell you they are some of the nicest people you will ever meet and they have a great deal of pride in their work and themselves.  Every contribution no matter how large or small gets me closer to making this dream reality.

What I Need:

Essentially funding, my goal is to raise $175,000 to open this factory.  In the event I don't raise the full amount I will use whatever funds that were raised to springboard another campaign and as show money for potential investors.  I am working with an investment company to take on a partner and if I can present $50,000, or $100,000 it will be much easier to convince the investor that they want to join me in a partnership to establish this business.

The perks for contributors:  Even just $1.00 adds up and I will list every contributor on a dedicated page of the website which will go live with the opening of the factory so their support will always be remembered.  My goal is to raise $175,000, of that $25,000 will be spent covering the perks for contributors.  The backpacks offered in the perks will be the first ones produced in the factory!  Now I am also offering a vacation for you and 1 guest for 6 days 5 nights.  I am prohibited from offering cash or airline tickets but once you arrive in the Philippines I will provide a hotel room at the fabulous Hotel H2O.  Every time I stay in Manila, I stay at that hotel.  Picture 1 wall of your hotel room is devoted to an aquarium!  It is simply amazing.  By day you will go to the Ocean Park for some sun and relaxation.  How about a city tour of Manila to introduce you to the culture of the Philippines?  Shopping is an experience in itself, locally known as malling.  Come see the famous Mall of Asia!  While you are here you will also be treated to a tour of the ex US Navy Base in Subic Bay and get a tour of the factory you helped to fund! This vacation will be given away to 1 lucky contributor once the factory is operational.  I will randomly choose 1 person from all campaigns combined to come see why I love the Philippine Islands.

The remaining $150,000 is what I need to actually start up this factory.  It covers lease, utilities, furniture, sewing machines, fabric cutters, utilities.  Everything I can think of from my 5 years of experience that I feel I need.  I have $30,000 reserved as liquid capital for expenses I didn't foresee.  Anyone who has ever tried to open a business will tell you that no matter how much research you do, there are always unforeseen expenses.  Plan for success.

Challenges and Risk:

This is a business, and there is always risk in business.  I have a client/supplier in one.  They will provide me with raw materials cut to their needs and then buy back the finished products after I have sewn them.  It's nice to know where my income is coming from but what happens if they go out of business?  They have been around since the 1980's so this is highly unlikely but still; I plan on breaking into the local and Asian market before the end of the first year.  There is no shortage of sewing factories in the Philippines, but I have an established product line that I can manufacture locally with local materials that will be of superior design and engineering. 

Other ways to Help:

Every dollar is 1 step closer to making this goal happen.  If you can't help financially then just share the link.  I am going to need people once this factory opens.  If you have a relative in Subic Bay area who is a skilled sewing machine operator or sewing machine mechanic I am going to need them.  If you have a contact who is a business investor I would like to send them my business plan.  Perhaps you have a contact that runs a business and would be interested in the products we will be sewing... or a supplier of thread.  Thread is the lifeblood of a sewing factory.

My sincerest thank you to everyone:

Christopher Lynn

story:
THANK YOU FOR ALL YOUR LOVE, SUPPORT & CONTRIBUTION....

_____________________________

Your support is greatly appreciated and will be utilized kickstart our first awareness event & fundraiser, the #impossiblemovement . As we come to a close in this indiegogo campaign; our team is now moving full gear with [I'M]POSSIBLE. We hope to see you there!

LEARN MORE & PURCHASE YOUR TICKETS at: 

www.canvasisme.com/impossible


MOTION GALLERY, Calgary AB
November 28, 2015
Avante Access: 6pm
General Access: 7pm

Breaking Barriers; Connecting Communities
Intimate Night Out. Interactive Live Art. 3 Act Showcase
Music. Film. Dance. Poetry. Building Connections

Silent Art Auction. Food Bites. Bar. Mingle. Converse. Groove.
Good Vibes Throughout
_______________________________________________

CONNECTING THE ARTS AND MENTAL HEALTH

VISION

To bridge mental health and the arts in order to help people heal, connect communities, and enhance well-being. 


MISSION

To Educate, Explore & Empower individuals and communities we service. Through in-depth cross-collaboration with mental health, academic and artistic professionals for ongoing development, implementation and research; the goal is to deliver education and understanding around mental health, as well as utilize artistic programs as tools for coping and self development, thereby, decreasing stigmatization and enhancing the well-being of individuals by bridging the gap to communities.


ARTISTIC PROGRAMS

Piloting March 2016.

 Developing artistic programs incorporating poetry, music and dance; exploring participant well-being in conjunction with existing mental health programs and activities.

A focused research group of mental health, educational and art professionals are collaborating on the development of sessional programming; providing a platform for innovative, holistic, and artistic methods based on fundamental coping strategies and combined research. The team will deliver these sessional programs in local nonprofit organizations and schools, with a long term hope to expand the bridge to acute care facilities holistically through validation of  a  (5) year implementation & research plan.


CONTRIBUTION ALLOCATION

1. [I’M]POSSIBLE
Breaking Barriers; Connecting Communities.
November 28 2015.
Motion Gallery, Calgary AB.

Production costs in a kick off event launching the mission and bringing the vision to life; connecting artists, educational and health communities. Event proceeds allocated to program implementation.

2. Year One Artistic Program Implementation:  Phase 1 & 2
Includes the developmental process through the cross-collaboration of mental health, educational and art professionals and the first round of sessional program implementation in local nonprofits and schools.

*Funds raised beyond the target goal will be allocated to the expansion of Phase 3's programming.


LET US PAINT OUR STORIES TOGETHER!

Join the #impossiblemovement


---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

BACKBONE JOURNEY

TOGETHER WE ARE POSSIBLE!

My name is Krizia "Canvas" Carlos and I am an artist and a nurse. My main artistic medium is dance, while I surround myself with other art forms. I am deeply passionate about arts and mental health. Specializing in the mental health field through my work as nurse in hospital wards throughout the city, I have developed a unique understanding of mental health, which most artists do not have the privilege to experience. 

In conjunction to my front line work as a nurse, my experiences traveling and immersing myself in different cultures; I have developed a distinctive understanding of the complexity of human nature through the different stories and life experiences that individuals share. Using this inspiration, I created groups that incorporated artistic activities such as music, poetry, and dance as therapeutic approaches in my practice in the ward. Through these simple activities, I began to see creativity, life, & hope in patients through their voices and their art. Although these small artistic groups were started to simply address patient "boredom" in the unit, I began to see the development of fresh and effective coping strategies for individuals.

Using the "Canvas" as a metaphor; an environment birthed where people have a "clean slate," a "fresh start" to explore positive means of self expression. Using the "Canvas" as a metaphor for LIFE we understand ourselves as creators of our own he[art]work, and that WE have the power to paint our canvases beautiful and inspiring.

Keep up with our progress, visit:  www.canvasisme.com

Keep scrolling to learn more.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

DETAILS


1. [I'M]POSSIBLE 

Motion Gallery, Calgary AB.

November 28th, 2015
Breaking Barriers; Connecting Communities.

Intimate Night Out. Interactive Live Art. 3 Act Showcase.
Music. Film. Dance. Poetry. Building Connections

Silent Art Auction. Food bites. Bar. Mingle. Converse. Groove.
Good vibes throughout.  

TICKETS
Purchase your tickets in the Perks and see your contribution!


COLLABORATIVE ARTS
Featuring an array of art forms stemming from fresh collaborations.  Merging poetry, music, dance, visual arts, film and fashion in a "3 Act" LIVE ART performance taking place throughout the evening.

[I’M]Possible is inspired by the voice of art and dedicated to the understanding of ‘Mental Health,’ removing stigmas and sharing in the importance of well being.

In collaboration with Events by Jones, Sister 2 Sister Association and Vine Marketing.


2. YEAR ONE: ARTISTIC PROGRAMS

March 2016-March 2017

The program model is designed to facilitate research based development, activities and sessional programs. We strive for holistic and community centered approach to empower individuals through resiliency, story telling and leadership to build a strong foundation for sustainable change to.

Selected leaders are masters of their craft. They undergo screening, core training and participate in cross-development.


Current community mental health organization partners include, but is not limited to:  The Alex Pathways to Housing, Sister 2 Sister Association & Mosaic Community Support Association. Community artistic organizations include those listed in the link provided: http://www.canvasisme.com/community-2/


THE MISSIONS FUNDAMENTAL 3 E's

EXPLORE - Everyone is beautifully created as unique individuals. Exploring and addressing the needs of each individual with relation to their unique needs, is important in achieving and maintaining personal "WELL-BEING."

EDUCATE - Knowledge is important, but the application of WISDOM is key to success. Through the use of different artistic mediums tailored to each individual need, the aim is to educate individuals in creating VALUE for themselves through the exploration and understanding of their heARTwork. This is the "spark" of discovering in the leader lying within. 

EMPOWER - Human beings thrive through CONNECTION. You are not alone! We are not alone! In conjunction with gaining value in ourselves, it is important to share positivity and strength around us to continue to fuel us in a sustainable manner. The aim is to build strong and positive support networks that will allow us to thrive through genuine and meaningful connections in our communities.


PROGRAM RATIONALE

Various research papers, as well as observations from the group sessions implemented in the early research stages have identified participant responses stating that the negativity and stigmas associated with mental disorders lead to feelings of disempowerment, decreased self worth, mood, and personal drive. Resulting in an overall lowered status of mental-health and well-being.

Participants credited positive coping strategies gained by means of expressing their emotions artistically.

Their indicated results report:
- Stress and anxiety reduction
- Sleep promotion
- Improvement in mood
- Increased sense of community connection
- General improvement in personal "well being"

"For thousands of years, people have searched for the meaning and beauty of life in music, painting, poetry and other arts. Now scientists are finding that the arts can benefit both your mental and physical health." -News In Health

In a study concerning cancer patients in the hospital; literature reports that it "increased patients' sense of control in the hospital, promoted wellness and the healthy aspects of patients' lives, reductions in pain and increases in immunity, decreases in anxiety, and reductions in psychological and physical symptoms. In several clinical studies examining the effects of music on healing and wellness, music has been found to be a form of relaxation and anxiety reduction." -American Journal of Public Health


*‘Canvas Is Me’ is not nonprofit or charitable entity.


Resources:

https://newsinhealth.nih.gov/2008/June/docs/01features_01.htm

http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2804629/

story:
About Us

Just One Humanity is a ground-up movement that focuses on specific needs of villages to improve quality of life. We focus on the simple fact that we are all more the same than different when it comes to basic needs and quality of life. We recognize that global inequities and basic needs such as clean water, healthcare, etc are not being met for many emergent nations.We promote needs-based assistance and pro-poor conservation at the village level in their commitment to self-sufficiency. Just One Humanity fosters a new paradigm of charity whereby developing nations serve as responsible citizens of this planet to engage in grass-roots involvement and become stewards of the environment.

Our mission is to to end extreme poverty in remote rural areas through sustainable solutions that preserve biodiversity and inspire global citizenship. We envision a world where basic needs are met for all people, serving as a foundation for self-sustainability and environmental stewardship.

We are currently working on building a community center in Salima, Malawi. The center will feature an education area for trainings on conservation, farming and literacy as well as an orphanage and clinic. 

Help Make This A Reality

We have purchased a 3 acres piece of land in Salima, Malawi, and are ready to start building but we need your help! We need a total of $35,000 to construct the building, supply food and clothing to the orphans and fill the clinic with three months worth of medical supplies. 

Breakdown of Costs:

$19,850 - building materials and labor

$7,000 - medicine and supplies for clinic

$1,500 - food, clothing and school supplies for orphans 

$2,650 - furniture, computer, front office supplies

The Impact

With this community center, we will be serving over 20,000 villagers in the surrounding areas. We have picked an optimal location that has a dirt road right into town. Through the education center, we will be able to offer trainings on farming techniques, animal husbandry, adult literacy and conservation. Through these programs we can lower deforestation rates, improve literacy, minimize livestock disease and increase food availability. The clinic will treat the most common illnesses in Malawi, including Malaria, HIV/AIDS, Tuberculosis and decrease the rate of infant and maternal mortality. The orphanage will impact more than 2,500 children that have lost their mother and father. We will offer daily meals, clothing, educational materials and school supplies. 

Risks & Challenges

Theft and vandalism - We will safeguard the center with a nightly guard, which will not only employ a local villager but also ensure that the center is not vandalized or robbed. Village Chiefs will be responsible for the center during the day as well as our managers for each individual facility.

Unknown Weather - Rainy season will pose some difficulty for us during the building phase of this project, however, we will protect all building materials in an adjacent facility as to not lose or damage any materials to wind or rain. 

Misuse of Medicines, Supplies and Food - Keeping track of all items going in and out of the center will be key to ensuring medicines are not being stolen or misused, food is not being taken from caretakers for themselves, and chiefs are not taking advantage of supplies. We will keep an inventory sheet for each area, the clinic, education area and orphanage. Our community director will be doing weekly check-ins and inventory counts to ensure accountability. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help monetarily, that's ok. Sometimes, we think we have to donate a certain amount, but that is not the case, Just one dollar can make all the difference when it comes to this center. And if you can get everyone in your office or class to donate a dollar, imagine the possibilities! If you cannot donate at all, please share this on social media, tell a friend or relative, you can make a difference and have a huge influence on those in your circle. 

We thank you for your consideration and support. Remember, just one connection can change a life.

themselves, and chiefs are not taking advantage of supplies. We will keep an
inventory sheet for each area, the clinic, education area and orphanage. Our
community director will be doing weekly check-ins and inventory counts to
ensure accountability. 
Other
Ways You Can Help
If you can't help monetarily, that's ok. Sometimes, we
think we have to donate a certain amount, but that is not the case, Just one
dollar can make all the difference when it comes to this center. And if you can
get everyone in your office or class to donate a dollar, imagine the
possibilities! If you cannot donate at all, please share this on social media,
tell a friend or relative, you can make a difference and have a huge influence
on those in your circle. 
We thank you for your consideration and
support. Remember, just one connection can change a life.

story:
Moldova has woken up

More than 40,000 demonstrators gathered on Great National Assembly Square in downtown Chișinău on Sunday, September the 6th (which is the largest protest in the former Soviet republic since its independence in 1991), to call for the resignation of the president, Nicolae Timofti, early elections and punishment for those several people responsible for mass embezzlement scandal of missing $1bn, which is equivalent to 1/8 of the country’s budget – disappeared from the three banks through mysterious loans. (source: The Guardian)

What We Need & What You Get

The demonstrators now need $500,000 in order to:

  • provide themselves with water and food
  • to buy more tents, clothes
  • electricity and heat during the night 
  • maintain and support the demonstrators so that they can survive as long as possible in the streets in order to take down the oligarch regime.


Pledge $4 and get a postcard sent from Moldova that represents the fight against the regime.
Pledge $8 and get a basket of local fruit which will support local agricultural farmers, which had to face the embargo imposed by Russia.
Pledge $20  and  receive a voucher for  a bottle of Moldovan wine, a choice from local producers - Cricova, Purcari, Vinaria din Vale.
Pledge $100 and get your name engraved on the wall of liberty, placed in the historical center of Chisinau.
The Impact

This should definitely help those people fighting for a more prosperous and democratic future, as well as their descendants. Moldova has been the poorest country for the last 25 years since its exit from the Soviet Union and there is an urge to make a big change at the moment in order to take down the local corrupt governors.

You may ask - What are you losing? Another journey on the underground or a drink in a pub? Oh well, it's for you to decide - is it crucial or not?

Instead you can definitely get some goodies from Moldova.

We guarantee that all the money will go to helping out the people that are willing to get their country back.

Media and the Press Support Us

http://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/sep/06/moldova-protesters-take-to-streets-criticising-mafia-government

http://www.euronews.com/2015/09/06/moldovans-protest-over-banking-scandal-in-a-rare-show-of-defiance/

https://www.rt.com/news/314586-moldova-protest-government-resignation/

https://news.vice.com/article/massive-protest-h...

story:
To Serve and Empower Los Angeles and Inglewood Communities through Martial Arts.

For more than 20 years, Hwarangdo West L.A. Academy has stood as the beacon and standard of martial arts training.  Thousands have traveled from near and far to train in HwaRangDo®, the Most Comprehensive Martial Art System in the World.  Now, we are expanding the martial arts training started in West Los Angeles into South Los Angeles and Inglewood community and we need little help from you!

To start, I will briefly introduce myself and provide an overview of the great work that the HwaRangDo® West L.A. Academy has done to support its community. My name is Antonio D. Goodwin and I am the branch owner and head instructor of HwaRangDo ® West L.A. Academy.  I am a California native and have lived in Los Angeles for almost 20 years.  I began training in HwaRangDo ® in 2002 under the intense tutelage of Grandmaster Taejoon Lee and I am currently a 2nd Degree Black Sash. In 2012, Grandmaster Lee passed ownership of the West L.A. Academy to me and I have worked feverishly since then to not only continue to teach and empower my students, but I have made it my life’s mission to empower and uplift my community.

Since taking ownership of the academy, I have reached out into the community and have developed a strong working relationship with several organizations across Los Angeles. We have worked with non-profit organizations in the community such as My Friend’s House, a non-profit organization that helps to feed and clothe the homeless, and Manifest Your Destiny, a non-profit organization founded by Hill Harper to help empower and educate at-risk youth.  We have created alliances with NoMore.org and the “ItsOnUs” campaign to raise awareness about Domestic Violence and Abuse.  Personally, I have been invited to speak at several schools regarding self-defense and self-empowerment including Wildwood High School (West L.A.), Hamilton High School (Los Angeles), Monroe Middle School (Inglewood), William Boroughs Middle School (Los Angeles) and Frank D. Parent School (Inglewood).  Most recently, I was invited to be the guest speaker at the Freedom School program at Camp David Gonzales, a juvenile probation camp, encouraging the young men there to be empowered by both knowledge of the world and knowledge of self.

To date, our Academy has hosted more than a hundred Self-Defense, Women’s Self-Defense and Bully Prevention seminars and events throughout Los Angeles and Inglewood.   The vast majority of these classes and seminars were provided free of charge, as I feel it is important to serve, build and empower our community regardless of economical status.  

In January 2015, our academy moved from the location it had been at for more than 20 years to a new and improved, safer location. I undertook several necessary renovations to make the property more comfortable and suitable for students and parents, and to further our mission by utilizing a space that is clean, bright and peaceful. There are plans to continue renovations to make the space even more comfortable and welcoming to members of the community. 

In addition, due to popular demand I have recently partnered with Zion Temple Community Church in South Los Angeles teaching Women’s Self-Defense classes every first Saturday of the month.  I have also partnered with Faithful Central Bible Church to teach Women’s Self-Defense class as well as martial arts, which includes Bully Prevention, Self-Defense, self-awareness and a code of ethics, to the youth of the Inglewood community every Saturday morning. The HwaRangDo West L.A. Academy will still host a Free Self-Defense class once a month in its West Los Angeles location.

Families from all walks of life in and around South Los Angeles and Inglewood have searched for an opportunity to learn self-defense and martial arts. Community members desire to become empowered and gain meaningful skills that they will be able to utilize to enhance many areas of their lives including at school, at work and at home and we aim to provide just that.

HwaRangDo West L.A. Academy is looking to continue outreach into our West L.A. and surrounding communities and establish a long-term HwaRangDo® program in Inglewood and Los Angeles.   Enrollment for the monthly women’s self-defense class in South Los Angeles has already doubled within two months and continues to grow.  In Inglewood, we are expecting 15-20 children to register this summer for weekly martial arts instruction. As word spreads, we expect that number to also double in the coming months when factoring in the schoolmates and family members of these children who live in the surrounding areas.

In the near future, we are also working with other community organizations and members to start other needed programs in Inglewood such as after-school programs and summer camps.  By assisting me in building this program, and continuing to make improvements to our main training center in West Los Angeles, you will directly help impact our community’s ability to maximize their human potential as self aware, accountable, responsible leaders.  We have already been able to effectively reach and teach hundreds of men, women and children. Ultimately, this will allow us to reach hundreds more and allow them a resource and positive outlet to learn the martial arts way, empower them and build productive community members and quality leaders in South Los Angeles, Inglewood and throughout the Los Angeles County.


What We Need & What You Get

Our goal of  $30,000.00 will be used to help secure our West L.A. location and create a long-term training program and curriculum specifically geared towards the women and school-aged children in the aforementioned areas.  Examples of necessary supplies include new portable martial arts mats, office supplies, heavy punching bags, speed bags, jump ropes, ab balls, medicine balls, targets and most importantly uniforms for the kids!  

 The teachers, kids, and people in the community are very excited about this!  This will be the first program of its kind fashioned especially for this portion of the community as no martial arts training for children offered in South Los Angeles and Inglewood is as comprehensive as what we teach within HwaRangDo.   

Our perks include everything from vouchers from free classes, free private training or life coaching session with Inst. Antonio D. Goodwin and customize workout/training packages.

The Impact

Every dollar raised will not be wasted.  The new training program is going to give children a stronger foundation in a wonderful space where they can learn how to build their potential as a martial artist, an individual and a community leader.  What's unique about this program is that it is being built around the needs and requests of South Los Angeles and Inglewood communities.  There have been smaller martial arts programs in the area but nothing like what we are proposing.  Through your contributions, these children and young adults will be exposed to and be able to participate in leadership seminars, tournaments, and most importantly they will be given the opportunity to help assist, teach and serve throughout the community and at other schools.  Empowering our community, serving humanity.


Risks & Challenges

The geographic location will be my biggest challenge to overcome because it requires me to occasionally branch out and away from our West L.A. home in order to bring this very important service to a community that needs it. However, I have developed and prepared a strong support system, including assistant instructors, who will be able to help me maintain the highest level of training at the West Los Angeles location.

Because of my partnerships with Faithful Central Bible Church and Zion Temple Community Church, as well as many other wonderful community organizations and youth programs, I believe this expansion stands a strong chance for success.  I have partnered with well-respected organizations, built a strong reputation through my work with testimonials as proof, and have gone about it the right way with the community members, whom I serve, in mind every step of the way.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute monetarily? We understand, but you can still help! Spread the word, share this on your social networks and let people know you believe in this effort!

story:
What is a Haylog?

The haylog is a patent protected, simple product that is completely new to the heating fuel market. Using a system of hay refining equipment and a highly efficient briquetting machine, Bragdon Farm LLC is able to take locally sourced waste hay and produce four-pound compressed haylogs for use in any wood burning appliance.

What is waste hay you ask? It is hay which has lost its nutritional value due to wet weather or humid conditions. The waste hay cannot be sold and used as feed hay which hurts the hay farmer’s business as a typical harvest can yield 20%-25% waste hay. This is where we come in, Bragdon Farm will buy this burdening product which will provide a secondary income stream to farmers while having no effect on the livestock feed market.

Why Burn Haylogs?

Haylogs are the all-natural, clean burning, alternative heating fuel source with a minimal carbon impact on our environment. No binders, waxes or oils are used, making them the most natural log on the market. On top of the cleanliness of our product, the raw material in our logs (pure hay) produces one of the lowest carbon footprints on the market. As multiple hay crops are harvested each year, the carbon released while burning a log will be recaptured by the next growing cycle - which could be as quick as a couple of months.

If that is not enough, you can rest assured that burning haylogs saves trees and preserves farmland. According to the Maine Department of Agriculture, each haylog produced preserves 100 sq. ft. of farmland.

Can I Burn Haylogs?

Do you have a fireplace, fireplace insert, wood stove, wood boiler, fire pit, chiminea or any other type of wood burning device? Then the answer is yes! The haylog acts very similar to traditional firewood – and that’s how you can treat them. The haylogs can be burned on their own or in conjunction with firewood. Simply start a fire using a firestarter or kindling with the haylogs to enjoy hours of heat!

With a moisture content of 12% or less, the logs are drier than a typical stick of seasoned firewood. The lower moisture content directly translates into higher heat production (higher BTUs) than that of firewood. Preliminary tests have revealed the haylogs produce between 8,000 – 8,500 BTUs compared to 6,000 – 6,500 BTUs produced by seasoned common northeastern hardwood species. Furthermore our haylogs produced a 65% longer burn rate than our test cordwood.

Not only are these haylogs clean and convenient to burn, but they are also clean and easy to purchase, carry and store away. The logs will be available for purchase by the case or pallet through retail destinations or factory direct.

About Bragdon Farm LLC

Bragdon Farm LLC is a manufacturing company producing compressed haylogs as an alternative fuel source. The company is owned by local hay farmer, Peter Bragdon, who has owned and operated his own hay farming business since 1977. Mr. Bragdon was removing tightly wound wet hay from his harvesting equipment’s drive shaft one summer in 2011 and wondered if that same waste hay could be turned into a useful product – such as a burnable log. Four years later, Peter now owns a previously abandoned bakery building where his company operates and has produced initial prototype haylogs.

The company is currently in the process of completing its front-end hay refining system to perfect the haylog formulation. Once the equipment is completely installed, formulation finalized and necessary UL and burn testing completed, the company expects to have the Bragdon Farm Haylog available by early 2016.

Want to Contribute?

Here is where you can make a positive impact on our company as well as the local farming community and environment. Any contribution will help take this small central Maine company another step closer towards a commercialized product and lessen the dependence on foreign resources in the heating fuel industry.

Contributions will assist in important tasks to get this innovative product out of our factory and into your fireplace or woodstove. Funds raised will go towards completing and perfecting product formulation, UL certification testing, and product commercialization. Our dream is to see this product used nation-wide with multiple haylog manufacturing facilities across the U.S.

story:
Catastrophic power failures and poor water are 'SILENT KILLERS' in Ghana. Deaths in 2015 have reached epidemic levels. Help build a sustainable solar power and water desalination station, to bring reliable, inexpensive energy and clean water to thousands in need, on land we are providing.

My Background

I was born and brought up in Uganda during my early years. The biggest influence during my formative years was my father, a World War 2 British Army veteran who spent his career installing water supply in some of the remotest and poorest areas of the country as a water engineer. His drive, kindness, charity, generosity and sheer humanitarianism in changing the lives of the poor and needy to whom he supplied water have defined my inner character and values in life. 

I have run a business in Ghana for 14 years, operating at times under the harshest climatic conditions, devoid of power and water in remote mining areas amongst communities and people where life itself is at a premium. My community of Gomoah Nanyano in the Central Region of Ghana is a poor fishing village where daily lives skirt the very edge of subsistence survival. Their plight has focused my desire to make a life changing impact for them and future generations to come.

My mission with your help, is to bring about sustained solutions to not only power failures but also bring to an end, shortages in clean healthy water that continues to inflict cholera and dysentery on the people of Gomoah Nanyano.

The Campaign

Ghana as a whole has been gripped in a crisis of epidemic proportions over the past twelve months. "Dumsor Dumsor" (meaning on and off) electricity power outages last for 36 hours in a 48 hour cycle. This has become a daily reality and shows no sign of relenting given the deep rooted issues related to fundamental problems in the nation's electricity supply. Like the globally recognised diseases such as HIV AIDS and the deadly Ebola virus that have become synonymous with Africa, "Dumsor" has become a sinister silent killer in Ghana. 

DUMSOR CLAIMS 200+ LIVES

THE NEW STATESMAN  
05 JUNE 2015

The above is an image of fatal carnage caused by a chain reaction of a malfunctioning generator leading to a calamity resulting in 200 deaths in Accra, capital of Ghana. All due to a power outage. This is just one disaster documented in recent months. Deaths are occurring daily all over the nation with no sign abatement.

My community in Gomoah Nanyano has suffered its fair share of deep sorrow due in particular to power outages in clinics and maternity homes.

Because of Dumsor? Midwives deliver using cell phones, candlelight

Erratic power supply in Ghana has forced midwives to use flashlight to assist women in labour to deliver their babies.

Published: 22.04.2015, Source: pulse.com.gh

Why my Campaign is important to me


My campaign is of great importance to me as I have seen great suffering and hardship amongst the people of Gomoah Nanyano. I have witnessed deaths of newborn babies and a worker due to sudden power failures, the latter during routine surgery.


I am fighting for clean, reliable and sustainable energy in Ghana which is blessed with an average of 4.5 hours of daily sunshine. This makes solar power a realistic solution to this current crisis. Gomoah Nyanyano's position on the Atlantic Ocean gives credence to a clean water solution for the village community. I am determined, with your help, to implement a power and water solution that can change the people's lives for the better, so that "Dumsor" and unhealthy water can stop killing local people. 

I want to raise funds in collaboration with the INDIEGOGO community for the construction of a solar power station and a water desalination plant. A few years ago I purchased a valuable piece of land overlooking the Atlantic Ocean for a commercial proposition, but this current crisis has affected my sentiment. I have decided instead to dedicate this land to solving the problem of power and water in Gomoah Nyanyano. This is my personal financial contribution to this project. The twin power and water stations will be known as "NSUO-KANIA" (meaning Water & Light in the Akan language of Ghana). 

Your help in this "seed" pilot project could revolutionise the lives in this poor community. I want to start a revolution that rolls out to the rest of Ghana if not the entire continent of Africa. With YOUR help we can make this happen together. Successfully completing this project will empower me to prove to global NGO's and institutional funders such as the World Bank to give me the mandate to build bigger projects that will help to heal people's pain and make deaths from power outages and poor water a distant memory.

How much money is needed from you & how it will be spent


In order to construct a very basic solar power station that generates electricity together with a water desalination plant on my land at Gomoah Nyanyano, I have set a target of US$315,000. This would provide simple stations to cater for the essential power and water needs of a part of the community. 

To give you an idea, one acre of installation would cost approximately US$500,000 in the USA! (Based on a proportion of 5 acres producing 1 Megawatt of electricity enough to power 300 homes!). On the basis of this yardstick, I am trying to squeeze both the solar power station plus the water desalination plant within a budget of US$315,000.

The total area of my land is 7 acres. I propose to utilise one and a half acres initially based on a basic funding budget (this is currently the maximum area I am permitted to construct upon without further permits). One acre will be applied to building a solar panel power station consisting of:

  • A Target Power Output of 120 Kilowatts of A/C Electricity
  • This would create enough power for 20 houses, the community Health Clinic, Maternity Clinic, Local School and the Village Police Station

PROJECTED COST OF SOLAR POWER STATION: US$ 200,000
1. Purchase of 20 Pallets (26 Panels Per Pallet) of solar panels at US$6,500 a pallet: US$ 130,000

2. 55-400kW PVI central inverters, TOP BRAND, AC rated power: 55-400kW (depends on model), AC rated voltage: 400/320V (depends on model) , AC output: 3-phases, Modular architecture: 55kW block units, Efficiency of up to 98% (-TL), IP20, LV isolation transformer included, Delivered pre-configured and pre-tested, Warranty: 5 years producer warranty: US$ 15,000

3. Photovoltaic Controllers, Storage Battery Cells, Cabling to Homes and Institutions as stated: US$ 30,000

4. Installation Engineers x 2, Consultancy fee of Manufacturer, Local Labour, Transportation, Ghana Customs & Excise Prevention Levies, 24/7 On-Site Security, Building equipment, Local currency fluctuation tariff: US$25,000


PROJECTED COST OF WATER DESALINATION STATION: US$ 115,000
The remaining half an acre will be used to house the water desalination plant together with an appropriate water tower tank to retain clean water supply.
Construction of this will take place simultaneously with the solar power station. 

  1. Desalination water station housing Reverse Osmosis salt water conversion and filtration system, inclusive of extraction pump and inward pipes: US$ 60,000
  2. Desalinated water pump, piping to water tower tank, cost of erecting water tower tank (30,000 imperial gallon capacity), tank filtration system. labour, installation consultancy, 12 months maintenance contract: US$ 55,000

This current funding would create the above to fulfil the construction of this twin project. If your generosity helps me to surpass this monetary target, I will apply the extra funds as follows:
  • Apply for planning permission of a larger solar power station on the rest of my land, to roll out greater wattage of electricity for more homes.
  • To invest funds in underground water pipes to essential institutions such as the Health Clinic and Maternity Home plus provide hot water to the same via thermal solar panels so that hot water can be used for sanitation purposes.
  • To buy a sanitised water supply carrier tank vehicle (similar to a large Semi fuel tanker) to transport water to the village of Gomoah Nyanyano.

What happens to the funds raised if I fail to hit my target?
In the event that I fail to reach the financial target I have set, I will update my page here on INDIEGOGO with a revised plan involving a down sized solar power and desalination water station. I will do this so that I may re-present my case for more funding to try and attain my initial goal. I never give up, and I will keep fighting to change the lives of people in my community until I attain my goal!

Perks!!!

I believe the Perks offered in this campaign are quite unique and really exciting! An important added benefit of our Perks is that your contributions to this campaign are directly helping local Ghana artists, artisans and traders! 
Our top Perk will be the names of 5 top contributors engraved on a foundation stone at the site of the two stations! Future generations will be reminded of whose contributions made this power and water solution possible!!

This is our second Perk! It is totally hand crafted by local artists and artisans depicting individual scenes of Ghana. Each one is different and individual!

Third down the roll of honour are these totally hand made authentic drums made from local primary materials by craftsmen in rural Ghana. Try a real jungle beat with it, and who knows what you will summon!!

Beautifully handcrafted, these elephants have been carved from real ebony hardwood. Each elephant is unique and different! 

These embroidered shirts represent the colours of Ghana! Some carry the 'Kente' design that is the essence of Ghana. Just 9 special male shirts are offered as crafted by local shirt artisans of Accra, the capital city of Ghana!

The 'Black Stars' national team of Ghana are one the most successful international soccer teams in the world! They have appeared in all the FIFA Soccer World Cup Finals since 2006! Your chance to own a replica of the real World Cup shirt as worn by the 'Black Stars' international team of Ghana!

These Ghana Caps are made of really good quality cloth with embroidery in the national colours and carrying the national flag of Ghana!

A 'one-off' hand carved African Warrior!! Just the one folks!!!!

Unisex Headbands. These are handcrafted in using real "Kente" cloth of Ghana! All are Unisex in one size.

A variation on the 'Kente' headbands, these are in so many cheerful 'tie & dye' cloth colours of Ghana! All Unisex in one size.

These wrist bands come in the colours of Ghana! A reminder of your valuable contribution to the spirit of Ghana!

Individually handcrafted beaded wristbands! An unusual fashion must for a lady of any age!

A really cute and authentic Ghana drum key chain made with real materials! It even drums a bit!!!

Beautifully carved in the shape of Ghana out of real wood and in the colours of Ghana! Some bearing the tribal 'Adinkra' symbols of Ghana!

Small 'I love Ghana' cheerful plastic keychains bearing the colours of Ghana!

To show our gratitude for your valuable contribution, our entry level Perk is a special email saying 'Thank You'!
By claiming these Perks, you will be directly helping the small rural craftspeople of Ghana who rely on the sale of such items for their daily livelihoods. A massive 'Thank you' for your generosity!!

The Impact


An accurate assessment of the impact of your contribution cannot be estimated or quantified at this embryonic stage of this project. I sincerely believe that your success in making  'Nsuo-Kania' a reality will create a positive impact in empowering a small community that could inspire future generations and be replicated in all communities in Ghana. Empowerment is the very essence of this project, because you will be empowering a small community and "seeding" a project that is a template for the provision of clean renewable energy and essential water in the whole of the continent of Africa. The knock-on effects of using nature's power in the form of the Sun and the huge reserves of water held by the Atlantic Ocean will I believe offer inspiration and hope to the rest of the world's small communities that there is a better, cleaner, safer and reliable alternative form of energy and water. Your contribution together with my fulfilment of this project may well be the catalyst to empowering small communities to take control of their own destiny and solve problems that have haunted not only countries in Africa but the rest of the world as well. By supporting 'Nsuo-Kania', you will be making a statement to world that self-empowerment is better than doling out aid.

Risks & Challenges


Undertaking a practical project in any country in Africa poses problems, challenges and risks. There are risks of security, harsh landscape, poor roads and underdeveloped infrastructure to name but a few.
For a foreigner (I am a British citizen) such a project would be a herculean task. All of the above issues would have to be surmounted plus the most essential attribute required to undertake any venture successfully in Africa is to have an intimate and working knowledge of local customs, cultures, regional dialects and credibility amongst government bodies, for example Ghana CEPS (Customs). Without a proven working knowledge and track record of all of the above it is nigh impossible for a foreigner to succeed in any African country. 
I know Ghana inside out. I have lived and worked in the country and in the mining sector of the Central Region of Ghana. I have been in my community for 14 years and understand the motivation, psyche and mindset of the various tribes of Ghana, and none more than the Fante tribe that makes up the majority of Gomoah Nyanyano. 
I relish the opportunity and privilege to construct the power and water desalination station. To me the risks and challenges of this project are merely an invitation to plant a legacy for many generations to come.

I need YOUR help!


I would love to receive your contribution and send you one of our colourful perks! However, if you are unable to contribute financially, please help and get this message out to all your friends and colleagues through social media such as Twitter, Facebook, Whatsapp, Google Plus, Linkedin and any social media you know and use! Your word of mouth will make a world of difference!
Thank you so much for watching and reading! A massive 'Thank You' for your support!
story_txt:
Catastrophic power failures and poor water are 'SILENT KILLERS' in Ghana. Deaths in 2015 have reached epidemic levels. Help build a sustainable solar power and water desalination station, to bring reliable, inexpensive energy and clean water to thousands in need, on land we are providing.

My Background

I was born and brought up in Uganda during my early years. The biggest influence during my formative years was my father, a World War 2 British Army veteran who spent his career installing water supply in some of the remotest and poorest areas of the country as a water engineer. His drive, kindness, charity, generosity and sheer humanitarianism in changing the lives of the poor and needy to whom he supplied water have defined my inner character and values in life. 
I have run a business in Ghana for 14 years, operating at times under the harshest climatic conditions, devoid of power and water in remote mining areas amongst communities and people where life itself is at a premium. My community of Gomoah Nanyano in the Central Region of Ghana is a poor fishing village where daily lives skirt the very edge of subsistence survival. Their plight has focused my desire to make a life changing impact for them and future generations to come.
My mission with your help, is to bring about sustained solutions to not only power failures but also bring to an end, shortages in clean healthy water that continues to inflict cholera and dysentery on the people of Gomoah Nanyano.

The Campaign

Ghana as a whole has been gripped in a crisis of epidemic proportions over the past twelve months. "Dumsor Dumsor" (meaning on and off) electricity power outages last for 36 hours in a 48 hour cycle. This has become a daily reality and shows no sign of relenting given the deep rooted issues related to fundamental problems in the nation's electricity supply. Like the globally recognised diseases such as HIV AIDS and the deadly Ebola virus that have become synonymous with Africa, "Dumsor" has become a sinister silent killer in Ghana. 

DUMSOR CLAIMS 200+ LIVESTHE NEW STATESMAN	 05 JUNE 2015


The above is an image of fatal carnage caused by a chain reaction of a malfunctioning generator leading to a calamity resulting in 200 deaths in Accra, capital of Ghana. All due to a power outage. This is just one disaster documented in recent months. Deaths are occurring daily all over the nation with no sign abatement.
My community in Gomoah Nanyano has suffered its fair share of deep sorrow due in particular to power outages in clinics and maternity homes.

Because of Dumsor? Midwives deliver using cell phones, candlelight
Erratic power supply in Ghana has forced midwives to use flashlight to assist women in labour to deliver their babies.

story:
Hi There!

Please watch the video, :) 

My name is Lia, I’ve been working in the travel industry for 9 years and openly gay since I was 15. I often travel to new destinations, and I always try to research and find local gay spots to make me feel comfortable and connect with my community in the new destination.  But it’s frustrating because it takes so much time to find the right information, and it’s often out of date.  Also, traveling alone and going to these places can be extremely challenging.  There are language barriers, different modes of local transit, and it can be hard to connect with local people.

That's why I founded Guide Me Away.

I have created Guide Me Away as a positive and upbeat online platform to help LGBTQ travelers across the world network when they travel.  This is something I’ve wanted to do for years and have been working on for over 7 months BUT now I need your help to take this project live and spread the word.

Here are some important things to know. Thank you for continuing the reading.

Our Mission

Guide Me Away connects LGBTQ travelers with local LGBTQ guides/locals who share their interests and passions. We want you to save money when you travel, you will not be treated like a tourist, your local guide will have your back!

Not only saving you money, but time, and you get to see all the BEST locals spots, How awesome that will be right!?

Our Vision

We picture a flawless travel experience where connections are made, friendships are created, and being who you are is OK wherever you go.

We all love traveling, and enjoy the sense of freedom!

At Guide Me Away, we want to help you embrace your freedom and enjoy your travel experience.  We’ll help pair you up with a local LGBTQ local who shares your interests, and they can show you around, give you advice on great places to go, give you tips to enjoy your stay and information on what’s going on in the area. You get to visit all the cool spots the locals enjoy, explore important and exciting sites, relax in safe spaces, and tour— all without being a tourist!

How does it work?

With Guide Me Away, you create your own account; type which area you’ll be visiting, the dates you’ll be traveling, and what your interests are.  The online platform will show you all the LGBTQ locals/guides in the area who have similar interests and how much they charge so that you can get personalized attention and local guidance without dealing with large tours and tourist traps. 

And you can return the favour!   Sign up and be a tour guide yourself!

You can also sign up as a guide in your area, and set a fee to help travelers enjoy their visit to your area, each guide/local will be reviewed by the travelers, so we can all have the best experiences.

The Impact

This is a ground-breaking opportunity for singles, couples and families who travel and want to meet local residents.  It’s important to create safe and open connections for the global gay community. 

With all the amazing ways that LGBTQ people can connect, it will be a beautiful and magical world when Guide Me Away can help ensure that LGBTQ travelers are welcome everywhere we go.  We will be stronger if we band together, help protect our fellow travelers, connect our travel friends with other locals, and have fun being who we are no matter where we go!

What We Need

Guide Me Away is almost ready to launch.  And we’ll need to get the word out, but that’s not going to be easy.  

Our goal is to raise $25,000 or more.

We want to encourage you to give any amount; there is NO AMOUNT TOO SMALL!  Every little bit helps and gets us that much closer to our goal!  This money goes toward:

Start-up costs: design & branding, finishing the user interface, debugging the website, insurance, and initial marketing expenses to get the word out.

Development and maintenance: Outsourcing all the other things I can’t do alone. (The platform that we are working on for over 7 month was built from scratch!)

Marketing! While this site is going to have lots of Vancouver tours, I need to expand the reach so that everyone will know about the website!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’ve made a contribution, we are eternally grateful!  We also know that it takes many to build a community.  Please help us drum up more support:

Make some noise about our campaign!  Please get the word out: shareGuide Me Away’s campaign using Indiegogo’s share tools.

Be a part of our growing community and sign up at www.guidemeaway.com. You will be the first to be notified when our platform is released so you can create your profile and start enjoying our journey together. 

Tell us a story!  Create your own link to our campaign and tell the world what your perfect travel experience would be like!  Do you want a hunky eye-candy tour-guide, or a fun and funny rabble-rouser who will help you paint the town red with purple and rainbow colored polka-dots?  Are you looking for a couple with kids around your children’s age so that they have friends to play with at the amusement park?  Or is a socialite with all the right connections more your speed?  Make something up!  We won’t hold you to it.

Just say Hi! I want to know you- yes, you. Just drop a line, say you care and you think it’s a good idea. It will make my day!

Let's change the way we travel!​

What We Need

launch.  And we’ll need to get the word
out, but that’s not going to be easy.  
Our
goal is to raise $25,000 or more.
We
want to encourage you to give any amount; there is NO AMOUNT TOO
SMALL!  Every little bit helps and gets us that much closer to our
goal!  This money goes toward:
Start-up
costs: design & branding, finishing the user interface, debugging the
website, insurance, and initial marketing expenses to get the word out.
Development
and maintenance: Outsourcing all the other things I can’t do alone. (The
platform that we are working on for over 7 month was built from scratch!)
Marketing!
While this site is going to have lots of Vancouver tours, I need to expand the
reach so that everyone will know about the website!
Other Ways You Can Help
If
you’ve made a contribution, we are eternally grateful!  We also know that
it takes many to build a community.  Please help us drum up more support:
Make
some noise about our campaign!  Please get the word out: shareGuide
Me Away’s campaign using Indiegogo’s share tools.
Be
a part of our growing community and sign up at www.guidemeaway.com. You will be the first to
be notified when our platform is released so you can create your profile and
start enjoying our journey together. 
Tell
us a story!  Create your own link to our campaign and tell the world what
your perfect travel experience would be like!  Do you want a hunky
eye-candy tour-guide, or a fun and funny rabble-rouser who will help you paint
the town red with purple and rainbow colored polka-dots?  Are you looking
for a couple with kids around your children’s age so that they have friends to
play with at the amusement park?  Or is a socialite with all the right
connections more your speed?  Make something up!  We won’t hold you
to it.
Just say Hi! I want to know you- yes, you. Just drop a line, say you care and
you think it’s a good idea. It will make my day!
Let's change the way we travel!​

story:
Objective 

Our objective is to build a community centre for villagers, and particularly women, to use as a space for education and training, and for sharing of experiences.

In the villages of Wayanad district, women are usually financially dependent on male family members and are restricted to roles of caregiver and food gatherer. They also do not venture into public spaces or socialise much outside close family gatherings. Discrimination against women has further limited their access to education and financial independence.

At Rasta our target group has been women who have little or no access to education or who stopped studying due to personal or social factors. Towards this end we have already conducted for them group farming projects and taught them bamboo handicraft production, tailoring and designing clay ornaments.

However, these women often do not have a common meeting space to share their experiences. Also, the climate at Wayanad does not allow for regular outdoor training activities. This is where a community centre building will enable us to bring together all our activities under one roof and give these women and villagers a space to develop their skills.

At the community centre we want to provide training to women in vocational skills, which will help them augment their family income, be financially independent and go on to become confident members of the community. We want to create a space where we can train local women in skills that will improve their quality of life. They will be able to generate income and also support each other in building skills in leadership, resource management and entrepreneurship development.

For this dream to become a reality we need your help in completion of the building since the building is now half way through . Even a small financial contribution on your part will make a world of difference to our efforts. Once the infrastructure is in place, we can implement the projects that we already have in the pipeline.

Women in the area have already expressed eagerness to join our courses. Not only will they directly benefit from the skills, self-sufficiency and empowerment that comes with employment, but even their families will, in turn, be enabled to rise out of poverty. In a ripple effect, their well-being will pass on to the community.

__ __ __ __  ___ __ __ __ __  __ __ __ __  ___ __ __ __ __  __ __ __ __  ___ __ __ __ __ 

Proposed Activities

The proposed community centre will enable us to offer training in the areas of:

  • Gender sensitisation and leadership skills
  • Entrepreneurship
  • Umbrella making
  • Training in repairing of cell phones, refrigerators and mixer grinders
  • Organic soap making
  • Tailoring
  • Horticulture and marketing of produce
  • Compost making and building smokeless stove
  • Pottery, ornaments and candle making
  • Yoga and meditation for women.
  • Space to exhibit and sell various products
  • library reading center 

Structure of building   

Pictures of ground floor 

               



We need your support for

Flooring with tiles - $ 3814

30 windows with glasses  -  $ 1300

fixing  two door -  $303

Top portion covering -  $758 (If we raise money more than our budget we will use this money for top portion completion ) 

Painting windows from rusting - $152

                                         Total  -   6327 $  

If we raise more than the estimated budget , then we will be capable to complete the top floor which will enable women to stay at the campus while they learn various skills . 

About RASTA

Rural Agency for Social and Technological Advancement, or RASTA, is a not-for-profit development organisation operating in Wayanad district since 1987. ‘Rasta’ in the local language means ‘road.’ Our goal is to pave a road of social and economic development through the villages of Wayanad.

Wayanad was identified as one of ninety most backward districts of India by Government of India . Nearly 35 percent of the region is forest area and 17.5 percent of its population belong to tribal communities. Poverty, lack of education and unemployment are significant problems that plague the people of this region.

The communities we work with come from diverse backgrounds, from tribal groups to poor landless women and farmers.As the work started having an impact, we expanded our portfolio to cover projects on natural resource management, community based organisations such as self-help groups, tribal development and sustainable development.Our work focuses primarily on women as often, they are the immediate victims of limited employment opportunities and resultant poverty and health related issues. 

At Rasta our vision is to co-construct an egalitarian society based on equality through social, economic and organisational development of the small and marginal farmers, women, tribal communities and other weaker sections. We believe in the development of human resources, sustainable resource management, and dissemination of information and promotion of socially and ecologically appropriate technologies for the development of rural communities. 

web site : www.rastaindia.org 

Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/rasta.wayanad 

Youtube : https://www.youtube.com/user/RASTAWayanad

story:
The Plan to Overthrow Dhaba Patriarchy...

... by not just claiming public space, but owning it.

The problem: As women and sexual minorities in Karachi, we are constantly suffocated in male-dominated public space, and our access to streets and spaces of leisure is limited due to cultural norms and threats of safety.

Our pitch: We want to make a small dent in Karachi's male-dominated public space by setting up a dhaba (roadside tea-stall) within the next year -- a pocket of oxygen that is inclusive, safe and welcoming for women and minorities who just want to chill on the streets and have a (cheap) cup of chai.


About #GirlsAtDhabas

#girlsatdhabas is a community of women, feminists and activists who want to claim male-dominated spaces in our communities that are not traditionally "supposed" to be occupied by women and sexual minorities, or are considered inaccessible and hostile spaces for us.

 

After hanging out at dhabas having chai, chilling on sidewalks and engaging in similar 'scandalous' activities, we felt our own fears and cautions diminish, and a heightened sense of ease and ownership over our city. We began sharing our experiences with other women on social media through hashtags - #girlsatdhabas and #girslplayingstreetcricket - and hosted street cricket matches (typically unsual for women) in Karachi and Lahore. 

Receiving media coverage from Buzzfeed, BBC, NYTimes, and various Pakistani and Indian publications has helped us refine our mission and grow our initiative's visibility. 

#GirlsatDhabas in the press:

  • BuzzFeed: Here's why South Asian women are uploading photos of themselves at dhabas
  • BBC: How drinking tea became an act of female rebellion
  • NYTimes: Pakistani women use selfies to reclaim tea stalls (actually they're photos, NYT)
  • The Quint: Gender: Hang out with these girls at dhabas

#girlsatdhabas has received submissions and attention from across the subcontinent. We recently held a discussion about women & public space at a local university where ~150 students showed up. We recognize that the issue of women's access and visibility is close to many hearts, and now want to channel that energy into collective sustainable action.

                                        

                                        


Chai Chahiyay… Public mein janaab! / Claiming the str33ts

#DhabaForWomen is our dream for a safe and inclusive dhaba/tapri where women can just feel comfortable hanging out for long hours. Dhaba/chai culture in South Asia is male-dominated, and we want to encourage women to participate in it, and own it for themselves. 

            

We plan for this dhaba to serve as a resource base to run activities; host workshops, dialogues, and campaigns around gender and feminism; and facilitate women to come together and address issues of public space access and harassment.

           

[#girlsatdhabas dialogue at Institute of Business Administration, Karachi on women in public space]

Our goal of $10,000 will go towards renting a dhaba space, getting it up and running in 3 months, initial maintenance costs and providing transport and security for all staff.

  • Stage 1: Setting up the #DhabaForWomen

  • Stage 2: Turning the dhaba into a space that runs regular activities, workshops, dialogues and campaigns about women + gender + public space

  • Stage 3: Expanding leisure activities that tend to be male-dominated, such as starting a motorcycling club*

  • Stage 4: Making it a base-camp for women's rights advocates and activists

Every contribution will be valuable. 

*women rarely drive bikes in Karachi, and when we ride as passengers, we typically sit sideways because it is considered taboo for us to spread our legs.



You can help us by...

  • Donating $10 or above. 

  • Participting in #girlsatdhabas; send us your photos + stories

  • Hosting a gully cricket match in your neighbourhood + volunteering as a cricket coach

  • Donating old bicycles / motorcycles

  • Spreading word / ask your rich relatives pliss :)

Your contribution will create impact.

  • #dhabaforwomen will create employment for groups marginalized by gender and sexuality by hiring local female/khwajasira(trans*) staff & provide a physical safe space for leisure and activism

  • You will help us form a community for young feminists to come together and challenge gender norms on the streets. #dhabaforwomen will create a visual shift in women’s visibility, both in public and online through social media

  • Your contribution will enable us to collaborate with feminist groups in India and support each other's resistances by working together on issues shared by women/minorities on both sides of the border

  • Our work aims to inspire and encourage others to start similar initiatives, and engage with issues of everyday feminism in practical, new, and innovative ways


"Laikin log kya kahayn ge?"
                 “But what will random family members and strangers say?!”

While there are social stigmas around women’s presence in public spaces in Karachi, our group has not faced any strong reactions of disapproval yet. However, women’s safety and street harassment are legitimate concerns which we want to consider at every step of the way. We will open our dhaba in a familiar neighborhood, where our community members can feel safe and welcomed. We will provide amenities for our team such as transport and health. We are also connected with a network of feminists and professionals working for women's rights who will provide advice and support as needed. 

We want to facilitate women to re-think and re-navigate our relationships with their cities, and to own and define public spaces on our own terms and whims. You can help make this a reality by supporting #DhabaForWomen.
