story:
Be part of our story

Hi there! My name is Alexi Faraco and I'm the organizer of the "OPA! I support Greece" campaign! As a Greek American businessman I have grown tired of sitting on the sidelines watching, while the situation in Greece continues to deteriorate. We are rapidly approaching a humanitarian crisis in the country, so I have decided to take action.

Fueled by the ever growing voices from Greece and the diaspora, the "Opa! I Support Greece" campaign aspires to write a new chapter in the epic journey that has become Greece. Having offered us over 4,500 years of History, Culture and Democracy, Our story doesn’t end here today in crisis or with a return to the status quo. Our story will attempt to unite the global community to chart a future worthy of our shared past. Be part of our story.

Austerity is destroying average Greek’s standard of living

Greece has offered the world so much, and has a lot more to offer, but the average person in Greece is suffering now; with unemployment hovering around 50%, and a rapidly shrinking economy many families are at the point of having difficulty putting food on the table. While talk of billions and bailouts abounds, this means nothing to the average Greek; what they have to look forward to now is increased austerity, higher taxes and a greatly diminished standard of living.

Let’s make a difference

That’s why I have designed the "OPA! I Support Greece" campaign, to highlight a very few of the many wondrous products and services that come from Greece. We are offering a wide range of perks that will provide each generous donation at EVERY level with a maximum return for the money you donate. 

What is your goal, guys?

Although we have set a very low and realistic goal of $100,000, we would really like to see this campaign raise $1 million in the month that it will run, so we can make a meaningful difference for the Greek people. If we are successful we will continue with more campaigns that will continue to showcase much more of what Greece has to offer, and being able to keep helping those in need!

What about the perks? Who will they benefit?

Almost all perks are from small Greek family operated businesses that can showcase their products, and services which will help them survive, stay in business and to keep their employees. In many cases they have supplied us with below market value prices, or donated their goods to help as much as they can as well. What remains after these costs, will go 100% towards food coupons from the national supermarket chain Sklavenitis, to those Greeks that are unemployed (verified by their unemployment card, or have demonstrated their need to any other charitable organization or the Greek Church) Each 50 euro coupon can sustain a family of four for about a week.

Donate, help, get perks & enjoy what Greece has to offer!

So go ahead, I challenge you to support Greece, and you can have fun in doing so, because you will receive a taste, a drink or a souvenir from Greece, or maybe even an actual stay in Greece that you can cherish, all the while knowing that your contributions are helping people in dire need! Every perk level is very competitive and you will be getting all natural, locally sourced products from small family farms and businesses, that will do a world of good for them and the Greek people and YOU will be making a DIFFERENCE! 

What else can I do? Spread the word for the “Gyro Eating Challenge”!

At the very least you can accept our Gyro eating challenge! Eat a gyro for Greece and challenge those you know to support Greece by eating a gyro, and making a donation. We will upload ALL your videos here and on youtube, that you send us to: info@opaisupportgreece.com. We would like to see your videos come in from all corners of the world, no matter where you are! OPA! And Kali Orexei!

Is there anything else I can do to help you guys?

Yes, sure! We need you to spread the word around and become ambassadors of our vision and goal. Share our campaign on your social media, email it to your coworkers, friends and family, or whomever else you might think of!

Can you do that? This will be more than ok for us!

Every contribution helps; even for a postcard from Greece, but if you cannot and can help in any other way I would like to hear from you, do you have an interesting idea or suggestion? Let me know!

You can email me for whatever you want at info@opaisupportgreece.com and tell me what you can do!

Be part of our Story!

This campaign is been supported by the team of emarket.gr and Deals365.gr.

The Perks in Detail

- Greek Postcard sent from Greece ($4)

A traditional Greek postcard showcasing beautiful Greece! In various designs, sent from Greece with a handwritten message! 

- Two posters with Greek themes by ''Concept Art and Design'' ($7)

Designed exclusively for our campaign by the greek company ''Concept Art and Design''. In downloadable form in 3 sizes: Letter, Legal or 20 x 24 inches (poster).

- 1 Greek print T-shirt ($20) or 3 T-shirts for ($50) by ''Concept Art & Design''

Designed exclusively for our campaign by the greek company ''Concept Art and Design''. With a selection from funny sayings and designs. Select from the following: "Opa, I supported Greece'' in White or Black,  Minion ''Opa'' in White, Minion ''It's all greek to me'' in White, ''Get your greek on'' in White or Black, ''I trained with Greek Gods'' in White or Black, ''Geia mas''(cheers) in White or Black, ''We love greek honey'' in White or Black.

IMPORTANT:  After making your donation for the Perk of 1 or 3 t-shirts, please e-mail your choices of theme, colour and size to info@opaisupportgreece.com

- Hardcover Greek Recipe Notebook by ''Concept Art and Design'' ($11)

Designed exclusively for our campaign by the greek company ''Concept Art and Design''. A 100 page Hardcover notebook that also includes 8 of the most famous greek recipes. 

- Homemade Greek Pasta Package by Stavrodromi Zymarika ($10)

With many years of experience and secret old recipes passed down from generation to generation from the mountainous Arcadia, Stavrodromi Zymarika follows their passion for creating traditional homemade pasta.

The package includes:

1. Hilopites, 500gr (Egg Noodles). Ingredients: semolina, wheat flour, milk and eggs.

2. Trahanas, 500gr (Wheat Frumenty). Ingredients: semolina, wheat flour, milk.

3. Extra Thick Pasta, 500gr. Ingredients: semolina, wheat flour, milk and eggs.

- Extra Virgin Olive Oil 1L. by Vassilakis Estate ($19)

Since 1865, the Vassilakis family has produced extra virgin olive oil on their estate in the Mirabello region of Crete, one of the area’s first olive producers.

Their Charisma Extra Virgin Olive Oil (1L) is an all-purpose extra virgin olive oil for olive oil lovers and heavy users. This is a high quality, flavourful olive oil for everyday use. Use it for everything, including healthy cooking, since extra virgin olive oil retains its nutritional values even at high temperatures.

- Box of 24 Pasteli bars by KAPA Evmelin ($24)

The original 3,500 year old healthy energy bar! Known since Homeric times, it was a favorite snack with warriors for its natural energy boost, while ancient Greek athletes knew very well its nutritious ingredients enhanced their performance on and OFF the field.

Ever since 1924, Evridiki Papadopoulou & Co, has produced and packaged this well-known product from Zevgolatio-Messenia. The company now goes on producing the same, pure pasteli for the KAPA-Evmelin company.

The box includes 24 Pasteli bars (70gr. each) by the KAPA Evmelin company. Made from pure Greek honey and sesame seeds with no added sugar or gluten.

- Greek Marmelades Set (Apricot Marmelade and Orange marmalade) by Arodama ($16)


The family company Arodama, based on the island of Crete, creates each of their products inspired by family recipes based on the Cretan soil and Cretan traditions.

The Apricot marmalade has always been a breakfast favourite. Full of the flavour and scent of fresh apricots selected from the best varieties in Crete, Arodama Apricot Marmalade is rich in vitamin A, minerals and fibre, while the touch of natural lemon juice gives it a uniquely wonderful flavour. No added preservatives. 100% Natural

The Orange marmalade with lemon Verbena & Apple is a distinctive Arodama marmalade, made from an old Cretan family recipe. The combination of oranges and apples, enhanced by the lemon-scented herb, smells and tastes delicious, providing for a unique and wonderful breakfast dish. No added preservatives. 100% Natural

- Olive Paste with Thyme Honey 212ml set by Arodama ($23)

Their Olive Paste with Thyme Honey (set with 2 jars) is fragrant, intensely flavoured, an unusual tapenade made with genuine Cretan thyme honey that delightfully surprises even the strictest of connoisseurs! With its magically balanced combination of flavours, its savoury piquancy enhanced by just a hint of sweetness on the palate, Arodama Olive Paste with Honey is a delicacy which can be enjoyed daily in many delicious Mediterranean recipes. No added preservatives. 100% Natural.

- Greek Herbs, Honey & Recipes collection by Greek Horizons ($15)

The Greek Horizons company is based in Rethymno, Crete and is a rapidly growing company specializing in the selection, packaging and distribution of fine Greek products, working exclusively with small producers.

This special collection includes: Herb Mix for tzatziki (50gr), Herb Mix for Greek salad (20gr), Herb Mix for chicken (25gr), Herb Mix for fish (20gr), Greek oregano (20gr), Greek Honey (130gr) and a Greek cookbook with traditional recipes!

- Greek Olive Products Gift Box by Greek Horizons $17

This souvenir box includes: Greek Extra Virgin Olive Oil (250ml Tin Box), Greek Olives (100gr), Glass Towel, Small Porcelain plate.

In the photo, the towel pictured can come with a ''Greece'' embroidery or be plain. The porcelain might come in a different style and in white color.

- Greek Coffee with handmade boiling pot by Nektar ($18)


After years of traveling around the world and having gained extensive experience in coffee production, G.Neofotistos founded Nektar company in 1951. Since then and until now, Nektar remains a family-owned, operated business, exclusively specialized in the production of top quality Greek coffee blends with an expanded product range. The coffee is made in Greece at the production unit in Mycenae. With the same greek coffee recipe since 1951, the Nektar Greek coffee is an award winning product both domestically and internationally!

Their Fresh-roasted Greek Coffee (200gr.) is selected from the world's finest varieties and comes with a handmade coffee boiling pot, so you can enjoy fresh made greek coffee every morning! The coffee pot is handmade and packaged by hand. Instructions in English are written on the package. 

- Natural Health Care package by Bioaroma ($22)

Bioaroma company is an inspiration from the vast history and heritage that surrounds the land of Crete. 100% natural herbal cosmetics based on research and archaeological finds that have been passed down from generation to generation. With no chemical preservatives, so natural...you can eat them!

The Natural Health Care package includes:

1. Bioaroma Beeswax ointment for skin problems (40ml): Traditional cretan ointment with olive oil and essential oils of dittany of Crete, chamomile and lavender.

2. Bioaroma Aloe Vera Gel with Lavender essential oil (40ml): Suitable for deep hydration, burns and insects. External use only.

3. Bioaroma Cypress Essential Oil (5ml): For calming your senses or as a massage oil to relieve asthma, cramps, broken skin or varicose veins.

- Natural Face Botox package by Bioaroma ($32)

The Natural Face Botox package by BioAroma includes:

1. 24h Face Cream with intensive anti-aging, firming action (40ml): Precious beeswax enriched with Cistus extract, a herb known since ancient times for its anti-aging action and other unique 100% natural ingredients, to improve and regenerate the skin's elasticity.

2. Anti-Aging Serum with Aloe Vera gel (30ml): With Aloe Vera gel, dittany, labdanum and wild rose extract, all from the rich nature of Crete.

- Ouzo set with bottle (0.7L) and 2 ouzo glasses by Giokarinis ($40)

In 1910, Heleni Giokarini established the first ouzo-distillery in Samos. Ouzo Giokarini is still being produced with the same traditional way for three generations. The experience of a century, combined with the careful selection of pure ingredients result in its superb quality.

The set includes: Ouzo Giokarini bottle (0.7L) with 2 ouzo glasses.

- Virgin Mary and Jesus Christ Folding Icon by Silver Axion ($45)

Silver Axion is an Athens based company that specializes in Byzantine Iconography.  Their designers, painters and craftsmen work with respect and love for the Byzantine tradition, combining traditional craftsmanship with modern technology. Using canvas, wood and silver they produce exact copies of great detail and exquisite artistic value.

This Virgin Mary and Jesus Christ double folding icon is from the Classic Series of the Silver Axion company. Made out of cherry wood and real silver. With wooden base. Dimensions: 95x80mm

- Virgin Mary Icon by Silver Axion ($100)

This rare, haunting image of Mary with the swords is associated with the prophecy of St. Simeon. It refers to the pain felt by Mary at the time of separation from her beloved Son, when He was crucified. It is believed by many to be miraculous.

The icon is from the Classic Series and is made out of cherry wood and real silver. With hanging hook. Dimensions: 200x250mm

- Handmade Gold Necklace by Kouzoupis jewelry ($430)

The Athenian company "Kouzoupis S.A" creates unique jewelry with references to the various periods of the Hellenic history. Hand made by committed and highly experienced craftsmen, the firm's goal is to safeguard and transfer to the future the historical tradition of the Hellenic jewelry.

Select one from 3 designs:

1. Necklace with an oval gold pendant in a white meander design from the Symbols Collection, Hand Made, Gold K18 2.80grm.

2. Necklace with a round pendant in a star gold/black design from the Symbols Collection. Hand Made, Gold K18 3.80grm.

3. Necklace with an oval gold pendant in a black / gold meander design from the Symbols Collection. Hand Made, Gold K18 5.00grm

IMPORTANT:  After making your donation for the Perk, please e-mail your choice of theme (1, 2 or 3), to info@opaisupportgreece.com


- An 8 days stay at the Athens Ledra Hotel ($1500)

A dreamy 8 days (7 nights) stay for 2 people at the 5 star "Athens Ledra Hotel", that boasts a rooftop, seasonal pool and bar with stunning views over the Acropolis!

The 7 nights stay for 2 people also includes:

- American breakfast during your stay at Zephyros restaurant (including tax.)

- Οne visit for 2 people to the Acropolis museum

- Οne Athens City Tour for 2 people during your stay
story_txt:
Be part of our story
Hi there! My name is Alexi Faraco and I'm the organizer of the "OPA! I support Greece" campaign! As a Greek American businessman I have grown tired of sitting on the sidelines watching, while the situation in Greece continues to deteriorate. We are rapidly approaching a humanitarian crisis in the country, so I have decided to take action.Fueled by the ever growing voices from Greece and the diaspora, the "Opa! I Support Greece" campaign aspires to write a new chapter in the epic journey that has become Greece. Having offered us over 4,500 years of History, Culture and Democracy, Our story doesn’t end here today in crisis or with a return to the status quo. Our story will attempt to unite the global community to chart a future worthy of our shared past. Be part of our story.Austerity is destroying average
Greek’s standard of living
Greece has offered the world so much, and has a lot more to offer, but the average person in Greece is suffering now; with unemployment hovering around 50%, and a rapidly shrinking economy many families are at the point of having difficulty putting food on the table. While talk of billions and bailouts abounds, this means nothing to the average Greek; what they have to look forward to now is increased austerity, higher taxes and a greatly diminished standard of living.Let’s make a differenceThat’s why I have designed the "OPA! I Support Greece" campaign, to highlight a very few of the many wondrous products and services that come from Greece. We are offering a wide range of perks that will provide each generous donation at EVERY level with a maximum return for the money you donate. What is your goal, guys?Although we have set a very low and realistic goal of $100,000, we would really like to see this campaign raise $1 million in the month that it will run, so we can make a meaningful difference for the Greek people. If we are successful we will continue with more campaigns that will continue to showcase much more of what Greece has to offer, and being able to keep helping those in need!What about the perks? Who will they benefit?Almost all perks are from small Greek family operated businesses that can showcase their products, and services which will help them survive, stay in business and to keep their employees. In many cases they have supplied us with below market value prices, or donated their goods to help as much as they can as well. What remains after these costs, will go 100% towards food coupons from the national supermarket chain Sklavenitis, to those Greeks that are unemployed (verified by their unemployment card, or have demonstrated their need to any other charitable organization or the Greek Church) Each 50 euro coupon can sustain a family of four for about a week.Donate, help, get perks & enjoy what Greece has to offer!So go ahead, I challenge you to support Greece, and you can have fun in doing so, because you will receive a taste, a drink or a souvenir from Greece, or maybe even an actual stay in Greece that you can cherish, all the while knowing that your contributions are helping people in dire need! Every perk level is very competitive and you will be getting all natural, locally sourced products from small family farms and businesses, that will do a world of good for them and the Greek people and YOU will be making a DIFFERENCE! What else can I do? Spread the word for the “Gyro Eating Challenge”!At the very least you can accept our Gyro eating challenge! Eat a gyro for Greece and challenge those you know to support Greece by eating a gyro, and making a donation. We will upload ALL your videos here and on youtube, that you send us to: info@opaisupportgreece.com. We would like to see your videos come in from all corners of the world, no matter where you are! OPA! And Kali Orexei!Is there anything else I can do to help you guys?Yes, sure! We need you to spread the word around and become ambassadors of our vision and goal. Share our campaign on your social media, email it to your coworkers, friends and family, or whomever else you might think of!
Can you do that? This will be more than ok for us!Every contribution helps; even for a postcard from Greece, but if you cannot and can help in any other way I would like to hear from you, do you have an interesting idea or suggestion? Let me know!
You can email me for whatever you want at info@opaisupportgreece.com and tell me what you can do!
Be part of our Story!
This campaign is been supported by the team of emarket.gr and Deals365.gr.The Perks in Detail- Greek Postcard sent from Greece ($4)A traditional Greek postcard showcasing beautiful Greece! In various designs, sent from Greece with a handwritten message! - Two posters with Greek themes by ''Concept Art and Design'' ($7)Designed exclusively for our campaign by the greek company ''Concept Art and Design''. In downloadable form in 3 sizes: Letter, Legal or 20 x 24 inches (poster).- 1 Greek print T-shirt ($20) or 3 T-shirts for ($50) by ''Concept Art & Design''Designed exclusively for our campaign by the greek company ''Concept Art and Design''. With a selection from funny sayings and designs. Select from the following: "Opa, I supported Greece'' in White or Black,  Minion ''Opa'' in White, Minion ''It's all greek to me'' in White, ''Get your greek on'' in White or Black, ''I trained with Greek Gods'' in White or Black, ''Geia mas''(cheers) in White or Black, ''We love greek honey'' in White or Black.IMPORTANT:  After making your donation for the Perk of 1 or 3 t-shirts, please e-mail your choices of theme, colour and size to info@opaisupportgreece.com

- Hardcover Greek Recipe Notebook by ''Concept Art and Design'' ($11)Designed exclusively for our campaign by the greek company ''Concept Art and Design''. A 100 page Hardcover notebook that also includes 8 of the most famous greek recipes. - Homemade Greek Pasta Package by Stavrodromi Zymarika ($10)With many years of experience and secret old recipes passed down from generation to generation from the mountainous Arcadia, Stavrodromi Zymarika follows their passion for creating traditional homemade pasta.The package includes:1. Hilopites, 500gr (Egg Noodles). Ingredients: semolina, wheat flour, milk and eggs.2. Trahanas, 500gr (Wheat Frumenty). Ingredients: semolina, wheat flour, milk.3. Extra Thick Pasta, 500gr. Ingredients: semolina, wheat flour, milk and eggs.- Extra Virgin Olive Oil 1L. by Vassilakis Estate ($19)Since 1865, the Vassilakis family has produced extra
virgin olive oil on their estate in the Mirabello region of Crete, one of the
area’s first olive producers. 
Their Charisma Extra
Virgin Olive Oil (1L) is an all-purpose extra virgin olive oil for olive oil
lovers and heavy users. This is a high quality, flavourful olive oil for
everyday use. Use it for everything, including healthy cooking, since extra
virgin olive oil retains its nutritional values even at high temperatures.- Box of 24 Pasteli bars by KAPA Evmelin ($24)The original 3,500 year old healthy energy bar! Known since Homeric times, it was a favorite snack with warriors for its natural energy boost, while ancient Greek athletes knew very well its nutritious ingredients enhanced their performance on and OFF the field.Ever since 1924, Evridiki Papadopoulou & Co, has produced and packaged this well-known product from Zevgolatio-Messenia. The company now goes on producing the same, pure pasteli for the KAPA-Evmelin company.The box includes 24 Pasteli bars (70gr. each) by the KAPA Evmelin company. Made from pure Greek honey and sesame seeds with no added sugar or gluten.- Greek Marmelades Set (Apricot Marmelade and Orange marmalade) by Arodama ($16) The family company Arodama, based on the island of Crete, creates each of their products inspired by family recipes based on the Cretan soil and Cretan traditions.The Apricot marmalade has always been a breakfast favourite. Full of the flavour and scent of fresh apricots selected from the best varieties in Crete, Arodama Apricot Marmalade is rich in vitamin A, minerals and fibre, while the touch of natural lemon juice gives it a uniquely wonderful flavour. No added preservatives. 100% NaturalThe Orange marmalade with lemon Verbena & Apple is a distinctive Arodama marmalade, made from an old Cretan family recipe. The combination of oranges and apples, enhanced by the lemon-scented herb, smells and tastes delicious, providing for a unique and wonderful breakfast dish. No added preservatives. 100% Natural- Olive Paste with Thyme Honey 212ml set by Arodama ($23)Their Olive Paste with Thyme Honey (set with 2 jars) is fragrant, intensely flavoured, an unusual tapenade made with genuine Cretan thyme honey that delightfully surprises even the strictest of connoisseurs! With its magically balanced combination of flavours, its savoury piquancy enhanced by just a hint of sweetness on the palate, Arodama Olive Paste with Honey is a delicacy which can be enjoyed daily in many delicious Mediterranean recipes. No added preservatives. 100% Natural.- Greek Herbs, Honey & Recipes collection by Greek Horizons ($15)The Greek Horizons company is based in Rethymno, Crete and is a rapidly growing company specializing in the selection, packaging and distribution of fine Greek products, working exclusively with small producers.This special collection includes: Herb Mix for tzatziki (50gr), Herb Mix for Greek salad (20gr), Herb Mix for chicken (25gr), Herb Mix for fish (20gr), Greek oregano (20gr), Greek Honey (130gr) and a Greek cookbook with traditional recipes!- Greek Olive Products Gift Box by Greek Horizons $17This souvenir box includes: Greek Extra Virgin Olive Oil (250ml Tin Box), Greek Olives (100gr), Glass Towel, Small Porcelain plate.In the photo, the towel pictured can come with a ''Greece'' embroidery or be plain. The porcelain might come in a different style and in white color.- Greek Coffee with handmade boiling pot by Nektar ($18)After years of traveling around the world and having gained extensive experience in coffee production, G.Neofotistos founded Nektar company in 1951. Since then and until now, Nektar remains a family-owned, operated business, exclusively specialized in the production of top quality Greek coffee blends with an expanded product range. The coffee is made in Greece at the production unit in Mycenae. story:
The Short Story

We are making a free computer program to streamline the collection of measurements from images that could have applications in ecology research, citizen science, conservation, monitoring for invasive pests, and education. Please consider backing us so that we can create this very useful software.

The Full Story

At the University of Florida Honey Bee Research and Extension Lab (UF HBREL), we are all about pushing the boundaries of knowledge in our field and making scientific discovery accessible to the public. We believe that by backing this project, you will be helping us do just that!

My name is Tomas Bustamante. I have been working in the UF honey bee lab for three years as a volunteer, lab technician and masters student. In order to complete my masters thesis, I designed a series of computer programs that our research team used to measure different physical characteristics of honey bees from images quickly and easily. Now we want to take those programs and integrate their features while adding significantly more features. This will allow us to create a single, intuitive application that can be used by professional researchers and citizen scientists alike.

"Measuring things in pictures? That sounds like something that other programs already do.” You are right - in a way. There are other,  pretty neat, general-purpose scientific software packages, such as ImageJ, that allow the user to measure the length, angles or other types of features in an image. Our project draws much of its inspiration from programs such as that. What distinguishes MorphoMetric from other software options is that it will be designed to be accessible enough for citizen scientists to use while also being robust enough for the high-throughput data collection and management that professional research demands.

Even though this effort is starting in a honey bee lab, MorphoMetric has the potential to help a lot of different people working with all types of organisms. Somewhere, right now, there is an undergraduate student who needs to design a good research project in order to graduate with honors, a beekeeper who needs to do a research project to become a master beekeeper, and a hobbyist scientist who is wondering how similar that population of beetles she collected while visiting her relatives are to those in her back yard. There is also a high school science teacher who is trying to teach his students the basics of insect anatomy and a scientist who is trying to develop a method to monitor certain subspecies of invasive insects (that was me!). MorphoMetric will be useful to these types of individuals and even more! 

Perhaps none of those people have the money for a microscope. However, the hardware needed for microscopy has become so accessible that anyone easily can make their own microscope at home. I think that it is about time for the software to catch up.

Design Principals and Core Features

The following design principals are the ideals around which MorphoMetric will be built. I also list a few example core features that will be a part of the program. 

  • Versatile -   The user will be able to measure the following parameters using the software: length, angles, percent pigmentation of a defined area, coordinate point, count data, area, curvature, perimeter, and more! The user will be able to customize his/her software for each project so that they do not have to waste time sifting through features they are not going to use.
  • Intuitive - There are a lot of software packages used in research today that are not intuitive or easy to learn. This will not be the case for MorphoMetric. The software will be designed so that anyone, whether scientist or school student, can use it without fighting a steep learning curve.  Many tasks will feel natural with just one or two clicks and more complicated tasks will be accompanied by menu-wizards that guide new users.
  • Accessible - A lot of software used in research is very difficult for new or non-professionals to use. MorphoMetric will be created with the citizen scientist in mind. This includes, among other things, making it work with a diverse set of image formats and exporting data in common, everyday file formats that do not require specialized software with which to work. MorphoMetric also will be accessible through the Honey Bee Research and Extension Lab website and written in Java so that it will be compatible with many different computer operating systems.

  • Project-Orientated - MorphoMetric will be structured in such a way that it helps researchers, whether professional or hobbyists, organize their projects. Each project will have its own data, settings, and design details so that people running multiple projects can manage them with ease.
  • Teamwork - I had the pleasure of working with a great team of people during my time as a masters student. One challenge, however, was keeping the team organized as they collected data. MorphoMetric will internally organize the images that are being analyzed and by whom so that teammates are not getting in one another’s way or accidentally taking redundant measurements.
  • Sharing - Sharing ideas, project designs and data is a big deal in the academic world. MorphoMetric will make sharing easy. It also will include options for storing data on externally accessible database servers so that collaborators and teams can work together even across long distances. Project templates also will let users share their entire project design with others, letting them more easily follow along with, repeat or add to their work.

Miscellaneous Features

  • Automatic Calibration - Many of the newer microscope/camera systems save magnification and image resolution data with the images taken. MorphoMetric will be able to read this information on supported systems automatically and calibrate itself for taking the most precise measurements. This feature saved our team time and helped us avoid the potential for significant error with data accumulation in my research. Simple two-click manual calibration will remain available for individuals not using a new microscope/image capture system.
  • Automatic Sorting - A common problem shared by many microscope/camera systems is that they save all of their images into a single folder, leaving you to sort through them manually and associate them with the correct specimens. MorphoMetric will have configurable auto-sorting that will let you sort your images with ease.
  • Crowdsourcing Tools (Tentative) - Many researchers do not have the budgets or lab space necessary to harbor the teams needed to complete large-scale morphometric projects. MorphoMetric will include tools that will let these researchers coordinate with the communities that support them or even let citizen scientists within these communities design their own projects to implement.

Time and Money

Costs - Fortunately, we have many resources available for our use at the University of Florida. We mainly lack sufficient funds to cover the labor costs associated with developing the software. Our financial needs include costs for:

  • designing and programming new features,
  • integrating features present in the prototype into the new design,
  • testing, modifying, and retesting to make sure the final product matches all of the design principals, and

Timetable - The project will last for six months if funded fully. I include below a tentative project outline. Be sure to check back for updates to the schedule.

  • Month 1: Planning and building the background software architecture.
  • Month 2: Most of the basic elements (different measurements types, handling images, saving data, basic user interface, etc.) will be programmed this month.  
  • Months 3 and 4: In the third and fourth months, we will finish developing the basic element, fix associated bugs, and work on developing the supporting features (database support, organizing teams, making project templates, etc.).
  • Months 5 and 6:  The final two months are all about polishing the final product. There will be additional bugs to fix, help documentation to create, etc.  

Underfunding - If we fail to reach our full funding goal, we will develop as much of the software package as possible, but possibly omit some less necessary features.  

Overfunding and Extra Time - If the project receives more funding than needed to develop the envisioned software, we will add more features and work with a design team to increase the product’s aesthetics. A version of MorphoMetric will be released at or around the 6 month mark, and new versions will be made available as new features are added with the extra funding. 

Perks

Everyone likes perks so here are some of the cool things that you might get for contributing to the project. We tried to choose things that would otherwise be difficult to get and would be exciting for science and nature lovers alike:

  • Receive an official UF HBREL medium nuc, hive cover and bottom board. Put it in your office or outfit a colony with it to let all of your friends know that you support scientific research at the honey bee lab!
  • Have your name in the software credits or on the UF HBREL website as a sponsor.
  • Participate in online streams and live chats for brainstorming and design sessions.
  • Get a special talk for your local bee club, association, or school group that is reserved just for supporters of this project.
  • Get a first look at some of the research that was achieved using the prototype software.
  • Receive an awesome poster displaying the more beautiful specimens that we have photographed using our microscope.
  • Be invited to hang out with the team at the UF HBREL for a day and get your own personal guided session with our microscope.

Impact

MorphoMetric is a project that has the potential to help many different groups of people. Here are some of the things it could facilitate: 

  • Faster Research! - The prototype for MorphoMetric was developed while conducting my thesis research. It was extremely useful for collecting all of the data in an accurate and timely manner. We believe that by focusing on the features that made the prototype fast and easy to use for my team, we can make a program that will help other research teams similarly!
  • Make Education Easy! - As a student, I found that one of the most challenging things about doing science was learning the ins and outs of all of the different tools available to conduct research. We believe that by focusing on making new tools that are designed to be intuitive and easy to teach, we can give other students more time to learn the scientific concepts they really need to know without having to work against a technological learning curve.
  • Identifying and Monitoring Invasive Pests- I have had the opportunity to work with the Florida Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services Apiary Inspection Team over the years, observing the techniques that they use to monitor for Africanized honey bees. Integrating MorphoMetric into their current system would cut down the time that it takes to identify and monitor these and possibly other invasive pests.
  • Citizen Science! - Everyone at the UF HBREL is a huge advocate of citizen science projects.  One of our goals is to make MorphoMetric easy enough to use that anyone can pick it up and begin using it right away.
  • Save The Bees! - While this project has the potential to benefit a lot of different people, we are still honey bee scientists at heart. We want to be able to continue our work studying honey bee populations, whether wild or domesticated, and we believe that having this tool will help us do that. Please help us save the bees!

Risk Assessment

There are risks inherent to donating to any project. Here are some of the ways that we will address the risks associated with this project:

  • Security - Giving support to crowdfunded projects is a great way to help new ideas become reality, but we have all heard the horror stories of people running off with other people's money without attempting to complete their projects. That is not going to happen here. The funds received will be deposited directly into an account maintained for the UF HBREL by the UF Department of Entomology and Nematology. This means that no one other than the principal investigator can have access to the funds.
  • Accountability - I believe it is important to be held accountable by people with greater experience and authority so that the project goals can be met.  I will be supervised by associate professor of entomology Dr. Jamie Ellis. Dr. Ellis has managed hundreds of research projects with many people in the past.
  • Experience - The previous project on which I worked for my thesis requirements had a larger budget and more people working on it than will this project. The experienced I gained managing a large project makes me confident that I can see this project through to conclusion.
  • Technical Skills - Keeping this project in-house instead of contracting with a software company will save on costs. My undergraduate and graduate training front load me with the technical experience needed to complete the project.
  • Release Date - The goal is to complete the project 6 months after receiving the funding in full. We will keep everyone informed about the process as things develop.

More About Me

I am currently a master's student in the HBREL at the University of Florida. I grew up in Orlando and moved to Gainesville attend college. I have always had a love for the natural world, and I developed a love of technology as I grew older. I was not able to choose between the two for my formal education, so I pursued and received my undergraduate degree in zoology with a minor in computer science.  

I got involved with the UF HBREL as a volunteer after taking a beekeeping course in the last semester of my undergraduate coursework. Following this, I was hired as a lab technician and accepted as a graduate student in 2013. I have been involved in some great extension programs at the lab, which, among other things, have made me especially interested in making science more accessible to the general public. I believe that making better and easier-to-use technologies, such as MorphoMetric, is one important way of accomplishing this goal. It also helps knowing that the software will make it easier for scientists to progress in their own research as well. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We need your help to spread the word about MorphoMetric. Please share MorphoMetric with your friends and families. Share the link for this page on your facebook page, twitter and Instagram feeds, social blogs, the forum of your favorite webcomic, etc. Indiegogo apparently has it's own sharing tools. You can also:

  • Check out our lab's Facebook.
  • Give us a shout-out on Twitter.
  • Follow our Instagram and request more cool microscope images.

Frequently Asked Questions

  1. What is MorphoMetric exactly?
    MorphoMetric is a computer program that can be used to take measurements of anatomical features imaged using a microscope.

  2. Who is the intended user of MorphoMetric?
    MorphoMetric is for science hobbyists, professional researchers, students, teachers and citizen scientists. Really, it is for just about anyone with an interest in doing science that requires them to take physical measurements.

  3. Who are you?
    I am a student at the UF HBREL with a love for the biological sciences and technology. You can see my picture of me before I grew a beard on our website.

  4. Aren't you a honey bee lab? This isn't a project about honey bees. Why are you doing this?
    I have a passion for making science more accessible to everyone. Plus, after much consideration, our lab team thought that the software would be useful to other researchers trying to overcome some of the challenges we faced. That includes other researchers who are working with honey bees or just about any other type of organism!

  5. I am sure your lab is conducting other bigger-budget projects. Why can't you pay for the project yourself?
    The way university labs work is that resources from grants or donations are allocated to a specific project and cannot be used to support other projects. There are some general-purpose resources that are an exception to this, because they are provided by the university itself, for example lab space, common-use computers, office space, chairs, etc. However, most things, such as money or labor, can only be used for the projects designated by the sponsor. This is good because it means that funding never goes to a project that it was not intended to support. However, it also means that we need to ask for more funding whenever we want to do a new project.

  6. What is the deal with this prototype that you keep mentioning?
    I made a prototype of MorphoMetric in order to complete my research for my master's thesis in entomology. It is very simple and does not include half of the features that I envision including in the final version; but it exists. Here is a link to a short video of it.

  7. Why are there pictures of insects all over this page?
    I thought that the campaign page could use some decoration to break up the wall of text. What better way to do this than with stunning examples of the beauty that we get to see using our microscope?

  8. Did you really build a microscope out of your cell phone and stuff from the hardware store?
    Yeah! It is pretty cool. I keep it at my desk and play around with it every once in a while. There are so many common place things that are really awesome when you look at them up close.

  9. What if I have more questions or even suggestions?
    You can email me directly at g4spar@ufl.edu with any questions, suggestions or concerns. Please do not hesitate to email me about the project. Hearing from you will help me make better decisions about the campaign and the project in general.

Credits:
  • Photos by UF Honey Bee Research and Extension Laboratory and by Jon Bremer at the Florida Natural History Museum
  • This is a campaign by the University of Florida Honey Bee Research and Extension Laboratory (UF HBREL). All funding will go directly to the lab.
story_txt:
The Short StoryWe are making a free computer program to streamline the collection of measurements from images that could have applications in ecology research, citizen science, conservation, monitoring for invasive pests, and education. Please consider backing us so that we can create this very useful software.
The Full Story
At the University of Florida Honey Bee Research and Extension Lab (UF HBREL),
we are all about pushing the boundaries of knowledge in our field and making
scientific discovery accessible to the public. We believe that by backing this
project, you will be helping us do just that!

My name is Tomas Bustamante. I have been working in
the UF honey bee lab for three years as a volunteer, lab technician and masters
student. In order to complete my masters thesis, I designed a series of
computer programs that our research team used to measure different physical
characteristics of honey bees from images quickly and easily. Now we want to
take those programs and integrate their features while adding significantly
more features. This will allow us to create a single, intuitive application
that can be used by professional researchers and citizen scientists alike.
"Measuring things in pictures?
That sounds like something that other programs already do.” You are right - in a way. There are other,  pretty neat, general-purpose scientific
software packages, such as ImageJ, that
allow the user to measure the length, angles or other types of features in an
image. Our project draws much of its inspiration from programs such as that.
What distinguishes MorphoMetric from
other software options is that it will be designed to be accessible enough for
citizen scientists to use while also being robust enough for the
high-throughput data collection and management that professional research
demands.
Even though this effort is starting in
a honey bee lab, MorphoMetric has the
potential to help a lot of different people working with all types of organisms.
Somewhere, right now, there is an undergraduate student who needs to design a
good research project in order to graduate with honors, a beekeeper who needs
to do a research project to become a master beekeeper, and a hobbyist scientist who is wondering how
similar that population of beetles she collected while visiting her relatives
are to those in her back yard. There is also a high school science teacher who is
trying to teach his students the basics of insect anatomy and a scientist who
is trying to develop a method to monitor certain subspecies of invasive insects
(that was me!). MorphoMetric will be
useful to these types of individuals and even more! 
Perhaps none of those people have the money for
a microscope. However,
the hardware needed for microscopy has become so accessible that anyone easily can make their
own microscope at home. I
think that it is about time for the software to catch up.

Design Principals and Core Features

The following design principals are
the ideals around which MorphoMetric
will be built. I also list a few example core features that will be a part of
the program.  


Versatile - 
      The user will be able to
     measure the following parameters using the software: length, angles,
     percent pigmentation of a defined area, coordinate point, count data, area,
     curvature, perimeter, and more! The user will be able to customize his/her
     software for each project so that they do not have to waste time sifting
     through features they are not going to use. 

Intuitive - There are a lot of software packages used
     in research today that are not intuitive or easy to learn. This will not
     be the case for MorphoMetric. The
     software will be designed so that anyone, whether scientist or school
     student, can use it without fighting a steep learning curve.  Many tasks will feel natural with just
     one or two clicks and more complicated tasks will be accompanied by
     menu-wizards that guide new users. 

Accessible - A lot of software used in research is
     very difficult for new or non-professionals to use. MorphoMetric will be created with
     the citizen scientist in mind. This includes, among other things,
     making it work with a diverse set of image formats and exporting data in
     common, everyday file formats that do not require specialized software with
     which to work. MorphoMetric also
     will be accessible through the Honey Bee Research and Extension Lab
     website and written in Java so that it will be compatible with many
     different computer operating systems.






Project-Orientated - MorphoMetric will be structured in such a way that it helps researchers, whether professional or hobbyists, organize their projects. Each project will have its own data, settings, and design details so that people running multiple projects can manage them with ease.

Teamwork - I had the pleasure of working with a great team of people during my time as a masters student. One challenge, however, was keeping the team organized as they collected data. MorphoMetric will internally organize the images that are being analyzed and by whom so that teammates are not getting in one another’s way or accidentally taking redundant measurements.

Sharing - Sharing ideas, project designs and data is a big deal in the academic
world. MorphoMetric will make sharing
easy. It also will include options for storing data on externally accessible
database servers so that collaborators and teams can work together even across
long distances. Project templates also will let users share their entire
project design with others, letting them more easily follow along with, repeat
or add to their work.



Miscellaneous Features





Automatic
     Calibration - Many of the newer microscope/camera systems save
     magnification and image resolution data with the images taken. MorphoMetric will be able to read
     this information on supported systems automatically and calibrate itself
     for taking the most precise measurements. This feature saved our team time
     and helped us avoid the potential for significant error with data
     accumulation in my research. Simple two-click manual calibration will remain
     available for individuals not using a new microscope/image capture system.
     

Automatic
     Sorting - A common problem shared by many microscope/camera
     systems is that they save all of their images into a single folder,
     leaving you to sort through them manually and associate them with the
     correct specimens. MorphoMetric
     will have configurable auto-sorting that will let you sort your images
     with ease.

Crowdsourcing Tools (Tentative) - Many researchers do not have the budgets or
lab space necessary to harbor the teams needed to complete large-scale
morphometric projects. MorphoMetric
will include tools that will let these researchers coordinate with the
communities that support them or even let citizen scientists within these
communities design their own projects to implement.



Time and Money 
Costs - Fortunately, we have many resources available for our use at the University
of Florida. We mainly lack sufficient funds to cover the labor costs associated
with developing the software. Our financial needs include costs for:

designing
     and programming new features, 
integrating
     features present in the prototype into the new design, 
testing,
     modifying, and retesting to make sure the final product matches all of the
     design principals, and



Timetable - The project will last for six months if funded fully. I
include below a tentative project outline. Be sure to check back for updates to
the schedule.


Month
     1: Planning and building the background software
     architecture. 

Month
     2: Most of the basic elements (different
     measurements types, handling images, saving data, basic user interface,
     etc.) will be programmed this month.  

Months
     3 and 4: In the third and fourth months, we will
     finish developing the basic element, fix associated bugs, and work on
     developing the supporting features (database support, organizing teams,
     making project templates, etc.). 

Months
     5 and 6:  The final two months are all about
     polishing the final product. There will be additional bugs to fix, help
     documentation to create, etc.  




Underfunding - If we fail to reach our full funding goal, we will develop as much
of the software package as possible, but possibly omit some less necessary
features.  
Overfunding and Extra Time - If the project
receives more funding than needed to develop the envisioned software, we will
add more features and work with a design team to increase the product’s
aesthetics. A version of MorphoMetric
will be released at or around the 6 month mark, and new versions will be made
available as new features are added with the extra funding. 


Perks

Everyone likes perks so here are some of the cool things that you might get
for contributing to the project. We tried to choose things that would otherwise
be difficult to get and would be exciting for science and nature lovers alike:


Receive
     an official UF HBREL medium nuc, hive cover and bottom board. Put it in
     your office or outfit a colony with it to let all of your friends know
     that you support scientific research at the honey bee lab!
Have your name in the software credits or on the UF HBREL website as a sponsor.
Participate
     in online streams and live chats for brainstorming and design sessions.
Get a
     special talk for your local bee club, association, or school group that is
     reserved just for supporters of this project.
Get a
     first look at some of the research that was achieved using the prototype
     software.
Receive
     an awesome poster displaying the more beautiful specimens that we have photographed
     using our microscope.
Be
     invited to hang out with the team at the UF HBREL for a day and get your
     own personal guided session with our microscope.

Impact



MorphoMetric is a
project that has the potential to help many different groups of people. Here
are some of the things it could facilitate: 


Faster
     Research! - The prototype for MorphoMetric was developed while conducting my thesis research.
     It was extremely useful for collecting all of the data in an accurate and
     timely manner. We believe that by focusing on the features that made the
     prototype fast and easy to use for my team, we can make a program that
     will help other research teams similarly! 

Make
     Education Easy! - As a student, I found that
     one of the most challenging things about doing science was learning the
     ins and outs of all of the different tools available to conduct research.
     We believe that by focusing on making new tools that are designed to be
     intuitive and easy to teach, we can give other students more time to learn
     the scientific concepts they really need to know without having to work
     against a technological learning curve. 

Identifying
     and Monitoring Invasive Pests- I have had the
     opportunity to work with the Florida Department of Agriculture and
     Consumer Services Apiary Inspection Team over the years, observing the
     techniques that they use to monitor for Africanized honey bees. Integrating
     MorphoMetric into their current
     system would cut down the time that it takes to identify and monitor these
     and possibly other invasive pests. 

Citizen
     Science! - Everyone at the UF HBREL is a huge
     advocate of citizen science projects.  One of our goals is to make MorphoMetric
     easy enough to use that anyone can pick it up and begin using it right
     away. 

Save
     The Bees! - While this project has the potential to
     benefit a lot of different people, we are still honey bee scientists at
     heart. We want to be able to continue our work studying honey bee
     populations, whether wild or domesticated, and we believe that having this
     tool will help us do that. Please help us save the bees!





Risk Assessment
 
There are risks inherent to donating to any project. Here are some of the
ways that we will address the risks associated with this project:


Security - Giving
     support to crowdfunded projects is a great way to help new ideas become
     reality, but we have all heard the horror stories of people running off
     with other people's money without attempting to complete their projects. That
     is not going to happen here. The funds received will be deposited directly
     into an account maintained for the UF HBREL by the UF Department of
     Entomology and Nematology. This means that no one other than the principal
     investigator can have access to the funds.

Accountability
     - I believe it is important to be held
     accountable by people with greater experience and authority so that the
     project goals can be met.  I will be
     supervised by associate professor of entomology Dr. Jamie Ellis. Dr. Ellis
     has managed hundreds of research projects with many people in the past. 

Experience -
     The previous project on which I worked for my thesis requirements had a
     larger budget and more people working on it than will this project. The
     experienced I gained managing a large project makes me confident that I
     can see this project through to conclusion. 

Technical
     Skills - Keeping this project in-house instead of
     contracting with a software company will save on costs. My undergraduate and
     graduate training front load me with the technical experience needed to complete
     the project. 

Release
     Date - The goal is to complete the project 6 months
     after receiving the funding in full. We will keep everyone informed about
     the process as things develop.





More About Me

I am currently a master's student in the HBREL at the University of
Florida. I grew up in Orlando and moved to Gainesville attend college. I have
always had a love for the natural world, and I developed a love of technology
as I grew older. I was not able to choose between the two for my formal
education, so I pursued and received my undergraduate degree in zoology with a
minor in computer science.

as well.

with your friends and families. Share the link for this page on your facebook

can also:

Follow our Instagram and request more cool microscope images.

story:
Who We Are and Why? 

We are West in Motion, a creative collective, that began as a lifestyle and apparel company. However, our early customers taught us something: we have greater purpose. 

We aim to inspire people to CREATE their own lifestyle. We are artists, dreamers, and visionaries. Business is our art. We believe art is mankind's way of showing us there is something deeper within. West in Motion wants to tap into that potential and provide opportunities to those who wish to build a better future.

Our Project and Vision
To continue to provide premium resources and opportunities we are launching our first major service: West in Motion Studios. West in Motion Studios will be a top-of-the-line, fully equipped, creative live/work space. Think of it like a hostel for the creative lifestyle. This is an all-inclusive retreat in San Diego, CA. You’re getting the tools, resources, and education to enhance your creative process.

West in Motion Studios will be designed to combine your love of traveling and creating with like minds by making it affordable and efficient. Our vision is to design a top-of-the-line workspace fully equipped for every artistic medium. Are you a musician? Are you a filmmaker? Photographer? Writer? It will have everything from canvases and paintbrushes, computers loaded with software, to a recording studio. Are you an entrepreneur? Techie? A marketing guru? We have your back. Remember, business is our art and we’re here to help. And if you want to experience a new way to travel or vacation, we are designing space efficient living quarters so you can enjoy your work. 

We are here to provide opportunity. Products and services that change the world. 


What We Need & What You Get
We need $30,000 to turn our dream into your reality.

The money will go towards:
1) $10,000 initial mortgage cost for a live/work space 

2) $10,000 towards top-of-the-line artistic equipment/supplies 
        A.Computers and software (multimedia tools)
        B.Production equipment (visual and auditory)
        C.Musical equipment 
        D.Art/craft supplies 
            (Paints, brushes, canvases, etc).

3) $10,000 will go towards developing our living quarters 
        A.Space efficient sleep pods
        B.Brainstorm room
        C.Hand crafted furniture (beds, chairs, couches, tables, desk, etc.)
        D.Miscellaneous (monitors, white boards, conference room, supplies, etc.)

Perks

There is no donation too small, everything is greatly appreciated. In return, we have rewards ranging from limited edition clothing, pre-booking your stay at West In Motion Studios, to being flown out to San Diego for our Grand Opening weekend. 

Please check our clothing below before you claim a perk and let us know what you want!

Men's "La Ciudad" Crew Fleece
Unisex
(Limited Edition Collaborative Item)

Men's "Red Beauty" Tee
(Limited Edition Tee)

"No Scrubs" Tee
(Limited Edition Tee)

Men's "La Ciudad" Crew Tee
(limited Edition Tee)

"No Scrubs"3/4 Baseball Tee
Unisex
(Limited Edition Tee)

"Lés Hustles" Long Sleeve T
Unisex
(Limited Edition Collaborative Item)

WIM "Blaze Your Own Trail" Hoodie
Unisex
(Limited Edition Collaborative Item)

West in Motion "Blue Collar" Tank
(Limited Edition Tee) 

"No Scrubs" Crop Tee
(Limited Edition Tee)

Women's "American Beauty" Tank
(Limited Edition Tee)

West in Motion "Racerback" Tank
(Limited Edition Tee)

Women's WIM "Simple Sweater"
(Limited Edition Tee)



WIM Tote Bag
(Limited Edition)

W.I.M SnapBack
(Limited Edition Item)




Risks and challenges

The biggest challenge we face is finding the perfect space for both work and lodging. Because of this, we will not rush to launch West In Motion Studios before it's ready. We are excited about the research and design aspects that will go into designing a top-of-the-line live/work space, and we are fully prepared and dedicated to bring you the best possible West in Motion experience. 


Stretch Goals
If we pass our goal of $30,000, we will use the additional funding for a larger space, more beds, more equipment, and possibly a WIM Studio in your city!


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute financially, you can help us by sharing our project from @Westinmotion.com, WIM Facebook, Instagram,and Twitter. All of those actions may have a big impact on our success because the more followers we have, the more people know about our project.

You can use the Indiegogo share tools to do so!

When like minds come together, improbable is lowered, and impossible is in sight. Let’s create products and services that change the world.

story:
Short Summary

The Admin Company Ltd is a new small business started by Christine Welten. Christine has years of experience within the administration sector, as well as being a freelancing writer, an internationally published author, an experienced editor, and a blogger! This means that she is self-motivated, hard working, and passionate about seeing her business succeed.

This campaign is to raise funds to help Christine get her new business off the ground. After doing market research in her home town, she realised that there was a massive need for a company that could provide temping relief and administration support for local businesses. After years of helping others both in and outside of work, Christine is passionate about helping small businesses succeed by using her own expertise in administration.

If this business were to succeed, not only would it help realise Christine's dream, but it would also be the first business of it's kind in her area. It would provide essential administration support to other local businesses, helping them grow and succeed also. In short, this campaign would not only help The Admin Company Ltd., but would have a flow on effect through the whole community.

What We Need & What You Get

To get this business up and running, I am asking for $20,000 of support. This will go towards:

  • Renting an office space for the first couple of months until revenue picks up.
  • Equipment for the office, such as a new computer.
  • Wages for those working in the business to help cover their costs while the customer base is grown.
  • Advertising the business on local media.
If this business does not succeed and is not paying for itself within 6 months, then any left over funding will be feed back into the local community through charities.

The Impact

Taupo is a town that has a thriving business community and a need for a business like The Admin Company. Because of the type of services The Admin Company offers, the whole community will benefit from it. Developing the community and the businesses in it is ultimately the goal of The Admin Company.

Risks & Challenges

There are risks to starting this business. Though research has shown that there is a need and people want it, there is always a risk that there will not be enough interest. Christine's volunteer work with community projects before means that she has a great rapport with others and can easily build relationships with other businesses, minimising the risk of not being able to find a customer base.

There is also the risk that the business will not be paying for itself in a reasonable amount of time, making it impossible for the business to continue. However, it is projects like this and the ability to promote her business well that makes Christine a great candidate to support.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute financially there are other ways to help.

- Spread the word! The more the brand spreads, the more work that will come in.

- Contact Christine about displaying a flyer in your business to help promote her work.

- Ask others that you know have financial means to contribute on your behalf. 

- Share, like, tweet, and spread wwwtheadmincompany.co.nz on social media.

story:
Short Summary

Hello my name is Justin Paul Morizono, the founder of Nikko Lighting llc..
With years of experience’s with electrical components and how it operates, I launch a space heater company. Our first model the Nikko 168 heater was introduced on Amazon, which were sold out of all 1000 units within 1 month. Rated 4.9 stars on Amazon. My company is located in Hawaii of all places, we do not get cold here. I am here on Indegogo to raise $5000. so that I may strategically move my company to Florida and Canada. By opening a warehouse in Florida and Canada, customers would not have to wait for there heaters being shipped from Hawaii. Nikko 168 heaters will help the people living in the United States and Canada, to stay warm during the winter months.

What We Need & What You Get

The target goal is $5000.the funds will be used to move operations to Florida and Canada.
1 X Nikko 168 Ceramic Space Heater rated 4.9 stars on Amazon.
1500 Watt Ceramic Heater / 5200 BTU
Silent Motor 52 DBA
Heat: Output Up to 120F Degree
3 X Heat Setting : Low, Med, High / 1X Fan Speed
Power Protection Light / Automatic Thermostat
Overheat Thermal Cutoff / Tip Over Switch
Removable Dust Filter - Pet Friendly
Nema 2 Prong Plug 120 Volt USA-Canada
Passed Underwriters Laboratory Safety Compliant for USA and Canada
Regular Price USA $65.00 
Regular price Canada $85.00

The Impact

With your contribution people across USA and Canada will receive there Nikko 168 heater's much faster.

Risks & Challenges

There are no risk involved, we plan to deliver product, I will guarantee it. The only challenges we might encounter: Long Beach Dock strike or trucker strike. This would delay shipment. We plan to deliver product by October 15, 2015.

story:
We'd like to introduce you to our friend Kylie.  She is a kindergartener that struggles with the everyday demands of a general education classroom.  She loves all animals and loves to sing for them. Kylie and her family are farmers at Come and See Farm. 
Our friend Trystan is a second grader that has difficulty paying attention in class.  He loves to draw and make things.  He loves his chicken and the physical duties on the farm.  He and his grandmother are farmers at Come and See Farm. 
"Trystan looks forward to going to the farm every chance he gets.  Being there can turn his frown upside down in minutes.  He is a part of something bigger and that gives him a feeling of belonging and of contributing to a greater good.  His excitement and pride was self-evident when he picked peas for the first time and took them home to share with our family.  We are so grateful that Come and See Farm was started and blessed to be a part of it.  I am so excited to see what is to come."  --Beverly Wade, grandmother
Clark a second grader and his sister Abby a kindergartener are farmers at Come and See Farm.  Clark loves to count the chickens every time he comes to the farm.  Abby loves to hammer nails and staples in pieces of wood.  Their parents are also farmers at Come and See Farm.
"Come and See Farm gives my family a place to grow and learn together." --Sarah Douglass, mother
"The farm is important to our family because it allows us to all come together, even with other families and learn so much while having fun."--Trish Pierce, mother
These are some of the farmers who are building Come and See Farm. 
Each Saturday we offer a seasonally appropriate program.We have chickens, goats and garden crops. Next year we will have honeybees. The land is being developed using permaculture practices. Permaculture practice develops land quality slowly, over time. Its premise is to care for the earth, care for people and to share the excess fairly.  All programs focus on skills people of all ages may use at home. The farm is open and accessible to all people, but especially for children who receive Special Education services in the public school.
Melissa Payne and Gail Holman have taken the nine acres behind their home and made a place where children and families can come and experience, learn about, and grow a farm.   
We've got goats and chickens.  We have a vegetable garden.  We have 20 farmers and one garage, bursting at the seams.  We need a BARN! 
We're asking you to join us in raising the funds necessary to build the barn for our current and future farmers. We are needing $50,000.

story:
We are FEAT. sock co.

We love socks and we love people who love socks. We design limited edition feature socks and have them made in Cape Town, South Africa. We stock stores across the country as well as overseas, and ship worldwide from our online store. We love supporting local industry and we would like to share our success with those who share our love for socks. 
With your help, in November this year we will launch a new range of socks to be sold by individuals in townships. We hope to help equip young entrepreneurs with a low risk, micro-franchise for them to easily test out running a business and hopefully generate capital to fund their dream enterprise. We want to craft relationships with these entrepreneurs that are built on sustainable, mutual benefit.
These young entrepreneurs, many of whom live in Townships in Cape Town like Khayelitsha, lack financial support when attempting to develop a start up. There are amazing tales of success despite the difficulties faced by many in these areas. We want to be a part of writing more success stories.
From our research we discovered that R90 for a pair of designer socks is a competitive price point. Popular brands that already exist within this target market such as Happy Socks and Paul Smith retail from R130-R320 per pair.  We also discovered that there is a high demand for designer socks in these areas. The competitor brands mentioned, only retail in the city and are not very accessible for those living in townships, despite the demand.

Distribution Model

  • Entrepreneurs become a member of the program where they gain access to our FEAT. hustle socks. When they sign up they receive a sample box with all 10 styles and an order form
  • They will have the freedom to choose to buy up-front and hold stock for resale or to accumulate orders from their community after showing them the samples, filling in the order form, collecting payment from customers, and then collecting their orders from us.
  • They will purchase FEAT. hustle socks for the wholesale price of R45 per pair, with a minimum order of 20 pairs, and resell them at a recommended retail price (R90 per pair).
  • They will then either deliver the socks to those who have ordered, or go on to retail the socks at markets, through stores or in their personal capacity.
  • We plan to put sales incentives in place, such as discounts on future orders or design collaborations with our design team.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $8000 to fund the production of 10 fresh styles! These designs have been sampled and tested within our identified target audience, the feedback from which we used to refine and alter the range. We are confident that these socks will be very popular.
In return for your generous donations you will receive gifts! We'll be giving away a variety of our beautiful, locally made socks. Go take a look at the 'Perks' for funders.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't worry if you can't help fund our project. There are other ways you can help. Share our story with your networks, get the word out and use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Our popular culture reinforces the idea that cake toppers have stood the test of time but they are a bit boring to say the least. We're out to change that one “Amazing Cake Topper” at a time! Help us establish this initiative to serve people in need of a solution for their lackluster cakes. For a low cost gets an “Amazing Cake Topper” to an individual and it can light up their birthday, holiday or baby shower.  Another added benefit to the Amazing Cake Topper is it will create a memory that will last forever if kept under appropriate conditions. So after the cake is gone and the party is over, you will have this wonderful memory of your special event.  When we plan parties we scrutinize over every last detail and often times it is hard to make the cake stand out with spending a lot of money on a cake designer.  Now you can have a professional cake at a fraction of the price.  Empower us to make this vision a reality with a donation to this project today!


                


Did you know that 30% of desserts in the US are decorated cakes and another 15% are regular cakes and 25% are cheesecakes, pound cakes and ice cream cakes? That is a lot of cakes to be topped.– This fact prompted us to dig deeper into a solution.  This is where we started to envision “Amazing Cake Topper” and all the possible benefits we could bring to people:

· A fun and exciting way to celebrate.

· A memory that will last forever if kept under appropriate conditions.

· A way to brighten up a plain cake.

When reviewing these benefits, features and much more, it inspired and assured us that this is a business. We feel if executed properly we can reach a large market of people in need of an easier way to make their cakes stand out.  Our features will make us incredibly qualified to succeed in the industry.  This paired with attention to detail and quality service will make us a key player if not leader in the industry. Our mission is to take care of every funder, supporter and customer with the upmost respect and care.  We feel this will be the key to our growth.

                               

Who is Amazing Cake Topper?

We are a team of professional cake decorators who has gathered many years of experience for 15 years in the design and development of fondant cake toppers, handmade with the most renowned pastry of the city.

We have the human talent and creativity to design this collection of fine pieces, really artistic, varied and unique.

Also, as a perks for your support, we are offering seven beautifully designed colorful and attractive to customers: Turtle, Bear, Monkey, Lion, Cat, Elephant and Giraffe. And we have the human talent and creativity to design this collection of beautiful characters.

Our company is passionate with creating an unmatched solution that’s fun and unique for your next cake. Our company will run the business based on our mission statement of providing everyone with a new and exciting cake topper that will be something they can keep forever to remember their special day.  We work hard and with enthusiasm, in order to offer products of high quality and design at competitive prices.

                      


For us to bring the “Amazing Cake Topper” to life, we need your support!

The essence of this crowdfunding is to help in the purchase of equipment and specific tools for bakery area essential to extend the offer and variety of products to a greater number of customers across the country, therefore your donation will go a long way to help achieve this goal.

We need about $14,000 in order to break “Amazing Cake Topper” onto the market. That will includes bakery equipment, materials, labor, marketing and related expenses for start-up.

· Necessary equipments:

  1. Hobart Floor Mixer Model HL600-1STD 60 qt. 4 Speed
  2. Somerset fondant sheeter Model CDR-600F
  3. Work Tables with Sink
  4. Sheet Pan Racks
  5. Others

· Expand our supply:

Baking Ingredients

                               

                             


3D Turtle Fondant Cake Topper (Size: 3.5" x 4" x 1" height approximately)




3D Bear Fondant Cake Topper (Size: 4" height approximately)



3D Monkey Fondant Cake Topper (Size: 4" height approximately)


3D Lion Fondant Cake Topper (Size: 4" height approximately)



3D Cats Fondant Cake Topper (Size: 3.5" height approximately)



3D Elephant Fondant Cake Topper (Size: 4" height approximately)



3D Giraffe Fondant Cake Topper (Size: 6" height approximately)



Apron or T-Shirt

Amazing Apron (One Size) or T-Shirt (Size: S/M/L/XL or XXL).

                  

                  


We feel so grateful to everyone who has taken the time to read out campaign and for those who contributed what they could to make a difference and helping us spread the word.  We have spent the last few months working hard to bring our vision to life in this campaign and it was worth every minute thanks to all our generous supporters.  Please know your efforts, even the smallest, don’t go unnoticed.  We will continue to keep you posted on what your donation helped us achieve.  You are part of our “Amazing Cake Topper” family.

Contributions....

Your generosity and support could make all the difference in the fruition of “Amazing Cake Topper”.

Please share this campaign with anyone you think would be willing to help.

Thank You!

Amazing Cake Topper Team
