story:
Our hostel is currently in the process of renovating our new home! We won't be able to open the doors before the start of the high season without your support! In order to make the Hostel an unforgettable backpacker destination, we need to complete renovations! With your help, we will be able to be open and ready to receive guests and give hundreds of money conscientious travelers the opportunity to make memories that will last a lifetime. 

Why Cozumel? 

Cozumel is more than just a beautiful Caribbean island! It is amongst the top ten diving destinations of the world! With more than 35 dive sites and a vast marine protected area, the waters of Cozumel are incredible. There's no better place to get a scuba diving certification! The island has so much to offer including, beautiful secluded beaches that are accessible by dune buggies! 

Our goals 

The backpacker market is getting bigger and bigger worldwide. We, as travelers and divers understand the needs of our guests and all the backpackers who choose the island of Cozumel. We stayed in hundreds of other hostels before, we dove hundreds of divesites and certified hundreds of dive students in the last years. That is why we have carefully chosen our services and facilities . This is why we decided to offer a wide variety of clean and affordable accommodation options, with very unique design in the heart of the city, just a one minute walk from the ferry pier! Knowing the island and knowing the backpackers needs there is no better location in Cozumel to open a hostel! Check out the rest of our page to see how your help earns unique perks! 

What we did so far

After months of research we found and rented our building at the perfect spot, which previously was a clothing store. We set up our company, we have our business plan, we have a name and branding, and did a whole lot of other stuff that goes along with starting a business. We bought and built beds and bunkbeds, we have almost all the matresses, sheets and linens what we will need to open. We also have the permit to operate a hostel, but we are in the process of getting some other permits for demolition and the construction works. We have our interior and exterior plans from a local architect.
In the last couple of months we renovated and opened our sister building, which is a 4 bedroom 2 bathroom building in the welthiest area of Cozumel, close to the popular beaches, to the harbour and to the divesites. This house has set up, opened its doors and ready to accommodate 12-15 people any time.

What is going on now

Now we focus on our main project in the new location in downtown. The landlord has agreed to start refurbishing and changing the interiors and turn the building from a former clothing store to a brand new boutique hostel and PADI Dive Shop within the next 8 weeks. We applied for permits, signed contracts for utilities, and already moved some bunks and other furnitures and matresses to the shop. While that is going on, we’ve taken out a few interior walls and met with contractors. As soon as the permits released our work refurbishing the interior can begin  and we’re hoping to open by Thanksgiving. 

What We Need 

We need approximately $15,000 USD to complete renovations. The money you help contribute will cover: 
  • Showers 
  • Toilets 
  • Walls and doors 
  • Energy-efficient LED lighting 
  • Furniture 
  • Decoration 
  • Lockers
  • Solar hot water system
  • Classroom 
We just discovered that the energy costs around the Main Square of Cozumel are three times more than in the other parts of the city! So our plan to  gradually integrate energy-efficient solutions for lighting, hot-water and air-conditioning just became a top priority. We need your help to put these environmentally-friendly changes in from the beginning. 

What You Get

We are offering amazing experiences in exchange for your support! We’ve put together some great rewards and hope you’ll be able to help us out and come visit us in return.
  • Stays in the Hostel - our best deals available here before we open 
  • Professional and affordable Scuba Diving Certification Courses in Mexico or in Florida
  • Stay and dive packages for the already certified divers at amazing prices
  • In-House Privileges 
  • Private Fishing Charters in Florida
  • T-shirts, stickers
  • and much more! 
View our Perks Page to find out! 

As Scuba Diving Professionals, we want to share the experiences of diving the pristine Cozumel Reefs with everyone! Hostel will be a welcoming place for backpackers and travelers to rest their heads after exploring this beautiful island! With hotel and food costs exploding, we feel it is necessary to offer unique and affordable accommodations to everyone! This is important to us because we want our guests to have the most memorable time no matter their budget! 
We will also offer the best packages available in Cozumel to guests on all of our PADI Dive Courses and daily boat trips! We have already had much success certifying over 400 students. 

We have invested everything we have into opening the doors to our new property but with costs rising and additional permits and requirements, we have had to improvise. We have managed to include Cozumel's city planning requirements of a garden and natural lighting into our renovations but still need your help! Hostel is still on track to open it's doors by the end of November if the goal is reached! Every little bit helps! 

Please spread the word!  

We realize that you may not be able to contribute financially at this point. We would just ask that you help us spread the word! Share this with as many people as possible! The more this campaign is shared, the greater our success will be! If we exceed our goal of $15,000, renovations will be expanded to include a lounge, the most advanced high-tech classroom and reception area! We will also enhance the accommodations with things like free high-speed WiFi, and acquire additional scuba diving gear, improving the experience for our guests! 
 Thank you for taking the time help and we appreciate your generosity!!!
story_txt:
Our hostel is currently in the process of renovating our new home! We won't be able to open the doors before the start of the high season without your support! In order to make the Hostel an unforgettable backpacker destination, we need to complete renovations! With your help, we will be able to be open and ready to receive guests and give hundreds of money conscientious travelers the opportunity to make memories that will last a lifetime. 
Why Cozumel? 
Cozumel is more than just a beautiful Caribbean island! It is amongst the top ten diving destinations of the world! With more than 35 dive sites and a vast marine protected area, the waters of Cozumel are incredible. There's no better place to get a scuba diving certification! The island has so much to offer including, beautiful secluded beaches that are accessible by dune buggies! 

Our goals 
The backpacker market is getting bigger and bigger worldwide. We, as travelers and divers understand the needs of our guests and all the backpackers who choose the island of Cozumel. We stayed in hundreds of other hostels before, we dove hundreds of divesites and certified hundreds of dive students in the last years. That is why we have carefully chosen our services and facilities . This is why we decided to offer a wide variety of clean and affordable accommodation options, with very unique design in the heart of the city, just a one minute walk from the ferry pier! Knowing the island and knowing the backpackers needs there is no better location in Cozumel to open a hostel! 
Check out the rest of our page to see how your help earns unique perks! 

What we did so far
After months of research we found and rented our building at the perfect spot, which previously was a clothing store. We set up our company, we have our business plan, we have a name and branding, and did a whole lot of other stuff that goes along with starting a business. We bought and built beds and bunkbeds, we have almost all the matresses, sheets and linens what we will need to open. We also have the permit to operate a hostel, but we are in the process of getting some other permits for demolition and the construction works. We have our interior and exterior plans from a local architect.
In the last couple of months we renovated and opened our sister building, which is a 4 bedroom 2 bathroom building in the welthiest area of Cozumel, close to the popular beaches, to the harbour and to the divesites. This house has set up, opened its doors and ready to accommodate 12-15 people any time.

story:
Update- We've had a massive response and a lot of offline donations toward this campaign. Please help us keep the momentum by sharing this with others. We were recently featured on the news (click link below.) We thank you for you for HAVING OUR BACK.

Fox News Story

At 17 years of age, Religious Expressions founder was frustrated with the Hip Hop Culture that saturated his generation. Because the lifestyle was so prevalent, it affected the music people were listening to, the clothes they wore, and the way people essentially lived life. With a vision for promoting an alternative lifestyle to those set apart, Jaylen began Religious Expressions out of the trunk of his mom’s 1997 Nissan Maxima with one mission in mind: to promote a lifestyle of faith through products that glorified God and spread the gospel of Jesus Christ.

He began selling T-Shirts that not only made a fashion statement but more importantly made a Faith Statement. His business began growing and eventually spread across the city of Detroit where he began setting up tables at church bazaars, trade shows, and other city functions.

In 2010, he graduated high school and went to Lubbock, Texas to pursue a degree in Business. Determined to keep his vision alive, he stayed prayerful and through faith in 2011 the first Religious Expressions store was opened in the South Plains Mall in Lubbock, Texas where he rented a 144 square foot (12×12) storefront for the Holiday Season. 

After opening a full store in the mall, he was relocated due to a major corporation wanting the prime space. The new space wasn't the best the mall had to offer and the ceiling caved in and the entire store and all of the merchandise was destroyed in a flood. Without the proper insurance Jaylen found himself back at square one. He has been behind in rent since trying to replenish merchandise and now has 5 weeks to raise past due rent, replenish inventory or possibly close the doors for good. 

The campaign goal is a minimum of $30,000 to cover rent, merchandise and personnel costs until the store is back on the right track!

story:
Dear Friends,

As I celebrate 55 years on this glorious earth, I ask for your help in funding the drilling of a bore well for accessing additional drinking water on my land in India. 

Seven years ago I was blessed to be able to use  inheritance from my family's estate to purchase two acres of land in Southern India where we have been creating an eco-ashram.  Today we have grown with the building of three eco houses made of mud, stone, and iron, but we don't have enough drinking water.  A 300 ft bore-well was made seven years ago but today the water table that it accesses is not abundant enough to accommodate the growing number of visitors. 

Achalam is located in the temple town of Tiruvannamalai in Tamil Nadu.  The town is best known for the holy hill, Arunachala, which has been drawing seekers on the path to truth for centuries, and pilgrims every full moon to burn their karma as they circumnavigate the 14klm base of the mountain.  It is also home to the sage Ramana Maharshi, who was liberated at the tender age of 16 and spent the rest of his life helping others on the path to inner peace. 

When the inspiration came to buy the land I could only imagine buying as much land as possible with the money I had so I could share the blessed space with others in a sustainable social enterprise. The ecology concept came after living in the jungle of Sri Lanka and comparing it to the concrete jungle of  Hong Kong.  Anyone who has ever lived in a porous, living structure like a mud house will know the feeling of the mother earth's embrace and the impact it has on balancing the body mind. 

The Achalam project is yet to become sustainable as the majority of visitors come for the full moon pilgrimage and give a donation of food provisions.  In order to take the development to a new level, I am seeking your assistance in the funding of projects like this one so we can increase the capacity for visitors, and for retreats to be held at the ashram. 

So I ask you to contribute any amount you can, if you can, to increase the flow of this necessary resource so that Achalam can continue to serve those who feel the call to this sacred space.  
And please, come to Achalam, by the grace of Arunachala. 
Blessed Be!

story:
Digital surveillance makes traffic safer.

With attachable devices to number plates is possible to create a digital traffic surveillance, which would make traffic safer. It would be like GPS kind of solution, which using allows for existing resources to be more of a rational use.

Imagine that you crash and do not know where you are located. You call 911 and you'll be replied that help is already on the way. Navigation system users can then free the road for emergency vehicles early on. The use of such a solution would provide savings in job losses of parking clerks, an increase in the police and fire department responsiveness and loosing requirement of speed cameras. Traffic on road can be monitored in vehicles and of corse through internet in real time. It is easy to report your location.

Necessary are of course digital sensors for number plates, navigation devices in vehicles, servers and creation of web solution. Income to developers would give web solution customers and users of vehicles navigation systems. Customer base could be formed by government, drivers, insurance, freight-, transport- and logistics companies.

Such system could save mileage in real time, loses blind spots in mirrors and eliminates car thefts. From work heading to way home would be sufficient about simple glance to digital map for finding out where there are no traffic jams. It is possible to see from GPS screen where are other vehicles around and report their impolite behavior. If vehicle is rented, it's route can be traced.

Internal Revenue Service could monitor usage of company cars without require of logbook. Barriers open by the device on licence plate. Parking fee gets debited automatically from your bank account. Traffic lights know in advance about your arrival, you are informed about roadworks and temporary traffic signs before reaching to them. By using navigation device online system computes even with waiting time of train barriers while preparing of the journey. The device suggests when is safe to pass by other vehicles. Logistics companies and authorities would know up ahead how much work they have coming up. Released resources can be directed to an acceleration of operations that have been long-running so far.

Device design:
Approximately 3.5cm lenght. 2.5 cm width. 1.5cm height.


Approximate pricing:
75eur per attachable device. (+VAT)
225eur per navigation device. (+VAT)
2eur per/mo (+VAT) monthly payments for navigation real time map usage.
4G+ SIM card for map updates, social etc. in navigation system is per your own expense. Navigation system is with WiFi sharing capability. Can connect your home/office/mobile/laptop WiFi as well, connectable via USB cable to computer/laptop, no needed SIM in that case for updates.

Development process:
Attachable device design, creation of the device, security of the device. Automation with barriers/gates and device creation on barrier/gate side, testing period.

Navigation system design and creation, map implementation, servers, security, testing period, web solution, security, testing period of connectivity, map implementation, security, testing period.

Implementation of local train times and visually moving trains. Testing period. Not exact timing until contract/agreement with train companies and/or government.

Implementation of driving and rest periods to show realtime usage and how much can drivers drive more for transport/logistic companies, availability creation to show clients when would driver arrive approximately in real time online (+notification possibility if late, time set can be modified.)

Possibility to make difference of trucks/cars and other vehicles, testing period.

Getting contracts with traffic sign manufacturers who are mainly private companies, security, implementation of traffic sign support to devices and creation of traffic sign side devices, testing period away from actual traffic.

Getting traffic sign devices implemented on the roads for no cost to the governments, testing period.

At same time with traffic sign manufacturers.. contracts with temporary traffic sign manufacturers (or directly road construction companies), implementation, security, getting them on the road with private companies of road construction, testing period, contract/agreement with governments to implement them on road without no additional cost to governments, security and another testing period.

Possible contract/agreement with government and/or private companies for attaching devices to trains as well for tracing their movement. Creation of devices, security, attachment of devices, testing period.

Further development for sharing locations, reporting on drivers side and mapping emergency vehicles with possible agreement of governments. Along with social connection to share location to friends (even when car is on the move friend can take and aim for your location as destination while both on the move) at all times or when manually chosen to do so. Possibility to share previous days routes to friends/company/colleges, hit detection of the device, notification on map if anyone near removed device or gone offline, suggestions on two way roads when would be possibly safe to drive by of vehicle in front of you.

Collision warning (on/off.)

Possibility to fix maps based on routes of vehicles and online to send in fixed routes to make changes, possible contracts with gas stations to pay automatically based on devices in gas station and devices on license plates or to get invoices based on customers contracts, security and testing period.

Possible solutions to parking places for gathering fee with notification on GPS that have parked to area where have to pay for parking, real time showing number of free parking spots available, fee gathered and possibility to implement even devices to know about parking violations who are parking without devices. 

Further development of ideas..
Such as contracts/agreements with car manufacturers getting fuel economy, current fuel level, indicator lights etc. shown in realtime.

Cameras & microphones that currently nearly every laptop already has into license plate devices.

Funding used for:
Attachable devices development, navigation system development, contract for map that would fit our needs, web solution development, servers, security, traffic signs devices development (to get contracts with private companies for temporary signs), traffic lights devices development (necessary hardware and software to implement in them, mainly along contracts with private companies making them), pre-creation of devices for transport companies.

Approximate timeline:
2-5 Years. Up to 7 for fully working solution.

story:
Our Innovative Solution!

Our primary mission and principle enterprise is to give all business owners (specifically, small to mid-size companies) a forum for addressing negative reviews posted online via crowd-sourced, business review and social networking sites! 

Such as, but not limited to: Yelp, Angie’s List, Google Reviews and many others. Thereby, giving the business owner an opportunity to rebut and express their side of the story, using our proprietary video and text formats!

> If you haven't already, please review our Above "Introduction" Video! 

> Then Watch Our "Follow up Video" Below! 


Why is it important that our campaign gets funded?

2Sides2 is completely a start-up venture operating on a shoestring budget. In order for us to accomplish our initial goals, we need operating capital for a new website with a new integrated infrastructure design. Currently 2Sides2.com is "only" a freshman presentation website. 

Additionally, and just as importantly, we need marketing capital for presenting our innovative solution aggressively. These funds will be used for promoting our creative strategies which are specifically intended to maximize our exposure to our core audiences, the small business owner and the general buying public. 

These are paramount initiatives for us to bring forth our conception into the arena of an actual working 2Sides2 solution for achieving our ultimate goal, "empowering all small business owner with an exciting and creative way to rebut negative reviews posted online!" 

What makes our project most unique? :)

This idea has never been broached before and is sorely needed for all business owners, but more specifically, the small to mid-size business owner!

Strategy Summary

Our obtainable goal is to see 2sides2.com linked synonymously with all business social media networking review sites. We will accomplish this in a two fold process. 

First, by introducing 2sides2.com to business owners and then secondly, informing the general buying public about 2sides2.com. We will accomplish this by reaching out to both verticals through various print, radio, youtube presentations, press releases, cross country promotional tours and radio/tv marketing campaigns. 

Enthusiastically, 2sides2.com will be presented to potential reviewers as the “new” social media resource for gathering information about their local businesses, while establishing a “brand new” platform and tool for all business owners to rebut their negative reviews posted online. Simultaneously establishing a customer-centric experience for all those who encounter 2sides2.com!

Selling Proposition

Our primary enterprise for business owners, rebutting negative reviews posted online, is made affordable by presenting two (2) options to access our proprietary services. 

ALL TEXT REBUTTALS ARE FREE AND UNLIMITED! 

(Up to 1000 Words Per Rebuttal)

The video rebuttals can be obtained by signing up for a 12 month (1 year) package agreement that can be purchased at a discount. The other option available is our monthly agreement (slightly higher overall - with 12 monthly installments) for the video package. Both of these packages will give business owners access to our proprietary video and text formats for uploading, 

"Their Side of the Story!"

Additionally, our second objective for 2sides2.com is to present an affordable outlet for small independent business owners to expressively and inexpensively advertise their company via our exclusive video and text formats. This is being offered in conjunction with our primary enterprise at a discount, but can also be independently purchased. 

ALL BUSINESS TEXT LISTINGS AND ADVERTISEMENTS ARE FREE! 

(Up to 1000 words with listed logo, website and contact information) Unlimited changes can be made to the text at any time!

The video advertising package can also be obtained by signing up for a 1 year package agreement that can be purchased at a discount. The other option available is our monthly agreement (slightly higher overall - with 12 monthly installments) for the video package. Both of these packages will give business owners access to our proprietary video and text formats for uploading, 

THE WHOLE ENCHILADA!

Includes both Rebuttal and Advertising Packages including both video and text (as described above) With up to 10 rebuttal video uploads. Also included - two (2) advertising videos and two (2) advertising text live at any given time. 

Customer can have 1 main constant advertising video and text running through out the year and then run a second video for specials, year-end blow outs, new products or service etc.

Both the rebuttal and advertising video subscriptions are complimentary of each other and by design, these programs will create a two (2) tier process for generating revenue at 2sides2.com!

Benefits for the Business Owner:

  • Can upload anywhere on any computer, smart phone etc.

  • Can collaborate with a partner or a team (up to 2 authorized entities)

  • Can customize every aspect so it’s right for their business by the category that best suits their products and or services.

  • Receives not only a forum for rebuttals, but also a low cost advertising outlet that piggybacks with their rebuttals or works independently.

With a new integrated infrastructure design 

> Currently 2Sides2.com is "only" a freshman presentation website. 

1.) This is paramount for 2Sides2 to initiate our completely operational launch. We have several estimates and after sifting through all the bids submitted by various capable website developers, we have narrowed it down to 2 vendors with an approx. price of: $15K

Our Innovative Solution!

Our
primary mission and principle enterprise is to give all business
owners (specifically, small to mid-size companies) a forum for
addressing negative reviews posted online via crowd-sourced, business
review and social networking sites! Such as, but not limited to:
Yelp, Angie’s List, Google Reviews and many others. Thereby, giving
the business owner an opportunity to rebut and express their side of
the story, using our proprietary video and text formats!> If you haven't already, please review our Above "Introduction" Video! > Then Watch Our "Follow up Video" Below! 

Why
is it important that our campaign gets funded?

2Sides2 is completely a start-up venture operating on a shoestring budget. In order for us to accomplish our initial goals, we need operating capital for a new website with a new integrated infrastructure design. Currently 2Sides2.com is "only" a freshman presentation website. 
Additionally, and just as importantly, we need marketing capital for presenting our innovative solution aggressively. These funds will be used for promoting our creative strategies which are specifically intended to maximize our exposure to our core audiences, the small business owner and the general buying public. 
These are paramount initiatives for us to bring forth our conception into the arena of an actual working 2Sides2 solution for achieving our ultimate goal, "empowering all small business owner with an exciting and creative way to rebut negative reviews posted online!" 


What
makes our project most unique? :)
This idea has never been broached before and is sorely needed for all business owners, but more specifically, the small to mid-size business owner!Strategy SummaryOur obtainable goal is to see 2sides2.com linked synonymously with all business social media networking review sites. We will accomplish this in a two fold process. First, by introducing 2sides2.com to business owners and then secondly, informing the general buying public about 2sides2.com. We will accomplish this by reaching out to both verticals through various print, radio, youtube presentations, press releases, cross country promotional tours and radio/tv marketing campaigns. 
Enthusiastically, 2sides2.com will be presented to potential reviewers as the “new” social media resource for gathering information about their local businesses, while establishing a “brand new” platform and tool for all business owners to rebut their negative reviews posted online. Simultaneously establishing a customer-centric experience for all those who encounter 2sides2.com!

Selling
Proposition
Our primary enterprise for business owners, rebutting negative reviews posted online, is made affordable by presenting two (2) options to access our proprietary services. 
ALL
TEXT REBUTTALS ARE FREE AND UNLIMITED! (Up to 1000 Words Per Rebuttal)The video rebuttals can be obtained by signing up for a 12 month (1 year) package agreement that can be purchased at a discount. The other option available is our monthly agreement (slightly higher overall - with 12 monthly installments) for the video package. Both of these packages will give business owners access to our proprietary video and text formats for uploading,

Side of the Story!"

This is being offered in conjunction with our primary enterprise at a discount, but can also be independently purchased. 
ALL
BUSINESS TEXT LISTINGS AND ADVERTISEMENTS ARE FREE! (Up to 1000 words with listed logo, website and contact information) Unlimited changes can be made to the text at any time!The video advertising package can also be obtained by signing up for a 1 year package agreement that can be purchased at a discount. The other option available is our monthly agreement (slightly higher overall - with 12 monthly installments) for the video package. Both of these packages will give business owners access to our proprietary video and text formats for uploading, 
THE
WHOLE ENCHILADA!Includes
both Rebuttal and Advertising Packages including both video and text
(as described above) With up to 10 rebuttal video
uploads. Also included - two (2) advertising videos and two (2) advertising text live at any given time. Customer can have 1 main constant advertising
video and text running through out the year and then run a second
video for specials, year-end blow outs, new products or service etc.Both the rebuttal and advertising video subscriptions are complimentary of each other and by design, these programs will create a two (2) tier process for generating revenue at 2sides2.com!

for the Business Owner:

story:
Our mission 

We aim to create a sustainable organic garden and arts centre, to help support livelihoods in the community and to work towards making a positive impact on social and environmental issues such as; health and well being, cross cultural dialogue, deforestation, and imbalance of wealth. 

Who are we?

The Kinkeling Community Garden and Arts Centre is a cross - cultural initiative founded by Allan Kerr, a musician based in Devon in the UK, and Kabiro Marong, of Essau Village, The Gambia. 

The name Kinkeling translates as ‘to cooperate’ and is from the local Mandinka language. This name sums up what is special about the project – People working together for each other. 

At the heart of the project is the 3 acre garden in the Gambia, which is used communally by several local families, for growing vegetables and fruit trees. This supports the community and also provides a wonderful environment for music, drumming, dance, meeting people and experiencing the everyday joys and challenges of Gambian life. 


Instead of focusing on the negatives of Gambian life, we are working with the positives of having a strong community, amazing musical traditions and in our case, a well established relationship and a willingness to work together to create a vibrant and meaningful experience.


What we need to do to achieve this


Install a Borehole – This will allow us to have clean drinking water on site and to plumb in taps and an irrigation system. As well as the borehole we want to use solar power to pump into a tank and use gravity to feed our needs.  £2500

Complete The Fence – Our successful fundraising so far in 2015 has meant that the fence is 80% complete, with just some small remaining sections of wire net needed and 3 gates. The fence will help to protect the growing plant nursery by keeping livestock from neighbourling areas out. £400

Guest accommodation: We are going to make the project sustainable as well as successful. We need to be able to welcome guests from abroad for volunteer and educational trips (traditional drumming, dance, mud brick building, sun catching etc). With just a few visitors staying each year and contributing towards food and accommodation, we could sustain and grow the project. We very much look forward to welcoming you from winter 2016/17.  £3500

Caretakers Salary:  £50 per month is a fair salary in the Gambia. In order for Kabiro and Fatou, who have 8 Children, to focus their attention on the project, we want to make sure we pay at least this amount for 1 year, until we are ready to open up to visitors. Cost: £600

What we have achieved so far

Allan has been travelling to The Gambia since 1996, and has known some of the people involved for nearly twenty years. In this time together with the local people he has planted coconut, mango, cashew, and other fruit and nitrogen fixing trees, dug and lined an open well, and almost completed a fence to keep livestock out. We have also established strong links with local musicians and crafts people, ran several camping trips for drumming students from abroad, and built a simple house for Kabiro and Family. Because of the strength and length of the relationships we feel confident in working together to grow the project. 


We Are Non Profit

All the amount raised goes to The Gambia and into the project. When we reach our target we will invest everything into making the garden project happen and in sharing future experiences and developments in the garden as time goes on.

Rewards

We have some amazing perks such as: Djembe drums, percussive log drums, smaller percussion, Very cool trousers, exclusive music downloads, Kinkeling calendars, vouchers for workshops and classes and more! And all just in time for Christmas!


Other Ways You Can Help

And whether you can afford to contribute financially or not, please share this campaign and our perks with friends and family, and generally spread the love! Thank you!!

story:
Short Summary

The Museo Bicknell, one of the jewels in the crown of the Italian Riviera and its deep-rooted culture, is in danger of becoming derelict because of lack of funding. This museum and cultural centre, created by Clarence Bicknell over 100 years ago,  is of great interest to researchers, tourists and the local community. Please give generously to this campaign launched by the Bicknell family and help save the museum from closure.

Who we are

I'm Marcus Bicknell, Clarence Bicknell's great grand nephew. I have made it a mission to help secure the future of the Museo Bicknell and to celebrate the 2018 centenary of Clarence's death with new academic research, European-wide exhibitions, TV and a new biography. We have even created the Clarence Bicknell Association in France, Italy and the UK to support the cause ... www.clarencebicknell.com
While state and local funding in Italy reaches rock bottom, we'll give whatever support we can to the museum and its staff. You can contact me via ...
info@clarencebicknell.com

What We Need & What You Get

We need about €100,000 to secure the next two years of the museum during which the management will be able to put more secure public funding in place. Please give whatever you can; all monies will be paid to the museum without any deduction. We have not yet been able to define swag and other perks with the museum's management but you can be sure of a warm welcome when you visit the place and the gratitude that's due. Big donors will be given a choice of swag items.

Some history

The museum was founded by Clarence Bicknell himself, in Bordighera in 1888 where he lived. The British settlers already had a library in the 1870s and Clarence was keen to have space to display both those books, his own books and his growing collection of plants and drawings. He was one of the prime movers in raising the necessary finance and completing the building. The neo-medieval design was most likely by an English architect, Clarence Tait. The building has a rectangular plan and is preceded by a porch. Inside there is a raised choir that makes it look like a church, but which was, an is, used as a stage or podium for presentation of all kinds. The interior, which is used as a reading room and auditorium, was one of the principal meeting places for the British colony of Bordighera.

The Museo Bicknell is still a working library, home to Clarence Bicknell’s library (including many botanical drawings), over 85,000 books, 3,000 magazines on the local area’s history, art and archaeology, 14,000 reproductions of rock engravings by Clarence and his collection of butterflies, one of the best in Europe. There are also paintings by Pompeo Bordighera Mariani (1857-1927), and ancient maps and manuscripts dating from the 13th to the 20th century

His work was continued by his nephew Edward Berry, British Vice-Consul who with his wife Margaret wrote an interesting guide of art history in the area: The Western Gate of Italy. They were supported actively by Prof. Nino Lamboglia, whose Historical & Archaeological Society founded in 1932 was generously supported by Margaret Berry. The Museo Bicknell was later integrated into the Istituto Internazionale di Studi Liguri along with their other museum in Genoa.

The fig tree (Ficus macrophylla or magnolioïde) planted by Clarence at the gate is a more common sight in Australia and New Guinea where they are called banyan trees. It has done so well in the climate of the Italian Riviera that it is now 8.6 metres in circumference, about 21 metres high and has proliferated wildly, destroying walls, the roadway and the gate itself. The wisteria on the front of the museum has done just as well but has been trimmed enough over time to be ornate and decorative.

Today the museum serves as a research centre and a community centre; art exhibitions, seminars and concerts help animate the place and raise funds.

The management

The staff of the museum, led by Prof. Daniela Gandolfi,  are expert and passionate about Clarence and act as a centre for research, conferences and further publications on the subjects dear to Clarence’s heart. Two assistants can only be paid for a few hours a week so the opening hours of the museum are very limited.

Contact: Museo Biblioteca Clarence Bicknell, Via Romana, 39, 18012 Bordighera, Imperia, Italy Phone:+39 0184 263601. bicknell@istitutostudiliguri.191.ithttp://www.iisl.it

The financial needs

The Museo Bicknell... Marcus Bicknell in conversation with Dott. Daniela Gandolfi, the Museum’s Director:

1) What does the Museo Bicknell do, and why is it special?

The Museo Bicknell, with its park and its collections, is still one of the great tourist attractions of the cultural and scientific town of Bordighera at the West end of Liguria, Italy. It houses the library of the International Institute of Ligurian Studies, one of the leading Italian specialist libraries, with over 113,000 volumes and significant archival collections. As part of its activities we hold conferences, exhibitions, lectures, concerts, readings, exhibitions of painting / sculpture, and illustration courses in botany.

2) Why does the Museo Bicknell need money, and how much does it need, year by year going forward ten years?


- The Museo Bicknell needs funding because of the economic crisis that has affected Italy in recent years. Public bodies have drastically reduced their contributions, in some cases as much as 100%.
- The Museo Bicknell requires an annual subsidy of € 50,000 euros and therefore of the next 10 years, € 500,000 euros.

3) Why do the people who funded it in the past not fund it so much any more, and who are they exactly?


The institutions do not fund the museum because of the severe economic crisis that has hit Italy. The organizations that financed the Museum are: Province of Imperia, Prefecture of Imperia, Liguria Region, the Ministry of Heritage and Culture, City of Bordighera.

4) What is the relationship between the Museo Bicknell and the Istituto Internazionale di Studi Liguri? What does the IISL do? Are there parts of the IISL in towns other than Bordighera?


The Museum has been a part of the International Institute of Ligurian Studies since 1947, based in the centre of Bordighera in Lamboglia Nino Via Romana 39 (Liguria, Province of Imperia, Italy).

The IISL is a cultural institute with the purpose of research and study into historical, archaeological and cultural heritage, recognized by the Italian State and the Region of Liguria. It handles a variety of museums, archives and archaeological areas in Ventimiglia, Imperia, Diano Marina, Albenga, Finale Ligure, Noli, Savona, Acqui Terme. It publishes specialist journals and monographs, organizes conferences, study days, exhibitions, specialized courses, seminars, excavations and archaeological research and provides scientific advice to public and private entities. 'The IISL is divided into 13 sections scattered across Liguria (10), Lazio (1) and Piedmont (2).

5) What is the status of permanent staff at the Museo Bicknell? How many people, working how many hours a week, effecting what roles?


- The staff of the museum is made up of 1 Director, 2 individuals manning the Museum and the Library and one person responsible for business and IT. Because of the economic crisis the time that can be spent in the Museum (notably the salaries) has been reduced by 50%. Currently the opening hours to the public are only 20 hours a week with special openings when there are events.

6) What are the roles of Daniela Gandolfi other than curator of the Museo Bicknell?  What level of energy of proportion of her time would be taken up at the Museo Bicknell rather than the IISL or her other roles?


- In addition to coordinating the activities of the Museum Bicknell , Dr. Gandolfi runs the Executive Headquarters of the International Institute of Ligurian Studies in Bordighera. She is currently responsible for the Archaeological Museums of Ventimiglia, Diano Marina and Albenga. She collaborates with various universities and Italian authorities. She has to her credit numerous archaeological excavations and research, both terrestrial and underwater, nationally and internationally. She is the author of numerous publications (180). She has participated in conferences and international studies and is Professor of the School of Interdisciplinary Archaeological Methodologies for the modules on the techniques of excavation, on Roman pottery and underwater archaeology . She was a member of the Italian Archaeological Mission to Iasos of Caria in western Turkey , and directed, between 2000 and 2006, the European Project between Italy and France on the " Julia Augusta Way." In 2009 she was honoured by the President of the Republic Italiana the title of Knight of the Order of Merit of the Republic .

7) Can a person be found that Daniela trusts to animate the Museo Bicknell and organise more regular exhibitions, seminars and visits? The value of the Museo Bicknell can only be measured in its popularity as a site for scholars and visitors. Is this principle agreed? Can further events be organised to animate the fund-raising?


- The initiatives promoted by the Museo Bicknell , though very numerous and varied , are not sufficient to fully use their heritage and its collections ; its popularity can not be measured only as a place for scholars and visitors, but with the fact that the Bicknell Museum is definitely a cultural heritage / monuments in Liguria ( natural history collections , archaeological collections , art collections , funds and documentary and photographic archives , park with botanical species of exception ) . In order to exploit all of its assets would be very useful and necessary to organize other events by knowing the most Bicknell Museum in Italy and in England , the birthplace of its founder Clarence Bicknell ( 1842-1918 ) .

8) Who are the decision-makers at the Museo Bicknell other than Daniela?

- The governing bodies of the Museum are represented by the President of the International Institute of Ligurian Studies (Cosimo Costa), and by the Board of Directors which is responsible for the administrative / financial entity. Recently a group of supporters formed "The Friends of the Museum Bicknell," who voluntarily joined by the management of the facility.

9) What does the Museo Bicknell think is the solution to the financial problem other than making a mid level appeal for people to take up a €1000 euro bond? What are the terms of the bond and why is called such rather than just a gift? Have new people started giving since Daniela's recent email? Who are the people that might give?

- The IISL , being included in the Italian NGO ( Non-Profit Organizations for Social Utility) regime, benefited from the possibility that Italian taxpayers can allocate 5x €1000 of their income to the International Institute of Ligurian Studies. For 2012 8565.00 € were collected in this manner.

- It would be essential to expand and increase the number of Italians who direct their donations to the IISL and it would be very important to promote a fundraising initiative in favour of Bicknell Museum in England, home of the Bicknell family . And in the course of preparing an exhibition of exceptional historical photographs preserved in the Museo Bicknell to be displayed in London.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please get the word out and see who else could help us.... and remember you can use the Indiegogo share tools to make this link available on your Twitter, Facebook and web pages. Thanks in advance.

years, € 500,000 euros.

do the people who funded it in the past not fund it so much any more, and who
are they exactly?

The institutions do
not fund the museum because of
the severe economic crisis that
has hit Italy. The
organizations that financed the Museum are: Province
of Imperia, Prefecture of Imperia, Liguria Region, the Ministry of Heritage and Culture, City of Bordighera.
4) What
is the relationship between the Museo Bicknell and the Istituto Internazionale
di Studi Liguri? What does the IISL do? Are there parts of the IISL in towns
other than Bordighera?

The Museum has been a part of the
International Institute of Ligurian Studies since 1947, based in the centre of Bordighera in
Lamboglia Nino Via
Romana 39 (Liguria,
Province of Imperia, Italy). 
The IISL is a cultural institute with the purpose of research and study into historical, archaeological and cultural
heritage, recognized by the Italian State and the
Region of Liguria. It handles a
variety of museums, archives and archaeological
areas in Ventimiglia,
Imperia, Diano Marina, Albenga, Finale
Ligure, Noli, Savona, Acqui Terme. It publishes specialist journals and monographs, organizes conferences, study days, exhibitions, specialized courses, seminars, excavations and
archaeological research and provides scientific advice to public
and private entities. 'The IISL
is divided into 13 sections scattered across Liguria
(10), Lazio (1)
and Piedmont (2).
5) What
is the status of permanent staff at the Museo Bicknell? How many people,
working how many hours a week, effecting what roles? 

- The staff of
the museum is made up of 1
Director, 2 individuals manning the Museum and the Library and one person responsible for business and IT. Because of the economic crisis the time that can be spent in the Museum (notably the salaries) has been reduced
by 50%. Currently the opening hours to the public are only
20 hours a week with
special openings when there are events.
6) What
are the roles of Daniela Gandolfi other than curator of the Museo
Bicknell?  What level of energy of proportion of her time would be taken
up at the Museo Bicknell rather than the IISL or her other roles?

- In addition to coordinating the activities of the Museum Bicknell , Dr.
Gandolfi runs the Executive Headquarters
of the International Institute of Ligurian Studies in Bordighera. She is currently
responsible for the Archaeological Museums of Ventimiglia, Diano Marina and
Albenga. She collaborates with various universities and Italian authorities.
She has to her credit numerous archaeological excavations and research, both
terrestrial and underwater, nationally and internationally. She is the author of
numerous publications (180). She has participated in conferences and
international studies and is Professor of the School of Interdisciplinary
  Archaeological Methodologies for the modules on
the techniques of excavation, on Roman pottery and underwater archaeology . She was
a member of the Italian Archaeological Mission to Iasos of Caria in western Turkey , and directed, between 2000 and 2006,
the European Project between Italy
and France
on the " Julia Augusta Way."
In 2009 she was honoured by the President of the Republic Italiana the title of
Knight of the Order of Merit of the Republic .
7) Can
a person be found that Daniela trusts to animate the Museo Bicknell and
organise more regular exhibitions, seminars and visits? The value of the Museo
Bicknell can only be measured in its popularity as a site for scholars and
visitors. Is this principle agreed? Can further events be organised to animate
the fund-raising?

- The initiatives promoted by the Museo Bicknell , though very numerous and
varied , are not sufficient to fully use their heritage and its collections ;
its popularity can not be measured only as a place for scholars and visitors,
but with the fact that the Bicknell Museum is definitely a cultural heritage /
monuments in Liguria ( natural history collections , archaeological collections
, art collections , funds and documentary and photographic archives , park with
botanical species of exception ) . In order to exploit all of its assets would
be very useful and necessary to organize other events by knowing the most Bicknell Museum
in Italy and in England , the
birthplace of its founder Clarence Bicknell ( 1842-1918 ) .
8) Who
are the decision-makers at the Museo Bicknell other than Daniela?
- The governing bodies of the Museum are represented by the President of the International Institute of Ligurian Studies (Cosimo Costa),
and by the Board of
Directors which is responsible for
the administrative / financial
entity. Recently a group of supporters formed "The
Friends of the Museum Bicknell,"
who voluntarily joined by the management of the facility.
9) What
does the Museo Bicknell think is the solution to the financial problem other
than making a mid level appeal for people to take up a €1000 euro bond? What
are the terms of the bond and why is called such rather than just a gift? Have
new people started giving since Daniela's recent email? Who are the people that
might give?- The IISL , being included in the Italian NGO ( Non-Profit Organizations for
Social Utility) regime, benefited from the possibility that Italian taxpayers
can allocate 5x €1000 of their income to the International Institute of
Ligurian Studies. For 2012 8565.00 € were collected in this manner.
- It would be essential to expand and increase the number of Italians who
direct their donations to the IISL and it would be very important to promote a
fundraising initiative in favour of Bicknell
Museum in England, home of the Bicknell
family . And in the course of preparing an exhibition of exceptional historical
photographs preserved in the Museo Bicknell to be displayed in London.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Please get the word out and see who else could help us....
and remember you can use the Indiegogo share tools to make this link available
on your Twitter, Facebook and web pages. Thanks in advance.

Short Summary

  • I am the CEO of GROOGR and the Founder of Groupe Reso International Corp.
  • High expectation to work closely with our users and develop a trusty relation with everyone
  • You contribution will support the next BIG THING on the web

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are starting and experiencing Crowd Funding and are very excited to close this first round of many futur possibility
  • We will compensate all donators regarding to the investment made. More features are added every days and will be release in priority to investors
  • Even if the goal is not reached, we will invest all the money cumulated in development, research and programming for a better experience for all.

The Impact

  • Your donation will make a huge difference!
  • You will be part of history with us!
  • You can already visit us at www.GROOGR.com

Risks & Challenges

  • Time and funding as a small company now
  • Spread this to be viral and raise our users to a 10 millions daily basis

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't contribute financially you still can help us in sharing this project, joining our website www.GROOGR.com
  • Share the project to all your contact. With the web now, and together, everybody can make a positive influence.

story:
Re-Launching Ras Kassa's

Recently, the building that housed Ras Kassa's in Boulder, CO was purchased by Google and razed. For the last year, I have been cooking take-out meals from the Broker Inn in Boulder and have now found a place in Lafayette to reopen the restaurant. Would you be able to help us reopen?

I, Tsehay Hailu, opened Ras Kassa's Ethiopian restaurant in 1988 in Eldorado Springs, CO with 6 tables. In 1999, Ras Kassa's moved to 30th Street in Boulder to a much bigger restaurant. I am still the head cook for Ras Kassa's and received my Associate's degree in Culinary Arts from Front Range Community College. Now I have 28 years' experience in the restaurant business. I love to provide the people and the community I love with authentic Ethiopian cooking and an excellent cultural experience. I would like to request your support to bring Ras Kassa's back.

Our Goals and Your Perks

Our goal is to raise $60,000 for capital, 6 months of operating expenses, and remodeling at the new space. Expenses in re-opening include kitchen equipment, an updated computer & inventory system, rent, and a beer & wine license. We will use our funds frugally to make the new space inviting and comfortable. However, we will prioritize setting up the kitchen. We estimate that after we re-open it will take 6 months until our customers have found us again and we are running as usual.

Choose a perk and make Ras-Kassa's re-opening happen. Then come see us at our new space to enjoy great Ethiopian food! There is little risk to you and even some savings available in the larger perks. You can redeem lunch or dinner perks at our take-out space too since we will continue to operate there also!

Your Support Brings Ethiopian Food Back to Boulder

Ras Kassa's brought a unique cuisine to Boulder. Where will you get excellent Doro Wat and injera if not Ras Kassa's? Remember all those good times at Ras Kassa's? Let's keep it going! You know your sister-in-law who loves to go there when she's in town! Let's make sure you can enjoy dinner with her there during her next visit!

Ras Kassa's is a also stronghold for the Boulder African community. Let's keep this seat of African development in Boulder going!

I am on the board of the 501-C3 non-profit PRIDE Ethiopia which brings the local Ethiopian community together to build elementary schools, cap wells, and educate health care workers in the highlands of Ethiopia.

Richard and I cook at the annual BoaBoa Festival run by the BoaBoa Foundation which works to build libraries in Ghana and provide schools with books.

We hold an annual event at Ras Kassa's in which we welcome the African runners of the Bolder Boulder after that great race. 

Ras Kassa's tries to give back to the community that has supported us so well!

The Work Ahead and Your Input

The restaurant business is hard but we have demonstrated that we can be a sustainable restaurant in this community. We have many, many loyal customers (we have 1,486 Facebook Friends) and we have new customers all the time. It has taken over a year in the competitive Boulder County real estate market to find the right spot - one that is central to our customers with the right size and the opportunity for growth.

One thing we are doing to make sure we have as many repeat customers as possible is to ask what you would like to see retained or hope to see changed in the new restaurant. Please email your ideas to me at RasKassasLafayette@gmail.com. 

Take-Out, Kick-Off, and Spread the Word

Come visit us at our Broker Inn Take-out Kitchen near 30th St and Baseline (upstairs, 2nd floor). Call us at 303-447-2919 to place an order Tuesday to Saturday, 4 pm to 8 pm. There are several tables outside the kitchen in the Broker Inn atrium where you are welcome enjoy your meal. We have water, paper plates, and utensils available.

Our Indiegogo Campaign Kick-off is February 4th at the Broker Inn Event Room. Come be part of the fun!

We are selling tickets for the Grand Opening of the new restaurant on March 18th 2017 as one of the perks. We really hope to see you there and we hope you will be one of the first supporters for our campaign.

Please spread the word!! 

In Gratitude,

Tsehay Hailu

story:
Black Girl In Om (BGIO), a lifestyle brand that promotes holistic wellness and inner beauty for women of color, is proud to announced our highly anticipated expansion. After a year of creating a space specifically designed to encourage self-care and self-love for communities of color in Chicago, we are eager to offer our vision to women of color all over the world. Through our online publication, a beautifully inviting social media presence and traveling assemblies, BGIO will establish a global community for an increasingly marginalized audience. 

“My story, the story of Black Girl In Om, is a relatively simple one that boils down to this: creating the change that I wanted to see for my own experience, and later realizing that change was what countless more women of color needed to see, and experience, as well.” – Lauren Ash, Black Girl In Om Founder and Creative Director

One solid year in, and the growth, engagement and support of Black Girl In Om continue to astound. This November marks our one-year anniversary. Since founding BGIO:

  • our online publication now sees 60,000 page views per month from 20,000 unique visitors. 
  • BGIO has facilitated wellness programs and guided more than 60 yoga and meditation sessions.
  • We have curated four holistic food and wellness gatherings, and held three wellness-oriented social gatherings, positively touching the lives of more than 250 women. 
  • BGIO has partnered with notable institutions such as the Museum of Contemporary African Diasporan Art and Rebuild Foundation
  • BGIO has garnered attention from features in national publications including New York Magazine and Elle.com.

Given our enormous impact within just one year through largely self-funded means, our goal is to raise funds that will allow us to make an even bigger impact in our second year. Specifically, the funds will be used for travel expenses which will allow us to bring BGIO pop-up yoga sessions, BGIO Happy Hour, and BGIO Food Church, to hundreds of women in seven major cities: 

  • Washington, D.C.
  • New York City
  • Minneapolis
  • Atlanta
  • London
  • Los Angeles
  • San Francisco/Oakland

Along the way, we look forward to partnering with the following women of color, all of whom are also committed to bringing more women of color life-affirming, enriching experiences related to holistic wellness, self-care and self-love: Jenné Claiborne, of Sweet Potato Soul; Millana Snow of SERENE Social; Anthonia of Mater Mea; Alex Elle (writer and maker); Randi Gloss, of GLOSSRAGS, Charmaine Bee of Gullah Girl Tea, Lee Litumbe of Spirited Pursuit, Tricia Khutoretsky of Public Functionary, and more!

The funds raised will also provide modest support for the Black Girl In Om team and Black Girl In Om contributors, allowing us to move into our second year strongly. 

Where the funds will go

Travel Costs

To take Black Girl In Om on the road, we have factored in the cost of modest airfare, on the ground travel, and other related travel costs. We are blessed to have friends in these cities that are able to host us when we arrive, so we don’t plan on having costs for lodging. 

Content Production

We are focused on bringing our online publication to the next level. To date, our editor Carla Soto and all of our contributors for our online publication have been donating their time, expertise, and creative energies for free. Amazing, right? We have factored in a start-up fund for content production so that our editor and our regularly contributing writers and photographers may begin receiving modest compensation. In 2016, we are securing sustainable funding opportunities for our team, as well.

Legal Fees and Start Up Costs

Black Girl In Om is comprised of two entities: Black Girl In Om, L3C and Black Girl In Om Publishing, LLC*. Starting not one, but two businesses, and establishing contracts for contributors, team members, and more is a financial investment. 

*Note: as such, your donations are not tax deductible donations.

Fiscal Sponsorship

We are proud to have recently received fiscal sponsorship from Fractured Atlas. In order to be able to apply for grants and other funding opportunities, we must raise $1,000 from our supporters (you)!

Reward Production and Shipping 

The reward costs for all tangible items cover the fees of creating them and getting them in your hands. Note: all tangible goodies, with the exception of Black Girl In Om shirts have been graciously donated to our campaign.

Filmmaker 

To visually convey the magic of Black Girl In Om, we hired our friend Seed Lynn, of Storyographers. Over the course of several months he documented footage, gathered footage from our friends in NYC (thanks Charmaine and Cyndi!) and produced it for our Indiegogo video! It is important that we compensate him for his professional expertise and the incredible attention he gave to our story and will continue to give our story in future film projects we are eager to share with you. 

Indiegogo’s Slice 

We have included the 5% fee and payment processing feeds that go toward Indiegogo when we are successfully funded.

Risks and challenges

We are committed to this vision, we just need your support. From the beginning, Black Girl In Om has been led by visionaries with very few resources, but enormous hearts and passion. We have all been completing this work because we believe in it. None of us currently enjoy a steady paycheck or set salary. Furthermore, our amazing team of contributors has also been creating work that has touched the lives of hundreds of thousands of people of color out of the goodness of their hearts. With a successfully funded campaign, all of us will be even more encouraged, supported, and able to continue to cultivate the vision of Black Girl In Om for countless more women of color. If challenges arise, we will communicate them with you!

Note: these donations are not tax-deductible.

story:
Short Summary

Play, Gym n Create was set up by myself ( Stephanie Russell ) and Miranda Irwin in April 2015 at Seaford Community Centre. Miranda used to run sessions at the centre when they were funded by the government but this funding stopped in December 2014. Miranda has a child care background and has many years of experience in this field. I am a qualified gymnastics coach and ran gym sessions in a sports centre back in the UK. I am a qualified dance teacher, being a member of the British Ballet Organisation. I also worked for a number of years as a childrens entertainer for Warner Holidays in the UK.

We both wanted to offer a community service, similiar to what was there before and came up with the idea of Play, Gym n Create early last year to run as a private enterprise.
We do a range of activities such as art and craft, gym time, song and dance time and the parachute as well as having plenty of free play time.
Contributors will be able to help us achieve this, and help us to provide a number of activities such as painting, gluing playdough, plaster moulds etc, as well as sensory experiences like "slime" which is particularly good for children with sensory issues, all of which can be costly.


What We Need & What You Get

We need to continuously buy paint, paper, glue, stickers, glitter and all forms of craft materials. Unfortunately a lot of our income is spent on insurance and hire costs leaving limited funding for these items. All funds raised will go towards these items. At the moment, we rely a lot on the generosity of parents and carers who have donated various items to us.

  • We will personally thank contributors on our business page on facebook.

The Impact

As well as all the art and craft we do, we spend a good 30-45 minutes a session on gym time, dancing and getting the kids active. Australia as a nation is suffering from obesity so we feel it is important to offer this service to set the pathways for the next generation and get them ACTIVE! Our sessions also help socially, getting the children ready for kindergarten and school. They also help parents and carers to feel connected with others in the community. 

    Our sessions have been running for almost a year now and many children have benefited from them. Parents have told us how their children have become more confident and social since coming to our sessions.

Risks & Challenges

As children grow and move on to kindergarten and school, we need to continuously get our name "out there" so that new families come through our doors. At this stage we do not have the funds to advertise other than through free advertisements but if we don't we risk the fact that new people just don't find out about us. Our challenge is to raise enough funds to be able to advertise more, so that all families with toddlers know where we are and what we offer.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please like us on facebook and help us get our name "out there"

You can donate craft items to us or children's toys. Any items are greatly received.

  • You can also use the Indiegogo share tools!

   What We Need & What You Get We need to continuously buy paint, paper, glue, stickers, glitter and all forms of craft materials. Unfortunately a lot of our income is spent on insurance and hire costs leaving limited funding for these items. All funds raised will go towards these items. At the moment, we rely a lot on the generosity of parents and carers who have donated various items to us.   We will personally thank contributors on our business page on facebook.

   The Impact As well as all the art and craft we do, we spend a good 30-45 minutes a session on gym time, dancing and getting the kids active. Australia as a nation is suffering from obesity so we feel it is important to offer this service to set the pathways for the next generation and get them ACTIVE! Our sessions also help socially, getting the children ready for kindergarten and school. They also help parents and carers to feel connected with others in the community.    Our sessions have been running for almost a year now and many children have benefited from them. Parents have told us how their children have become more confident and social since coming to our sessions.     Risks & Challenges  As children grow and move on to kindergarten and school, we need to continuously get our name "out there" so that new families come through our doors. At this stage we do not have the funds to advertise other than through free advertisements but if we don't we risk the fact that new people just don't find out about us. Our challenge is to raise enough funds to be able to advertise more, so that all families with toddlers know where we are and what we offer.   Other Ways You Can Help Please like us on facebook and help us get our name "out there" 
You can donate craft items to us or children's toys. Any items are greatly received.  You can also use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
(English to follow)

Pourquoi faire une campagne de financement?

C’est notre deuxième édition de La Semaine de la bière de Montréal. L’année passée, nous avons organisé un événement a petite échelle avec peu de moyens. Cette année, nous voulons l’améliorer:

  • Nous voulons augmenter notre audience. Il y a déjà dix mille personnes qui prévoient l’événement, mais nous savons que nous pouvons toucher un plus grand nombre de passionés de la bière.

  • Événements et dégustations. Nous voulons maintenir les prix de dégustation aussi bas que possible.

  • Et prix! Prix pour les passionés de la bière!

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous pouvez obtenir

Ce dont nous avons besoin:

  • Nous avons besoin des ressources financières pour payer les outils de marketing, promouvoir l’événement et acheter des prix pour les jeux et les concours.

  • Tout l’argent recueilli sera investi pour rendre un événement plus génial.

Ce que vous pouvez obtenir :

  • Marchandises de La Semaine de la bière de Montréal 2016: autocollants, affiches, T-shirts et plus!

L’Impact

L’objectif principal de La Semaine de la bière de Montréal est de faire valoir la bière autant que les lieux qui la servent. Montréal aura l’image d’une vraie capitale de la bière.

  • Nous voulons que les gens aient plus d’excuses pour aller prendre une bière avec des amis pendant la semaine.

  • Nous voulons que les gens essaient des bières différentes et qu’ils aient l’expérience de nouvelles saveurs.

  • Nous voulons que les gens découvrent de nouveaux lieux et apprennent de nouvelles choses à propos de leur ville.

  • Nous voulons que les gens s’amusent!

Autres moyens d’aider

Certaines personnes ne peuvent pas contribuer financièrement, mais c’est toujours possible d’aider:

  • Participez ici: https://www.facebook.com/events/1706086756342222/

-----------------------

Why are we here?

This is our second edition of the Montreal Beer Week. Last year we made it happen on a very small scale and with few resources. This year we want to make it a lot better:

  • We want to grow our audience. We already have 10K people anticipating the event, but we know we can reach more.
  • Events and tastings.
  • And prizes! Prizes for beer lovers!

What We Need & What You Get

What we need:

  • We need financial resources to pay for the marketing tools needed to promote the event and to purchase prizes for the games and contests. 
  • All the money raised will be invested in making the event more awesome.
What you can get:

  • Montreal Beer Week 2016 merchandise: Stickers, posters, T-shirts and more!

The Impact

The main purpose of the Montreal Beer Week is to showcase the beer and beer offering venues of a true beer city like Montreal:

  • We want people to have mores excuses to go have a beer with friends on a weekday.
  • We want people to try different beers and have new flavour experiences.
  • We want people to discover new places and learn new things about their city. 
  • We want people to have a good time!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • RSVP here: https://www.facebook.com/events/1706086756342222/

story:
MagicTreamer™ - System

The MagicTreamer™ an incredibly versatile climbing system.

Small in the box - Huge in the pot


What is the difference in the MagicTreamer™ to other trellises ?

  • A normal trellis is bulky and flat, sometimes heavy, too.
  • The MagicTreamer™ is surprisingly lightweight and small in the box. When assembled it becomes impressively large and voluminous to its 3-dimensional construction.
  • Most known trellies get fixed by sticking the ends or some spikes into the soil and don´t even give reliable stand to themselves and the plant.
  • The MagicTreamer™ lower part is constructed like a basket that sits in the ground completely. This improves the stability essentialy and stabilty grows with the growth of the plant.
  • Standard trellises have a defined size and shape - their given one
  • With the MagicTreamer™ models you decide on shape and size - by changing the placement of the rings you can build the Treamer the way you like and the way it fits your pot best.
  • Bamboo sticks, plastic grids or metal frames mainly have a static function.
  • The MagicTreamer™ itself is an eyecatcher, almost a sculpture. Besides that it is a trellis much more reliable and steady. Our model "TomatoHome" even provides some aspects of plant protection. It can be equipped with an umbrella to protect sensible plants from nasty weather. 
  • Here some overgrown examples (prototypes) :

 
 


What you give and what you get

     
  • The MagicTreamer™ Team needs totaly  26.500,- € for initial order of special stainless steel,  cutting tools, machinery, packaging and assembling supplies
    •  
  • You get a special discount of 40 % at the  "TomatHome"(without pot.). 
  • Your discount price is 76,- $ (RRP = 129,- $)


    • You get a special discount of 40 % at the  "Onio" (without pot.). 
    • Your discount price is 53,- $ (RRP = 90,- $)
 

  • You get a special discount of 40 % at the  "Doublo"(without pot.). 
  • Your discount price is 27,- $ (RRP = 45,- $)


  • You also can get a Set of 3 and a "MagicTreamer™ Starter Set" with all three models of the MagicTreamer™ ( Onio, Tomato, Doublo) with an extra discount. 



About the campaign

  

  • Norbert, a professional gardener, invented this system when searching for a better solution to grow climbers on a trellis.

    After the idea was born the system was filed for patent in Europe, USA and China. Together with Uwe, the younger brother, many prototypes were built and many different kinds of steel tested.

    Now wanting to place the system on the market a company was founded:  U_N_limited. ("U" comes fom Uwe, "N" fom Norbert). The company now is a "Limited" (GmbH) and Uwe is CEO.

    When having found the right typ of steel it turned out that to get this the way wanted is a very costly matter. As a high quality steel is wanted with dimensions and specifications defined there is no suitable material ready on the market. The band needed has to be manufactured to customers defaults. This only works in a realistic price segment when you order tons of the material. It is the main obstacle to be overcome to get to serial production. Other expenses are: Special tools and equipment for the factory are needed. Packing: Heavy cardboard boxes have to be produced. Many minor things have to be thought of and financed: Assembling material, screws, manuals, mounting hook, .....

    With your help we will be able to provide three models of MagicTreamer™ the best possible way we can think of. Manufacturing will be done in Europe.

    For your support you receive a 40% discount on the RRP. (Limited to the first 100 units of each perk)

    For the next orders you will get a discount of 30% of the RRP.

    So, don`t hesitate! Be one of the lucky owners of a brand new MagicTreamer™ at a very special price.

Pictures are overgrown examples of the prototypes. 
 
 
Risk

  • The risk is negligible. We got everything under control:

  • The patent is filed.

  • The models offerd are tested and great. (Many more models to come)

  • A supplier (Germany) for the steel with the properties needed is waiting for our order.

  • The factory for production (Europe) is preparing for start of production.

  •  Our team here is ready to start getting production to start and organize delivery as soon as the first MagicTreamers™ come from production.

  • Our plan is to be able to start delivery by end of July. If we don`t get the neccessary funds in time this may cause a delay. But just a delay, nothing else!
    •  
  

Pictures are examples of the prototypes. 


Thank you  - The MagicTreamer Team
