story_txt:
Tecnología y Productos de México (TECNOPROMEX) Por el Momento es una Estación de Trabajo que Consiste en Dos equipos de Cómputo Casi Obsoletos, el Internet que Uso es del Vecino y Mi Oficina es Una construcción con el Techo Fracturado a Punto de Caer, No tiene Cimientos y el Techo lo Sostengo con Vigas de Madera; Yo Represento a TECNOPROMEX mi Sueño es Constituirla como Empresa
Mi Misión Por el Momento es Estructurar a mi Comercializadora con Equipo y en un Entorno Más Seguro, por eso Pido tu Ayuda, no Deseo nada Regalado Quiero Ganarlo
Estoy Ubicado en Calle Nayarit 77 Colonia Ricardo Flores Magón de la Ciudad de Cuernavaca, Morelos, México; Para Atención al Cliente de Cualquier parte del Mundo; Nuestro Teléfono 0527773670761 Aunque Prefiero el Contacto por Correo Electrónico:   tecnopromex@gmail.com


Mi Nombre es Jaime Emeterio Salgado, Nací el 11 de Octubre de 1959, en Tenanguillo de las Cañas, del Estado de Guerrero, México; Soy Fundador de TECNOPROMEX  que Recuerda por el Mimento es una Estación de Trabajo muy Sencilla
QUE OBJETIVOS SE LOGRARÁN CON ESTA CAMPAÑA:
1.- OFICINA Y EQUIPO: Por el Momento es Muy Importante Tener una Oficina Segura y Adquirir Equipo más Avanzado y Rápido para Desarrollar Mis Planes de Trabajo Bajo Presión.

2.- DEBO COMERCIALIZAR PRODUCTOS DIGITALIZADOS DESCARGABLES QUE  AYUDAN A MEJORAR LA CALIDAD DE VIDA DE LAS PERSONAS: Uno de los Productos a Desplazar es el Digital, Producto Descargable en la PC del Cliente en Forma de Información Estos: Son Libros Electrónicos Manuales y Guías Especializadas, Softwares o Programas Informáticos, Cursos de Capacitación, Cursos de Idiomas, Tutoriales Audiovisuales, Tratamientos Naturales y Mucho Más, Editados en Español Con avanzadas Técnicas Autodidactas para Descargar en la Computadora del Cliente y Promover su Aplicación, Formación, Capacitación en Casa:


3.- DEBO COMERCIALIZAR PRODUCTOS FÍSICOS DE ALTA CALIDAD: Son Aparatos electrónicos, Cámaras Digitales, Cámaras de Vídeo, Relojes de Pulso y Decorativos, Computadoras, Laptops, Tables, Equipo Periférico de computación, Equipos de Audio y Video, Telefonía Celular, Suplementos Alimenticios, Suplementos Vitamínicos y Más...



4.- OBTENDRÉ INGRESOS DE LA HERRAMIENTA GOOGLE ADSENSE:  Es una Herramienta Sencilla de Implementar, Consiste en Permitir que Google coloque Tres anuncios Publicitarios en Tu Sitio Web y los Visitantes de tu Sitio Algunos Harán Clic en los Anuncios de Google; Por Cada Clic Google Te Pagará Algunos Centavos de Dólar; A esa Estrategia Google le nombra "Pago por Clic"; Yo Desarrollé Muestreos y Testeos Determinando que de 250 mil Visitas se Generan unos 2000 Clics en los Anuncios de Google traducido en Dinero Serán unos 150 Dólares...


Mi Proyecto Consiste en Generar una Plataforma De Sitios Específicos con Alto Valor en su Contenido, No Son Tiendas Virtuales, Son Sitios que Atraen Como Imán a los Visitantes, Estos Sitios Deberán Recibir Después de 4 Años de Trabajo unos 3.5 Millones de Visitas Mensuales Generando Ingresos Superiores a los 1800 Dólares Cada Mes de Manera Recurrente.

5.- MI COMERCIALIZADORA LLAMADA TECNOPROMEX DEBE CRECER Y DESARROLLARSE HASTA CONSTITUIRSE EN UNA EMPRESA: Como Negocio Debo Crecer al Grado de Constituirme como Empresa; Depende Mucho de los Ingresos; En México Cuando las Utilidades Brutas de una Persona Física superan los 75oo Dólares Mensuales, las Autoridades Hacendarias Hacen Presión para Constituirse Como empresa, este Objetivo de Ser Empresa Podemos Lograrlo 4 Años Después de Recibir el Apoyo Financiero de Crowdfunding.
ORGANIGRAMA DE  TECNOPROMEX PRIMER AÑO DE TRABAJO

ORGANIGRAMA DE TECNOPROMEX SEGUNDO Y TERCER AÑO DE TRABAJO

ORGANIGRAMA DE TECNOPROMEX CONSTITUIDO COMO EMPRESA CUATRO AÑOS DESPUÉS DE RECIBIR EL FINANCIAMIENTO DE CROWDFUNDING INDIEGOGO;  SU NUEVA DENOMINACIÓN SERÁ: 
Tecnología y Productos de México S.A, de C.V.

Con tu Apoyo Financiero Planeo Constituirme como Empresa en 4 Años a Partir de la Inyección de Capital; Entonces Daré Trabajo a 33 Personas en México y 5 o Más Comisionistas Extranjeros...
PRETENDO RECAUDAR CON TU AYUDA 32000 DÓLARES O MÁS, SERÁN APLICADOS PARA:
1.- Compra de Equipos de Cómputo de Alta Capacidad
2.- Compra de Cámaras Digitales de Alta Resolución y Equipos de Telefonía Celular
3.- Compra de Equipo de Audio y Video de Alta Resolución para Grabación de Video Cursos, Conferencias y Tutoriales AudioVisuales
4.- Compra de Proyectores y Equipo Periférico para Presentaciones Profesionales
5.- Equipo y Mobiliario de Oficina
6.- Compra de Existencias para Comercializarlas
7.- Pago de Nóminas Mientras la Comercializadora Despega
8.- Pago de Gastos Corrientes Mensuales Mientras la Comercializadora Despega
9.- Pago de Hosting, Dominios y Gastos Publicitarios
10:- Pagos de Gastos Publicitarios Recurrentes Mientras la Comercializadora Despega
RIESGOS Y OBSTÁCULOS: Claro que Existen Riesgos Durante el Desarrollo de mIs Trabajos, por Fortuna este Emprendimiento no Está Pensado de la Noche a la Mañana, Está Pensado desde Hace Varios Años, con el Respaldo de Cientos de Testeos de Prueba y Error; Cada Paso, Cada Estrategia, Cada Técnica que se Pretende Aplicar está Cuidadosamente Calculada en un Entorno Operativo Optimizado para Producir Ingresos, a Corto, a Mediano y a Largo Plazo; Ante este escenario los Riesgos y Obstáculos Están Minimizados...

story:
Hi my name is Connie Beneteau

and I am the coordinator of the RetroFest and Rock-Around the Clock festival in Chatham-Kent for the past 4 years. RetroFest has been thrilling families for 15 years and this is our "Sweet Sixteen" so we would like to 'pump it up' and we need your help to do that.

RetroFest started with only a few cars back in 2001

and now we have over 600 classic vehicles and over 30,000 visitors who come from around the region (London, Windsor, Sarnia) for this 2 day event.

We are now getting requests to bring in more rides, more cars, and more entertainment.

This is why we decided to launch this campaign. RetroFest is a free event offered to the public. We are asking you to partner with us in making this year special.

In all these years RetroFest has become a Cultural Landmark.


Friday
  • amusement rides,
  • vendors,
  • live entertainment in the park
  • OLG classic cruise night
Saturday
  • activities in the park
  • indoor entertainment
  • classic car show
  • soap box derby
  • junior judges
  • celebrity encounters



What We Need & What You Get

The annual budget is $25,000. We covered till now the entertainment, marketing and set up costs and we just need to cover licenses, community and event planning.

The unique perk:



The festival became a cultural landmark in Chatham-Kent and the region and we are proud to say that we are having a positive impact on the community:
  • is the first festival of the season that welcomes 'Spring'
  • there is a full generation that grew up with our festival
  • brings families together for the week-end
  • develops hobbies and passion for classic cars
  • promotes healthy activities and competitions
  • adds to the community flavour
  • create the environment for community connections
  • helps charities fund raise and connect with the community. Some of them are: Rotary, Boy Scouts, Community Living, Optimist Club of Chatham, and Big Brothers Big Sisters


Your involvement will bring a lot of smiles on kids faces, directly and indirectly.




Risks & Challenges

  • RetroFest is an outdoor event with indoor elements specially to be able to run rain or shine.  We have facilities and activities set up inside the Capitol Theatre and Convention Centre specially to keep our guests entertained and engaged.


Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you are not able to contribute financially, there is still ways you can help out our campaign. You can like and share to all your social media friends. 

Please, and it's important, use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Welcome to Powercanister...

Powercanister has one goal – to create an alternative energy solution that is clean, safe and reliable.

  • The Powercanister team is made up of a team of electrical engineers, scientists, and marketers that are committed to taking this technology to the next level.
  • We feel that creating a new way of producing electricity from water is one of the waves of the future.
  • Contributors to the Powercanister campaign will enable us to bring light to all corners of the world without wires.





What We Need & What You Get

  • We need tooling to bring the first Powercanister product to life
  • The funding raised during this campaign will enable Powercanister to begin to tell the world of power from water through a real and practical product.
  • Be a part of the future when you purchase one of our perks and be the envy of all of your friends!
  • Whether we meet our funding goal or not Powercanister is moving forward! We won't stop as we are dedicated and driven.






The Impact


Your contribution to this project has the potential to bring power to places no one could have imagined.  

  • Without the need for terrestrial cabling, wires, or expensive machinery YOU have the opportunity to bring light and more (down the road) to the world!





The Favourite Perks



BUY NOW




BUY NOW




BUY NOW




BUY NOW





The Team

Iuliu was interested in amateur electronics and telecommunications from the beginning. A true inventor, Iuliu has been working on several utility patents for the past several years.
He invented the generator by mistake, while wanting to create a mini current stabilizer for his electromagnetic wave meter device.
Working with Alex for the last four years, he developed and raised Powercanister to a different level, giving the opportunity for this technology and these products to exist.
Iuliu currently lives in Romania and holds a Bachelor's degree from the University of Economic Studies, in Bucharest, Romania.

The son of an electrical engineer, Alex has always had an interest in electricity and how things work. By the age of 6, he had already built his first radio and by the time he was 18, he had finished blueprint drawings and managed the electrical construction of an entire dental lab. 
Prior to his work on the Powercanister technology, Alex has been a serial entrepreneur, proud Hungarian, and an involved community member. In 2010, Alex started the largest privately owned Hungarian social networking site Magyar Vagyok.
In 2009, Alex founded the Internet service provider 12Global in Chicago. 12Global is a Gigabit high speed Internet company that provides services to large, midsize, and smaller MTU (multi-tenant units) in Chicago, providing them internet service as well as TV if needed.
His passion for technology, his Hungarian heritage, and his community are what sets Alex apart from the crowd as a true innovator, leader, and entrepreneur. 
Alex relocated to Chicago from Romania in 2000 and holds a combined bachelor/master’s degree in electrotechnics and an additional master’s degree in business administration from the University Politehnica Timisoara in Romania.


Zoltan is a dentist and an amateur electronist. He is more of a thinker than a talker. He pays big attention to the smallest details. The Powercanister look and feel was perfected by Zoltan including the ability to stack the units, the inventive way to connect the units together to create more power as well as the implementation of Feng Shui Bagua signs on the outside of the box. No detail was overlooked during the design.
Zoltan returned to Romania after a few years living in Canada and the USA and is preserving his heritage by building a social network site around the Hungarian cultural values.
Zoltan is also involved in many environmental projects and placing a special emphasis on teaching kids to care for nature. Planting trees, building nesting sites for birds (storks, swallows and others) is his favorite spare time activity.

For the past 16 years, John has built expertise, relationships, and a keen market sense of the consumer wireless and cloud technology space. With over 100 global product launches under his belt, John’s role at Powercanister is to drive the go-to-market strategy and enable Powercanister to successfully launch green, sustainable products globally - enabling the company to bring “light” to all corners of the world.
Prior to joining the Powercanister leadership team, John held various global product, marketing and communication roles at Seagate Technology, HTC, HERE ®, and Motorola. In these roles he was accountable, adaptable, customer centric, and worked closely with cross functional teams, vendors, and members of the media to generate positive share of voice, marketing and branding for a variety of products. 
John’s greatest strengths are his creativity, ability to turn product features into stories, and leadership. He thrives on challenges, particularly those that include exciting new products that expand the company’s reach and create rich consumer experiences.
John holds a Bachelor of Business Administration degree with a double major in Marketing and Information Technology from the University of Iowa.




Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't quite ready to purchase one of our perks that doesn't mean you can't help and be involved!

  • Help us by getting the word out! Share our project with your friends and family over social media and make a difference. Simply use the Indiegogo share tools or post to your own social media circles. It's simple and would really mean a lot to us.

A true inventor, Iuliu has been working on several utility patents for the past several years.He invented the generator by mistake, while wanting to create a mini current stabilizer for his electromagnetic wave meter device.Working with Alex for the last four years, he developed and raised Powercanister to a different level, giving the opportunity for this technology and these products to exist.Iuliu currently lives in Romania and holds a Bachelor's degree from the University of Economic Studies, in Bucharest, Romania.



The son of an electrical engineer, Alex has always had an interest in electricity and how things work. By the age of 6, he had already built his first radio and by the time he was 18, he had finished blueprint drawings and managed the electrical construction of an entire dental lab. Prior to his work on the Powercanister technology, Alex has been a serial entrepreneur, proud Hungarian, and an involved community member. In 2010, Alex started the largest privately owned Hungarian social networking site Magyar Vagyok.In 2009, Alex founded the Internet service provider 12Global in Chicago. 12Global is a Gigabit high speed Internet company that provides services to large, midsize, and smaller MTU (multi-tenant units) in Chicago, providing them internet service as well as TV if needed.His passion for technology, his Hungarian heritage, and his community are what sets Alex apart from the crowd as a true innovator, leader, and entrepreneur. Alex relocated to Chicago from Romania in 2000 and holds a combined bachelor/master’s degree in electrotechnics and an additional master’s degree in business administration from the University Politehnica Timisoara in Romania.








Zoltan is a dentist and an amateur electronist. He is more of a thinker than a talker. He pays big attention to the smallest details. The Powercanister look and feel was perfected by Zoltan including the ability to stack the units, the inventive way to connect the units together to create more power as well as the implementation of Feng Shui Bagua signs on the outside of the box. No detail was overlooked during the design.Zoltan returned to Romania after a few years living in Canada and the USA and is preserving his heritage by building a social network site around the Hungarian cultural values.Zoltan is also involved in many environmental projects and placing a special emphasis on teaching kids to care for nature. Planting trees, building nesting sites for birds (storks, swallows and others) is his favorite spare time activity.



For the past 16 years, John has built expertise, relationships, and a keen market sense of the consumer wireless and cloud technology space. With over 100 global product launches under his belt, John’s role at Powercanister is to drive the go-to-market strategy and enable Powercanister to successfully launch green, sustainable products globally - enabling the company to bring “light” to all corners of the world.Prior to joining the Powercanister leadership team, John held various global product, marketing and communication roles at Seagate Technology, HTC, HERE ®, and Motorola. In these roles he was accountable, adaptable, customer centric, and worked closely with cross functional teams, vendors, and members of the media to generate positive share of voice, marketing and branding for a variety of products. John’s greatest strengths are his creativity, ability to turn product features into stories, and leadership. He thrives on challenges, particularly those that include exciting new products that expand the company’s reach and create rich consumer experiences.John holds a Bachelor of Business Administration degree with a double major in Marketing and Information Technology from the University of Iowa.







Other Ways You Can Help

 If you aren't quite ready to purchase one of our perks that doesn't mean you can't help and be involved!  Help us by getting the word out! Share our project with your friends and family over social media and make a difference. Simply use the Indiegogo share tools or post to your own social media circles. It's simple and would really mean a lot to us.

story:
Short Summary

  • Corgi Cycles was formed by founder Cole Reece, when he realized what the world needed to solve all of its issues were more corgis and bikes. By combining the two and putting them on as many things as possible, Cole tries to fix the world one item at a time.
  • This campaign will raise funds to offset production costs for the company.
  • Corgis and bikes are two of the greatest things in the world, bringing happiness to millions of individuals, and Corgi Cycles can bring that happiness to many more people.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are asking for $500 (the minimum ) in order to order and produce all of our planned products for Corgi Cycles.
  • Each perk will get you an item from Corgi Cycles for completely free! Furthermore, you will get the items from the previous perk levels!
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, we will still use whatever funds we get to produce as many items as we can.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Don't have money to contribute? Just share and promote the page on your facebook/twitter/other social media!

story:
We aim to raise £1000 to pay visa fees for aslyum-seekers from Pakistan in Thailand who are threatened with forced repatriation, and to help towards medical expenses and other necessities. In the picture above Lily is with two of her three boys.

I have set this up because the situation is driving me crazy and I need to do something positive about it. Lily has been arrested in Thailand in a crack-down on illegal immigrants. [http://www.cbn.com/cbnnews/world/2015/March/Tha...] She is one of hundreds of Christian refugees from Pakistan who have gone to Thailand to claim asylum with the United Nations Refugee Agency. Unfortunately her visa has run out because she could not afford to renew it and her husband and son are in the same situation. If they get sent back to Pakistan they could be facing people who have made death threats against them. They will also be broke because they used their money to flee to Thailand. Lily's whole extended family are in a tricky situation, two have asylum in the UK but the others have either been arrested or have been forced into hiding - there are about 40 people in all. I don't know exactly how many because various babies have been born since it all started. I'll try and fill in the details of what happened in updates to this site. In the meantime let's do something positive about this. We can't solve all the problems but money can help and every little bit helps so don't be shy of giving even a little.

Btw Lily is a 'failed asylum-seeker'. She came to the UK with her two-year-old son to claim asylum but was rejected. I visited her in Yarlswood, the detention centre, before she was deported. She told them the plain truth but the authorities had to make a judgement and they decided on balance that it was OK to send her back. They were right in the sense that she was not murdered, but the harassment continued and the police have been part of the problem. Anyway the fear-factor went up a level and now she and her entire extended family have either fled Pakistan or are in hiding. Thailand is not like the UK. There is no government money for asylum-seekers and they are forbidden from working. They survive on what little they bring with them and the kindness of the Church. The people at the UN office are sympathetic but have nothing to give them. Lily's case is in a queue - she has been offered an interview to assess her claim in 2018. That's right, 2018. This is the best that the most important international refugee agency of the great United Nations can offer. Another aid agency, the charity Caritas, said they had food for refugees, so they went to their place in Bangkok, but the fares for transport were higher than the cost of the food they were given.

I wish the politicians who say they care about human rights, or the charities set-up to help those in need, would sort this out. It seems crazy that it's left to friends to do a whip-round using this Indiegogo site. But that is all I could think of.


This is from a letter Lily's sister wrote to the Red Cross:

Dear Sir / Madam,

Since the beginning of March hundreds of Christian refugee seekers in Thailand have been arrested. The police come in the early morning arresting women, children, and men. My main fear is the safety of my family . My youngest sister [Lily] her husband and three children were arrested by police because their visa were expired. My other family members are in hiding, they are afraid of being arrested because they do not have valid visa for Thailand. Many Pakistani Christians who fled to Thailand having grave financial difficulties. Fear of police raids mean some have to move accommodation and pay new security deposits. Some refugees suffer trauma-related conditions due to persecution back in Pakistan, and fear to suffer more if they are forcibly deported back to Pakistan. We fear also abuse by police who have idea they can do anything, especially when a family has girls. I thoughts that the fear and danger we faced in our country will be accept by the UNHCR and later on my family can start a new life in another country, to live a life without any fear and threats. Every human being wants to lives a normal life and we wish too.

............

Update 13/04/2015

Efforts are being made to get Lily and her two children released from detention. I am waiting for news on that as communication is not easy at the moment. Her relatives are worried about the affect on the children in particular but are trying to make sure none of the others get detained. Conditions are very difficult. So many people are crammed into a single space that there is not enough room for everyone to lie-down on the floor to sleep at night. Very little privacy. Guards not respecting detainees.

story:
Conjure Campaign


  • Amid the overfamiliar landscape of grocers, coffee shops and historic churches of Durham, NC, stands an enigmatic structure… a house of conjure, bearing the perplexing name of Thaumaturgy 777. It’s proprietor is Magus, a musician, poet, occultist and Conjure Coach. He works with select, private clients to create strategic, innovative solutions to a variety of problems, both magickal and mundane. 

    Steeped in two decades of practice with the tarot, astrology and ritual, Magus uses a diversity of methods to peer onto the astral plane to gather information, identify objectives and manifest those goals on the material. Standing in the gap between the witch doctor and the life coach, working at the crossroads where Hoodoo, Pagan and Ceremonial Magick meet, Magus helps intrepid individuals to a deep place of understanding, with a new set of skills from which to draw.

    Magus is an initiate of The Hermetic Order of the Golden Dawn, a graduate of Catherine Yronwode’s Hoodoo Rootwork Correspondence Course and he’s versed in various other Pagan practices of spell work and divination. As a life coach, he is educated through Robbins-Madanes Training.

    Established in 2010, Thaumaturgy 777 is an exclusive supply house of occult goods, offering up the finest in custom materia magica, those requisite articles of ritual magick... candles, books, powders, incenses, herbs, oils and curios. 


What You Get... What Thaumaturgy 777 Gets... 


  • It's time to expand the shop and the goal is $12,000. 
  • The funds will be used to purchase inventory, new shelving, furniture, a second computer and salary for an employee. Its also time to upgrade to an actual cash register ;-)
  • You get to be a very special part of this radical overhaul and you'll get some really exciting, exclusive stuff for yourself at the same time! 
  • Logically, the first concerns are always rent, bills and inventory. Beyond that, the financial contributions will go to the items that are needed most, in a sensible order. 
  • If the goal is surpassed, then all additional funds will go to the next project, which is a Pagan community center, called Heka House, named after Hekate, the Goddess of witchcraft and heka, a term that means magick and the liminal spaces, between the worlds. The building that Thaumaturgy 777 already occupies is itself, a large and liminal world unto itself, being highly ideal for such a venture. The vision is to turn this space into a place where various groups can meet and those in need can receive whatever immediate assistance we might be able to provide or point in the direction of. This might be as simple as sharing a hot meal or giving someone a ride to a doctor or the Food Bank. 


The Impact

  • This is a small business in the truest sense of the word. It's a chance for you to be a champion for the little guy, helping many to experience some real magick, devoid of Hollywood froufrou and sensational commercialism. The only other such shops are all more than 45 minutes away, in any direction. There's nothing like 777, anywhere else in Durham. 
  • Thaumaturgy 777 is fast approaching its 5th year in business. 5 years seems to be the magick number for businesses and I will be there this summer. There have been really good times and some exceedingly stressful times, even where it looked like I wouldn't make it at all, no matter what I did. Yet, the rough weather has been harbored and the future looks quite bright, indeed. There are lots of new things opening up right around the shop, such as Cocoa Cinnamon, a very popular coffee shop and Gregoria's Cuban Steakhouse is a fabulous eatery, right across the street. Only a fraction of a mile from 9th Street, the shop is now surrounded by great new businesses like Panera Bread, Harris Teeter and more. 
  • I started Thaumaturgy 777 out of my bedroom in 2010 and used a sum of personal funds (less than $3000) to start out in a tiny, two room physical location, less than a year later. After almost a year in that little space, Thaumaturgy 777 was upgraded (through some generous mojo from Jupiter) to a 3,600 square foot house on Hillsborough Rd in Durham. The shop is currently only two of those rooms but now there is a dedicated Temple space where I do private ritual and workings for patrons, there is a lab where the incenses, teas, bath mixes, oils, etc are mixed and a private office where I meet with patrons for conjure coaching. Additionally, I live in the building and there is a very large conference room where large workshops and group rituals are held. 


Risks & Challenges

  • Indiegogo says I should honestly assess the risks of this, since people appreciate transparency. I know that's true. So, here it is. Honestly, I have done everything the hard way, from day one. Part of that is a lack of business training; I went into this blind and taught myself all of it. Part of it is a thick-headed stubbornness that is both a blessing and a curse. My Cancer sun and Virgo ascendent means that it has to be my way and really, that is the only reason the products are as good as they are and the services are as solid as they are. Yet, I realize that any strength becomes a weakness, when taken too far. Yet, I am constantly reading, studying, asking questions and petitioning my Deities for aid. All this keeps me on track and most people would have folded by now, yet I am still here... against all odds. 


Other Ways You Can Help


Some of you are just not able to contribute right now, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • You'll be doing me a HUGE service if you'll take just a moment and share this on your Facebook or other social media site, or if you will put it on your own website or pass it to a list serve, absolutely anything you can think of, it will be highly appreciated. Indiegogo has share tools! So, check those out!
  • You can also volunteer time to come in and help. There's always a lot to do here. 
  • Other things needed are yard work and greenery (indoor and out), a carpenter to build shelving and any kind of furniture that is in good shape, as in tables, couches, folding chairs, etc. I also can use the expertise of anyone who understands Quickbooks or can help me streamline the operation in any way, be that legal issues, packaging, supplier tips or anything useful, in any way. 
  • Most of all, make any contribution you can, however small, because they add up quickly and share the link for this! I thank you from the bottom of my heart for helping me to make an old-fashioned conjure house come alive in Durham!

Some of you are just not able to contribute right now, but that doesn't mean you can't help:  You'll be doing me a HUGE service if you'll take just a moment and share this on your Facebook or other social media site, or if you will put it on your own website or pass it to a list serve, absolutely anything you can think of, it will be highly appreciated. Indiegogo has share tools! So, check those out!
You can also volunteer time to come in and help. There's always a lot to do here. 
Other things needed are yard work and greenery (indoor and out), a carpenter to build shelving and any kind of furniture that is in good shape, as in tables, couches, folding chairs, etc. I also can use the expertise of anyone who understands Quickbooks or can help me streamline the operation in any way, be that legal issues, packaging, supplier tips or anything useful, in any way. 
Most of all, make any contribution you can, however small, because they add up quickly and share the link for this! I thank you from the bottom of my heart for helping me to make an old-fashioned conjure house come alive in Durham!

story:
Short Summary

Josh Greenman, a Returned Peace Corps Volunteer was requested by a Mayan women's cooperative while serving in Guatemala to educate and train them how to make wine using local elderberries. He helped them despite only having bread yeast and lacking proper equipment. He did his best to teach the women basic fundamentals of the process but had neither the time or equipment to finish things before his term of service ended, in addition to this the little wine that was produced turned out terrible given the sensitivity of wine.

Since the end of his service in early 2014, he began graduate school in the United States but remained dedicated to finishing the project with the women. During his first semester in 2014, he developed the project further and created a proposal for a class assignment. He then reached out to a colleague and a community development professional and also an experienced home-brewer who specializes in fruit wine to join him in carrying out the project properly. 

Upon verifying over the phone that the women still wanted to produce wine, the three have began organizing everything to go down Chimente this summer. The three will travel to Guatemala and carry out this wine project to teach the women of Flor de Maria how to make wine over the course of three weeks. They will also set the women up with proper equipment for making and bottling the wine. 

Through this project, the women will work with a distributor to sell the wine throughout the country and are estimated to be able to produce up to 300 bottles of win a year. These sales will increase their hourly income from $1 to $3 for time spent on production.

What We Need & What You Get

We need a total of $5,000 in order to cover transportation, room, and board costs associated with the trip.

  • Transportation (Flight/Car) for 3 round trip airfare tickets from Chicago to Guatemala City and transportation within the country - $2,500
  • Room & Board for 3 to cover hotel, food, and incidentals for 21 days- $2,000
  • Equipment - $500
  • We pay 18% in fees charged by Indiegogo - $900 if we reach our target 
  • Funds will still go towards these items even if the target is not reached.
If the target is reached, additional funding will go towards our 2nd trip down in 6 months where we teach the women how to bottle. 
An example of equipment is:
  • Camden tablets (for prepping the wine for fermentation)
  • Corker
  • Bottles
  • Hydrometer
  • Phosphates
  • Thermometer
  • PH meter
  • Hydrometer
  • Scales
  • Carboys
  • etc.

The Impact

This project is extraordinarily important for female empowerment and community development. The additional knowledge, skills, and money will allow them to be able to help bring themselves, their families, and their community out of poverty. Currently these women hold multiple jobs, support their families and households. Since 2007 they have been producing jams and shampoos that are sold across Guatemala but the value earned from these items only makes them $1/hr and they only work 12 hours a week because of family and other responsibilities. With the incorporation of wine to their products sold, it is estimated that their hourly income will raise to $3/hr.

This project is wonderful because these women are the ones with the drive to produce wine and once it is done, the women will be self sufficient to continue making wine on their own. This women WANT to make wine to improve their livelihoods but need our help to learn how to do this.

Risks & Challenges

We face very little obstacles outside of financial costs with this project since it is small scale and nothing is harmful in the wine making process. What this means is that even if the women do mess up in the process, the wine won't hurt anyone but will instead just taste bad. This means they will need to perfect the art to be more successful.

Aside from money, main challenge faced in this project is yeast. Currently the only yeast that can be found in Guatemala is bread yeast which ferments much faster and has a less pleasant flavor compared to regular brewing yeasts. One way we will try to get around this is by arranging an import service with the local Missionary Relief Aid store. We will attempt to persuade the store to import proper yeast for the women to purchase as it is needed. Once the process takes off though, we hope to travel down again with additional equipment to allow the cooperative to grow their own yeast from what is brought down.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the finances to help out this great cause, this doesn't mean you can't still help us out!

Please, share this Indiegogo cause with everyone you know and on your social media pages. Sharing this page and cause will increase our exposure and the chances of reaching out to someone who can donate.

Thank you for everything,

Josh, Mark, Shaun, and the women at Flor de Maria!

The three will travel to Guatemala and carry out this wine project to teach the women of Flor de Maria how to make wine over the course of three weeks. They will also set the women up with proper equipment for making and bottling the wine. 
Through this project, the women will work with a distributor to sell the wine throughout the country and are estimated to be able to produce up to 300 bottles of win a year. These sales will increase their hourly income from $1 to $3 for time spent on production.   What We Need & What You Get We need a total of $5,000 in order to cover transportation, room, and board costs associated with the trip.

Transportation (Flight/Car) for 3 round trip airfare tickets from Chicago to Guatemala City and transportation within the country - $2,500
Room & Board for 3 to cover hotel, food, and incidentals for 21 days- $2,000
Equipment - $500
We pay 18% in fees charged by Indiegogo - $900 if we reach our target 
Funds will still go towards these items even if the target is not reached.

If the target is reached, additional funding will go towards our 2nd trip down in 6 months where we teach the women how to bottle. 

An example of equipment is:
Camden tablets (for prepping the wine for fermentation)
Corker
Bottles
Hydrometer
Phosphates
Thermometer
PH meter
Hydrometer
Scales
Carboys
etc.

  
The Impact
 This project is extraordinarily important for female empowerment and community development. The additional knowledge, skills, and money will allow them to be able to help bring themselves, their families, and their community out of poverty. Currently these women hold multiple jobs, support their families and households. Since 2007 they have been producing jams and shampoos that are sold across Guatemala but the value earned from these items only makes them $1/hr and they only work 12 hours a week because of family and other responsibilities. With the incorporation of wine to their products sold, it is estimated that their hourly income will raise to $3/hr.
This project is wonderful because these women are the ones with the drive to produce wine and once it is done, the women will be self sufficient to continue making wine on their own. This women WANT to make wine to improve their livelihoods but need our help to learn how to do this.
Risks & Challenges
 We face very little obstacles outside of financial costs with this project since it is small scale and nothing is harmful in the wine making process. What this means is that even if the women do mess up in the process, the wine won't hurt anyone but will instead just taste bad. This means they will need to perfect the art to be more successful.
Aside from money, main challenge faced in this project is yeast. Currently the only yeast that can be found in Guatemala is bread yeast which ferments much faster and has a less pleasant flavor compared to regular brewing yeasts. One way we will try to get around this is by arranging an import service with the local Missionary Relief Aid store. We will attempt to persuade the store to import proper yeast for the women to purchase as it is needed. Once the process takes off though, we hope to travel down again with additional equipment to allow the cooperative to grow their own yeast from what is brought down.
    Other Ways You Can Help If you don't have the finances to help out this great cause, this doesn't mean you can't still help us out!
Please, share this Indiegogo cause with everyone you know and on your social media pages. Sharing this page and cause will increase our exposure and the chances of reaching out to someone who can donate.
Thank you for everything,
Josh, Mark, Shaun, and the women at Flor de Maria!

story:
We are Torrie and Taryn Wilson, the creators and siblings behind Three Hands. We've been hustling our whole lives together and have finally taken the initiative to do something substantial with our dreams which is opening our own restaurant and bar. 

Three Hands will be a new late-night restaurant and bar serving up delicious snacks, house-made cocktails and good times until 2am every night in the Dufferin and Dundas area of Toronto.  We want to bring love and soul to the neighbourhood through our passion for fresh food and good times.  We have been working so hard at reaching our goal but have met some road bumps along the way and need your support! 


                                             Our signature fried chicken...

                                              
                                                    Don't it look so good....

As with any new business starting out, financing is always difficult and Three Hands needs YOUR help raising funds in order to get our establishment off the ground! The funds raised with this crowdfunder will go towards start up costs and for the restaurant. We want to be prepared for any obstacles we have to face. Every little bit helps and will not go unnoticed! We love the support we're already receiving, and have amazing perks for anyone who donates and helps us open up our dream restaurant. 

             Even if you can't donate, please share this with family and friends!
                                                    FOLLOW US ON INSTAGRAM
                                                      @THREEHANDSTORONTO

                                                                             XO
                                                                 LOTS OF LOVE,
                                                                 THREE HANDS

story:
X-Dom - Low Cost solution in House Automation


  • Home automation device that learns your schedule and reduces your electric bill.
  • X-Dom is a domotic solution to automate houses in a simple and inexpensive way. 
  • The project of  italian "start-up" Aeromechs, aims to revolutionize the market of home automation with the marketing of the X-Dom, a product that wants to be accessible to all.
  • This is a small device, similar to a mobile phone charger, which is implemented in the electricity grid, allowing remote control of existing electrical components at home.

Aeromechs debut a new video for X-dom.


The plot of the video follows three kids, who want to help their grandmother with the basic functionalities of the house, like the electricity, the tv or even the alarm system. Following this, the kids turn into their favorite super heroes, like storm character from the x-men, in order to help their grandmother and give her the quality of life that she deserves.

It is a funny and dynamic way of showing that everyone can control X-Dom, as it is easy to install and extremely cheap. 





What can X-Dom control?

Through an application for mobile devices, such as "smartphones" or "tablets", the latest product of "start-up" Italian, Aeromechs, enables control of electric lights, air conditioning, television, alarms and other equipment.


  1. The Lights




2.    The Alarm System




3.  Your Television




4.  The AC



You can control X-Dom from:


  1. Laptop
  2. Smartphone
  3. Tablet


With a help of an App!





History of X-Dom


We began in 2011 and it’s been a challenge everyday, since that very first idea of setting up something different.
Our Team is composed mainly by Engineers from Naples. 
Currently we are involved in many projects, in the fields of electronics, informatics and automation engineering… and we’re planning to move towards new business areas.
Aeromechs core business consists in the implementation of high-tech systems for “energy management” strategies, applied to different technological fields, such as aeronautics and domotics. Particularly, we’re involved in European and National projects referred to this topic.
X-Dom is the first product of Aeromechs.

The X-Dom leverages the existing electrical connection, so there are not necessary on-site works or alteration or purchase appliances adapted to operate the system, since X-Dom adopts a data transmission technique that eliminates the need for additional cabling .




It is composed by:


– 1 Master module which is a device connected to the electricity grid that has an Ethernet port and an infrared input . The ethernet port interfaces to a wi-fi router to be able to converse with Tablet PC / Smartphone, while through the entrance you can store the infrared command codes from various remote controls (eg, air conditioner, stereo , TV) within of the module.

– Slave modules which is a device connected to the electricity grid that deals with turn on / off lights (or other) , or send control codes to the infrared equipment . .
– Software for Tablet PC / Smartphone allows the end user to control various devices present in a room, after performing an initial procedure of registration of the commanders of the various devices .



Cheap & Easy


In other words, it’s easy, simple and it’s not expensive! The costumer will be able to control from his smartphone/tablet the Air conditioner, the lights as well controlling the security. More important, this can be done easily and at low cost.
Currently the life cycle of the product is in the prototype stage.




Target 


In addition to being more affordable compared to other home automation products on the market, the great advantage of X-Dom is exempt from the technical intervention on site. The user can control everything remotely, is cheap and it is not necessary to call an expert to install it.

The "software" is free and easy to use, Target for families since everyone can install it.


Where we are?

We’ve been working on X-Dom  product for 2 years. The X-Dom that you see in the video is a working prototype.

With your support, we can bring the X-Dom into homes worldwide. While we’re close to entering production, your contribution will help fund:

  • X-Dom production

  • Production tooling

  • Large component orders

  • Certification

Team 


Finding the right people is a challenge for any endeavor. Success in home automation requires a team of talented, passionate, and motivated designers, engineers, and entrepreneurs. We have already formed a truly awesome team, but we will have to bring in more team members to realize this dream. In fact, we are actively looking for new members to join X-dom and hit the ground running! Check out our website for more information.

Links


  • Official Website
  • Official X-Dom video
  • Facebook
  • Twitter

story:
ABOUT US

We are Maple Mountain Brew Co. and by we, we mean you too! We are a local microbrewery located in the heart of downtown Provo, with deep roots in Utah County. Our whole idea is to bring the best product to the community we love and grew up in, we want to give back to the people that surround us everyday. Since we are giving back to those we love, love is the main ingredient in our beers! We make sure to go the extra mile in our brewing process so that the love and care we take can be tasted through each fresh batch of MMBC beer. By donating you will be helping in creating the foundation of our dream and as we grow you will know you did your part in supporting your neighbors! Don't miss out on the chance to help us make history by becoming the first brewery in Utah County since before Prohibition!

OUR PROCESS

We handcraft beers in small 150-gallon batches under the close attention of our experienced brewers.  MMBC recipes contain only the highest quality ingredients including organic, local (as available), and non-gmo products. These standards combined with the unique process of using only purified sunbaked water and traditional brewing methods, ensures a level of quality that shines no matter the method of storage(bottle, can, keg). Our beers come in tall 22 oz bottles painted with our signature logo and will be on shelves near you soon, but we cant do it without you!

OUR BEERS

Don't worry we will have sessionable beers as well!

PERKS

Donate $100 for this awesome goodies pack featuring a limited edition fillable bottle, pint glass, CoLAB bottle opener and a sticker!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

You can contribute even if you can't donate by spreading word about our campaign! Let others know about Maple Mountain Brew Co by sharing the link on Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter! Scream it from the mountain tops if you have to!


THANK YOU!

story:
First of all i want to apologize for my English if it’s not so good at some points, but i’ll try my best to tell you all about the Responsible Trash Can in the best way i can :)

Also i want to say that this project is fully NON-PROFIT, the Responsible Trash Cans will be earning money only to maintain these machines and to support a new Animal Rescue Center for injured and endangered wild and domestic animals.


I'd like to present a first EVER multifunctional Responsible Trash Can that works ONLY on solar energy!


In countries with hot climate (like Thailand, Brazil, Mexico, etc.) it's sometimes hard for stray animals to find drinkable water. That’s what the Responsible Trash Can will be for! You just put trash in the Responsible Trash Can - and in exchange for you act of kindness, that kept city clean - Responsible Trash Can will pour some amount of water and dry food into the trays that are built into the side of the machine! Even if there’s already enough water and food in the trays - the machine will STILL REMEMBER your effort, and as soon as some water or food will be gone - the Responsible Trash Can will add more to the trays.

 I know, some people sometimes get annoyed with stray animals, but lets not forget that all the stray dogs, cats and other animals are the result of human irresponsibility - and, i hope, we are all agree that no animal should suffer for water or for food just because of said human irresponsibility! Plus, the happier animals are, the more food and water they have - the less aggressive they are! It’s easy!

How it works:


Inside there are four cells:

One big cell for all kinds of garbage. (№ 1)

One cell for plastic (bottles, cups, etc.). (№ 2)

One cell for glass bottles. (№ 3)

And the main operating cell. (№ 4)


Inside of the cells № 1,2,3 are metal containers that will be changed to a clean, washed ones everyday twice a day (every morning and every evening). Also inside of all three cells there are small smoke detectors, in case if someone will throw a lit cigarette, or something like that, in the Responsible Trash Can. Above all three cells there is a container with an emergency water: when any of the smoke detectors will detect smoke - water from the container will prevent the fire. Note that the Responsible Trash Can mostly made of metal and is not flammable, but still we don’t want any smoke there, right? :)


Now, the most important part: OPERATING CELL, what’s inside of it?

  • Batteries, that constantly gather energy from the solar panel above.

  • A computer that runs the machine.


For people:

  • Water cooler, with a holder, that holds a bottle of water for people.

  • Paper cups holder.

  • Coin collector.

 For a coin (like 25 cents) anyone will be able to have fresh cold water in a paper cup.

When a bottle is empty - a small red light will be on, and the machine will not accept any coins.

  • Equipment for an electric outlet.

For a coin anyone will be able to plug in their phones or other devices to a machine for 5 minutes - that should be enough to make a necessary call or send a text message. If 5 minutes not enough - with another coin you can add another 5 minutes and so on! So it will be like public phone...but for your own cell phones! And remember, these machines work ONLY on solar energy! WOW!


For animals:Water tube.

Food tube.

Food and water trays, that will be changed to clean, washed ones twice a day.

Weight sensors: when water or food weight in the trays are lower than needed - weight sensors tell the computer to add more food or water.


How it looks from the outside?


Front side:

On the front side there a three slots: the bigger oval one for the cell № 1 (for all kinds of garbage), and two smaller  round ones for cells № 2 and № 3 (for plastic and glass). Colorful, eye-catching design of the front side will make people to come closer, where they will be able to read all the important information: instructions on how to use this machine, information about the Responsible Trash Can and why is it so useful.


On the top there is a big solar panel.


On the right side (on the upper part of the right side) there are:

  • Coin slots, (one for water and one for the outlet)

  • Water dispenser for people to buy water in paper cups.

  • An electric outlet.



On the lower part of the right side there are food and water tray for animals. 


Left side or back side or both (if visible, if machine doesn’t stand against a wall) - both of those sides will be a paid advertisement space for different companies.

  Parameters of the machine 180cm x 180cm x 90cm.

I’m sure, you understand that the picture - it’s just a quick sketch of how the machine may look like when it’s built, but still design may vary, we’re thinking of other colors (white, orange). Unfortunately we don't have enough money and opportunities to create a nice-looking 3D model of the Responsible Trash Can to show you better how it supposed to look in real life - that's how desperate for your help we are. But design is not the main thing to talk about at the moment; the most important thing right now is to build at least one of these machines - that’s when we will be able to show you how it really looks from the outside and what’s inside, and how responsible the Responsible Trash Cans are :)


Again, i want to remind you, that this is a fully NON-PROFIT project! All the money, that will be earned with these machines by recycling plastic and glass, by selling water in the paper cups, by charging for an outlet usage, by selling advertisement space and by selling the machines to an interested companies - all the money will go to maintain the Responsible Trash Cans and to support a new INNOVATIVE Animal Rescue Center for injured and endangered wild and domestic animals, that will soon be opened and a link to it will appear here.


So, what do we get by creating these machines? The answer is easy!

  1. Happy animals.

  2. Clean cities.

  3. And proud people, that kept animals happy and cities - clean!


As soon as we get enough of your support - we’ll start building the Responsible Trash Cans. We REALLY need your help to build at least 3 first machines to place it in the city to see how it works, what needs to be changed, etc. And as soon as we start building - i’ll be posting photo and video updates on how the process is going. And when the very first machine will be placed in the city street - we’ll make a presentation video with all the explanations and with moments of how people use the Responsible Trash Can during the day.

Every city in the world needs at least one of these machines!

Please, donate or share or both! I really need your support to get this project live!!!


And, please, note, that all rights reserved, and any attempts to copy this machine in any way - will be considered as stealing...and stealing from charity has never been cool and it never will be.

Unfortunately we don't have enough money and opportunities to create a nice-looking 3D model of the Responsible Trash Can to show you better how it supposed to look in real life - that's how desperate for your help we are. But design is not the main thing to talk about at the moment; the most important thing right now is to build at least one of these machines - that’s when we will be able to show you how it really looks from the outside and what’s inside, and how responsible the Responsible Trash Cans are :)Again, i want to remind you, that this is a fully NON-PROFIT project! All the money, that will be earned with these machines by recycling plastic and glass, by selling water in the paper cups, by charging for an outlet usage, by selling advertisement space and by selling the machines to an interested companies - all the money will go to maintain the Responsible Trash Cans and to support a new INNOVATIVE Animal Rescue Center for injured and endangered wild and domestic animals, that will soon be opened and a link to it will appear here.So, what do we get by creating these machines? The answer is easy!
Happy animals.
Clean cities.
And proud people, that kept animals happy and cities - clean!
As soon as we get enough of your support - we’ll start building the Responsible Trash Cans. We REALLY need your help to build at least 3 first machines to place it in the city to see how it works, what needs to be changed, etc. And as soon as we start building - i’ll be posting photo and video updates on how the process is going. And when the very first machine will be placed in the city street - we’ll make a presentation video with all the explanations and with moments of how people use the Responsible Trash Can during the day.Every city in the world needs at least one of these machines!Please, donate or share or both! I really need your support to get this project live!!!And, please, note, that all rights reserved, and any attempts to copy this machine in any way - will be considered as stealing...and stealing from charity has never been cool and it never will be.

story:
Who are we?

We are a writing group trying to turn into a company that will create video games characters in marginalized groups. So people of color, trans people, non binary people, lgbt people, disabled people, neuratypical people, and more!

Though we originally intended to be a publishing company at the time of this indiegogo, our goals have since changed.

Why are we doing this?

Most of us are in marginalized groups so we know what's it like to not get do see yourself. We know how bad that can feel and we don't want anyone else to ever go through that.

Risks

This will no doubt be controversial. It may flop as well. But If we succeed just imagine all the good that we could do? Mainstream media diversified imagine that!

Where is the money going?

The money will be used for the following resources. Name registration, paying of artists, paying of coders,paying of voice over artists, paying of music royalties. Advertisement, and licensing..

story:
My Story

My name is Mikayla Johnson, and I am a lifeguard and a swim instructor, and have been for 5 years. I now attend the University of Idaho, and am training to become a Student Supervisor, in charge of coordinating the university swim lessons. I first got certified through the Treasure Valley YMCA when I was 16, and worked there all through high school. They offered me something positive in a time of need, at a point in my life that would have had negative consequences for my future. We had just moved back to the United States from Spain, my parents were divorced, my mom was unemployed, and I was starting school at a new high school with no friends, and not a lot of confidence. Teaching swim lessons allowed me to positively influence hundreds of lives, and changed mine for the better.

The YMCA is a huge part of mine, and many people in the Treasure Valley’s lives, and now, I want to give back.

According to the Department of Health and Welfare, Idaho has the second highest unintentional drowning rate in the nation for the 1 to 5 year-old age group, second only to Florida. Drowning is the second leading cause of unintentional injury-related death for children between the age of 1 and 14. Nine people drown in the United States every day. Approximately 75% of child drownings occur because of a lapse in adult supervision for less than five minutes. This is an issue very dear to my heart, and I want to work to prevent as many drownings as possible. 

You can help me with that goal.

What You Can Do

Donate! The YMCA is in need of equipment to continue providing high quality swim lessons, and to maintain the aquatic facility for everyone to use. Here are some suggested donations:

  • Goggles: $5
  • Swimsuits: $15
  • Water Noodle: $15
  • Float Belt: $25
  • Water Barbell: $25
  • Group Lessons: $60
  • Private Lessons: $150

The Impact

Having adequate equipment and funds helps the YMCA maintain their philosophy of never turning someone away due to inability to pay. The YMCA also participates in the Make-A-Splash program every year. Through Make a Splash, the USA Swimming Foundation partners with learn-to-swim providers and water safety advocates across the country to provide swimming lessons and educate children and their families on the importance of learning how to swim. Donations allow the YMCA to reach out to more and more of the community each year. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Another opportunity to donate is the YMCA Strong Kids Campaign is an annual fundraising campaign focused on raising much needed resources to support proven YMCA programs that give kids the opportunities they need to reach their full potential: to live healthier, happier lives today, and grow into productive adults in the future. Also, anytime you put you or your family through swim lessons, regardless of which pool, you are helping the fight against drowning!


Thank you for your support!

story:
Hello fellow light workers, earth lovers, and human travelers! We are here to share with you the Crystal Earth Project and our participation in the planting of Crystal Seeds. 


What is the Crystal Earth Project? The Crystal Earth Project is a worldwide peace initiative. Ancient crystal technologies are used to increase and amplify the direct connection between Mother Earth and the human physiology. The project is headed by The Wholeness, a California-based organization devoted to bringing archangelic technologies into our daily lives to support awakening. Crystal Seeds are made of three energetically pure, aligned crystals enclosed in a 27 point copper sphere designed using sacred geometry. The crystals are mined and cut in Brazil to the specifications of the team, and are free of human intention or programming. More information about the Crystal Earth Project can be found HERE.

Where are we going? The mission of the project is to plant these Seeds across the world, in many places of established holy energy, as well as in backyards, forests, and fields, connecting a supportive web. Seeds have been planted in sacred places throughout the globe; Norway, Israel, Hawaii, Peru, Oregon, California, Wyoming, Texas, New Mexico, Nepal, and India. We are heading to our ancestral homelands of France and the UK with the intention of planting two seeds, one in each country near historically holy land. This will bring us to the Scottish highlands and to southern France.

How Do the Seeds Work?  Earth energy enters the seed and spins inside the silent core amplifying  through a vortex. The powerful Earth energy then radiates from the seed. "When Crystal Seeds are planted in the ground, a powerful energy grid is enlivened and becomes more accessible to the human physiology" (The Crystal Earth Project). In other words, by planting the seed within Mother Earth, her spectrum of awakening energy becomes more accessible to us. As each seed is planted it connects with other seeds and other aspects of the crystal grid, elevating the frequency of our human reality into a worldwide increase of harmony and connection. This is the technology that causes a certain string to vibrate on a guitar when the same note is played across the room. This beautiful planet and her inhabitants are quite literally made of the same elements, and we rise together, connected and in natural peace. 

Who Are We? We are mother and daughter with a deep, shared mission in this world to share and spread light. This is a call for service to the beloved planet. We have both been gifted the blessing of a wisdom-keeping tradition of knowledge. This is a very personal project for us - to plant Crystal Seeds in primary places of ancestry, and to honor a cycle by returning to these lands, completing past and offering to future. 

 "I am honoring my own work in this lifetime and also creating an enlivening of future potential by planting in lands that are directly related to my lineage of sacred healing arts. For over 30 years I have centered my work on opening flow within the human physiology, animals, and plants. Experience has revealed that there is only wholeness and that the qualities of harmony and disharmony of wholeness can be respectively increased and decreased, consciously.  Now is the time to offer myself to the enhancement of harmonious flow of the earth for her benefit and for the benefit of all that are sustained and nourished by her." ~ Janet

"I acknowledge a primary life mission - to assist in the revival of the awakened and balanced human through deep connection and communion with the earth and with each other. It is vital to me that I participate as much as possible in helping to create a strong foundation of harmony on this beautiful planet, to make the way a little easier for those who are on the journey back to Self. Crystal grids, ley lines, and energy matrices are a few ways that I have experienced increased amplification of Earth energy. There is nothing more effective for me in clearing the path for awakening than to become harmonious with the energies of the Earth, to ground my physical body, psyche, thoughts, and emotions in the delicious natural world that surrounds me. I believe I am a symptom of the whole, and that this warm connection is growing and rising. I have always loved the crystal realm, spending time in my favorite gem shop as a child would involve me for hours. I later became a jeweler in order to work with these elements. I am aware of their power just as I am aware of the sacred connection between humanity and Earth; the energy of sacred places moves through the elements that create them. We are these elements. As within, so without." ~ Crystal

What is the Funding Structure? We will be combining camping with low-cost shelter and largely preparing our own food during travel, in true backpacker pilgrim style. If we do not raise enough to make the trip but are able to purchase a Seed, we will continue to fundraise until we are able to plant the Seed. Here is our cost breakdown for nineteen days of travel.

Travel and Transportation Costs: $5800.00

Room & Board: $3000.00

Seeds: $2000.00

If this is a project that ignites your heart and you find that your own deep knowingness and remembering is activated, we welcome your energy as an integral part of this sweetly intimate interaction with Mother Earth. And it can't come at a better time than this moment. Even if donating is not right for you, please consider sharing right now with those you love. We are honored to be on this journey with you!

Yours in Galactivation, Elevation, Intention, and Earth-keepership, 

Janet and Crystal
