Have you ever wanted to physically give these gifts out and witness the smiles first hand? Join Heroes In Black on a mission to collect and hand out gifts on Christmas morning to over 6000 at-risk and homeless youth, as well as expecting young mothers and their children currently living in shelters, group homes and community housing across the GTA.
If you’re not able to make the event and just want to donate to this great cause, you can do that here. All donations will go towards gifts from our Holiday Wish List below for youth 0-24 years of age.Drop off and pick ups are available.Event details are here: https://www.facebook.com/events/1728392724055913/#Tickets for this event are availiable here: https://www.eventbrite.ca/e/holiday-heroes-tickets-19384546…To stay up to date with all our events, please like our Facebook page, then click events and then click subscribe: www.facebook.com/heroesinblackPlease email us at heroesinblack@gmail.com if you need to reach us directly and someone will get back to you within 48 hours.Holiday Wish List:- Winter Clothes/Jackets For Ages 0-24- Baby Formula/Food- Diapers (All-Sizes)- Baby Wipes- Giftcards- Books/Journals- Underwear/Socks- Backpacks/School Supplies- Toys ages 0-24- Blankets/Pillows- Instruments- Hygiene Products- Art Supplies**100% of your contribution will go directly towards youth in need across the GTA. Give generously this Holiday season and join us on a mission to turn frowns upside down.****Any extra donations will go towards even more gifts**For more information please visit: Heroesinblack.ca

story:
Never doubt a small group of committed citizens can change the world; indeed it's the only thing that ever has – Margaret Mead

Let’s lead the change!

The Money

$500K will result in our finished technology, with a goal of completing the development in 4 months! But, the stretch goal is $2M+, which would enable Imani to scale up for the pilot countries, integrate with partner banks, finalize partnerships, secure storage, and go LIVE - beginning to transform lives.

The Challenge

Imagine payday has arrived!  After waiting in line for several hours, you’re finally paid, in cash. And then you begin the walk home. Past the locals who will “save” your money for a 20% fee.  Past the prostitutes, who will take your money AND potentially give you a disease.  Past those who may take your money against your will.  Past the villagers and friends, who ask you to give to one of their needs, and you are culturally required to help. And the risks won't end once you make it home.

In the developed world we live in, we never even see our paychecks – it’s immediately deposited into a bank account. 

But in emerging markets, cash is your "paycheck", which you receive publically.  You have no safe place to deposit your money, no way to send money to family, and no way to plan for the future. 

82% of families across the globe have no access to banking. They are The Unbanked.  They have no way to protect their money. Indian, African, Latin, Eastern European, Asian, and many other cultures, send home the majority of their paycheck, which costs them an average of 18% -40% interest!

The Solution

Imani brings financial services to these unbanked. Imani's patented mobile bank is safe, secure, and treats the causes of poverty with only a 1% flat fee, anywhere in the world.

Using a new, push system, Imani provides a fraud free, irreversible, mobile, banking system. At Imani, we deliver a real-time receipt of funds, without transferring any account or phone numbers.

The benefits are vast, and broad-reaching, across multiple beneficiaries and partners.

Non-profits in developing and developed markets will also benefit from the ability to safely, and inexpensively, send their money to the country of their choice, have it arrive in the local currency, to be used in their development and infrastructure projects.

But most of all, Imani believes, the benefits are the social changes. At Imani, we want to alleviate poverty. We want to fight corruption. To provide financial infrastructure and education. To enable people to fulfill their own financial dreams.

All humans are created equal, and security should not be a privilege. Imani will provide hope, resources, and equality to those less fortunate and give them the financial freedom much of the developed world takes for granted.

The Imani Plan

Now is the time! Ghana, one of our 8 pilot countries, is currently seeking mobile banking systems, and August of 2014, stated a desire to move to a ‘cashless society’ within 3 years. They have created an annual mobile money conference, and have appointed Fifi Kwetey, Minister in charge of Financial & Allied Institutions at the Presidency to support this endeavor through legislation.

While not everyone has access to banking or fresh water, they do have cell phones, making it possible for Imani to offer a safe, trusted, inexpensive, cloud based, mobile banking system. (Photo's by Josh Callow.)

The developing world is ripe with opportunity. It is the new business frontier. And mobile is a proven market.

This unprecedented market opportunity is due to both the potential payment volume, and because of the need for basic financial services across these markets.

The Market

In Africa alone, the current mobile payment volume is $40B. According to Ericsson’s June 2014 report, there will be 600 million GSM  (smart phone) subscriptions by the end of 2019, allowing our pilot market to grow from 100m to 750m in the next 5 years.  But only 10 - 22 % of 1.033 billion Africans have a bank account or credit facility. (Image below courtesy of docebo.)

In both Africa and India, the two geographies with existing, established, competitors, the current models pay for agents on the street who manage the transactions.  These armies of agents require high fees, which are prohibitive to the poor, and therefore limit transaction volume and scale.

The Risks

Imani’s primary risk is waiting too long to enter the market, with the risk of inferior products flooding the landscape. The main obstacles to Imani are potential delays due to the time associated with negotiating partnerships in pilot countries.

About Me

I have two, lifelong, passions:

      • Addressing global issues to result in true, lasting, change

      • Technology.  The cutting edge nerdy stuff that has the capacity to affect how we live.

    Imani marries the two, by using the technology for social change. 

    The Board of Advisors

    Why am I doing this?

    The answer is simple, because I must.  For me it’s personal. The mother I watched with the sad eyes on my most recent visit, who kissed her children and laid them on pieces cardboard for the night, is no different from me. I’ve done nothing to deserve my privilege. She’s done nothing to deserve her poverty. I’ve come to terms with the fact that my ability to affect world atrocities is minimal. But, I also know that I CAN impact world injustice. Imani is the one thing I can't not do.

    My drive to make a difference began formulating as a young child, growing up in various developing countries with my family. My parents are the founders of Mercy Ships.  We lived 10 years onboard the Anastasis—the world’s largest non-governmental hospital ship that has operated in developing nations since 1978, impacting more than 1.9 million direct beneficiaries.

    I have the ability to make a difference

    I have the knowledge, the highest level contacts across our pilot countries, the cultural understanding, the technical skills, and the ability to strategize, plan, and deliver Imani. To empower those with less privilege than I, to pursue their own goals. Fulfill their own dreams.

    My career experience is weighted in financial technology and global partnerships with Fortune 100 companies (18 years marketing and strategy consulting to Microsoft, Lloyd’s of London, CBSI, etc.). I also have extensive experience in global education and non-profits. I have managed budgets up to £120M / $240M, and been Chief Marketing Officer of a technology startup for online payments in the Seattle area.

    Technology changes everything

    Imani CTO, Nick Brown, and I have been friends for many years. Nick has extensive experience with startups, and over 25 years working with global financial transaction processing systems. He was member of the Accredited Standards Committee (ASC) X9/F6 Working Group, whose responsibility was to develop national (ANSI) and international (ISO) standards for data security in the financial services industry.  Like me, Nick has dreamt for many years of using his technical skills and expertise to prevent fraud and corruption, and bring financial opportunity to the poor.

    Now is the time

    Together with you and Imani's patented technology and connections, we can make it a reality!

    I, Heidi, and my team, invite you to join us as Imani brings mobile banking to the unbanked. 

    Your donation could change the world.

story:
Unleash your inner vintner—Bring the behind-the-scenes experience and essence of Napa Valley into the comfort of your own home to create wine that is original and distinctly yours. No reservations, VIP access, or experience needed. Just you, a few friends, and your VINOBLENDS KIT.

While working in the restaurant and wine industry for over two decades, I realized that few wine enthusiasts know what goes into making a great wine. 

So in 2007, I created a company that combines the excitement of wine blending, wine tasting, and wine education for small private parties to large corporate events. Our events help wine enthusiasts understand the artistry and science that goes into wine making, allowing them to appreciate the subtle distinctions of a wine; uncorking a new and fun wine tasting experience.

The concept took off and people really enjoy the experience, especially when they get to take their own wine blend home. Now, I want to share this unique experience with wine enthusiasts around the world who can’t attend one of these events.

Not another boring bottle of wine:

Invited over to a dinner party? Don't arrive with another boring bottle of wine. Be the "(wo)man of the hour" and present your lovely host with a VinoBlends kit. And while the lemon-rosemary chicken is roasting, the cheese and spinach pockets are baking, tomato basil soup simmering, and the kids on their iPads, unbox the VinoBlends kit and get blending. Heck, adults deserve fun pre-dinner activities too. 

Blending wine is the process of combining different wine varietals to create a composite that's better than any of the wines separately. The wines blended might be from different varieties, different regions, different wood—and non-wood-aging, different vintages, and even wines made from different fruit.

Did you know? Wine makers don't have to label their wine as a blend as long as 75% of the wine is from a single varietal.

People love the experience of being a winemaker for the day, and VinoBlends delivers this experience in a beautifully packaged kit with everything you need to blend 100% varietals to discover the wine that you enjoy the most—just like the winemakers do at the wineries. 

Blending your own wine can be done in five fun and simple steps:

Each VinoBlends kit will include everything you need to be a winemaker for a day. Here's a sneak peak of the prototype.

 Each kit will include the following items:

  • Three (3) 100% pure varietal wine sourced from an award-winning boutique Napa Valley winery (2013 vintage: Merlot, Cabernet Franc, and Cabernet Sauvignon)
  • One (1) empty wine bottle to bottle and serve your own custom blend
  • One (1) glass graduated cylinder to precisely measure your variations
  • One (1) glass beaker to precisely measure your favorite blend 
  • One (1) glass funnel to make sure you bottle each precious drop
  • One (1) placemat to map out the blending process
  • One (1) VinoBlends wine bottle opener
  • One (1) VinoBlends ballpoint pen
  • One (1) notepad to record your wine tasting journey and preferences
  • One (1) reusable cork to temporarily store your custom blend
  • How-to DVD to walk you through the wine blending steps
  • Introduction and tasting descriptors sheet of the three 100% varietals

We’ve put in a lot of time and resources over the past few months to get to this stage, and we need your help with the final push to get these kits to production and into your hands.

Here are two impactful yet simple ways you can help:

1) Show your support by purchasing a VinoBlends kit! Every dollar will help us get closer to producing the first 2,500 kits. You, our IndieGogo supporters, will get access to the first run of 500 VinoBlends kits, which if we meet our goal will be shipping by late November (arriving just in time for the holidays)!

2) Share this campaign with your friends! #vinoblends #myvino

Tweet about us! Facebook us! View our posts on Instagram!

Here's our short link to share: http://igg.me/at/vinoblends 

We are allocating 500 of the first run of 2,500 kits for our IndieGogo supporters at 10%-60% off the suggested retail price of $169.99. 

Here’s a breakdown of the rewards:

Thank you for visiting our IndieGogo, and please support our campaign. Help us bring the behind-the-scenes experience and essence of Napa Valley into the comfort of your own home to create wine that is original and distinctly yours. No reservations, VIP access, or experience needed—just you, a few friends, and your VinoBlends kit.

Risks and challenges

Shipping: We regretfully cannot ship our kits to Pennsylvania, Texas, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, Mississippi, and Utah. Shipping in California will be roughly $25-$28, for all other US states shipping will be roughly $30-$33.

Production: This will be our very first run of VinoBlends kits. Possible risks include delays due to wine bottling issues, or a delay in packaging or kit supply orders. If any issues arise, we will communicate with supporters and update you on a new ship by date.

Fulfillment: Shipping a kit with wine and fragile materials across the U.S. will be a challenge. We're currently working with a Bay Area company to design a sturdy and safe package so the kit arrives on your doorstep in one piece. We're still working on shipping cost, but we'll have that information soon. We'll post an update once we secure the best rate.

story:
Hope Car Wash of Dallas/Fort Worth

Thank you for visiting our page. If you have a moment, please give us some of your time and learn about Hope Car Wash!

My name is Alex Anderson and my wife and I live in downtown Dallas. We have only been residents of Dallas for a few months, but shortly after we arrived, we couldn’t help but notice the large homeless population in our city. 

After several encounters, we came to the conclusion that a large portion of these people have desires and goals that far-exceed receiving spare change. Several of the people we have met are more excited to talk about job opportunities than they are to receive donations. These are the people that we want on our team.

We want to combine the explosive service-on-demand market with civil service. We want to make our community a more positive place for people of all walks of life, but most importantly, we want to change lives by providing new opportunities to people who haven't given up on themselves or their goals.

Hope Car Wash will allow these individuals, who are able and willing to perform physical work, to improve their lives. We will provide incentive based pay, work uniforms with complimentary laundry service, and daily meals to individuals who want to work. Compensation will be a direct reflection of productivity. This structure, along with one property manager (per site) providing direction and leadership, will help to inspire these individuals to improve their lifestyles. 

Structural Outline:

  • We will create partnerships with local commercial and residential properties that will allow us to rent space within their parking structures.
  • After a select few initial team members are operational, we will put our screening process in place. This will allow us to ensure that our new team members are capable of performing their operational duties, as well as help us establish a starting point from which to monitor their progress.
  • With an initial team of 2 to 4 individuals and one property manager per facility, customers would be able to drop their vehicles off at a designated location for pick up, or provide their vehicle's location and license plate number so that the team could perform a Quick Wash.
  • The cost of car washes will be determined on a per-facility basis to account for operational direct costs, as well as a flat revenue figure for the team member(s) washing the vehicle. Overhead will be applied depending upon the startup costs per site. The average cost per wash, based on industry and local market analysis, will be $20 for a basic exterior hand wash and wheel polish / $70 for a basic detail. Value-add items, such as window and tire treatments, will be included in the service offering list within our unique mobile application that will begin production after the successful launch of our indiegogo campaign. Please refer to the Risks and Challenges section to have your security concerns addressed.

Initial Requirements:

  • $4,000 - $5,000 for a strong marketing campaign. This will likely be outsourced to a professional marketing firm to optimize web presence and social media influence.
  • $12,000 - $15,000 for a work truck, trailer, and water tank/pump to haul equipment and employees to sites. (2008 Ford Ranger and used landscaping trailer)
  • $3,000 - $5,000 for startup fees, time, and resources required to set up meetings with property managers/commercial real estate owners (Lincoln Harris Properties, CBRE, Trammell Crow, etc..).
  • $2,000 - $3,000 for initial fees associated with recruiting, purchasing work clothing, lunches, and other miscellaneous thru steady state.
  • $4,000 - $5,000 for contract deposits. In the conversations that we have had with professionals in the Dallas/Fort Worth commercial real estate market, we are expecting to create monthly short-form contracts that provide us with a designated area at a set rate. The space allotted will be subject to change based on amendments to the agreements. 
  • $2,000 - $10,000 to provide operating capital to local homeless shelters that will ultimately be housing our employees until they are able to find a new living space.

Investor Return:

Our return profile will initially consist of free car wash packages, as well as weekly updates on our employees. Keep in mind that our main objective is to help people change their lives. We will show you the progress that our employees are making every week, and will establish channels of communication between employees and investors so that the people that you are helping know who you are and are provided with personal incentive to remain in the program.

The Impact:

Given the proper attention to detail, and sufficient support to reach steady state, Hope Car Wash has the potential to hedge the effects of poverty in our beautiful city. After streamlining our process in Dallas, we intend to spread our presence into every major city in the United States.

Risks & Challenges:

Trust: Our main challenge will be developing trust amongst our clients. To help alleviate initial concerns, our initial offerings list will only consist of exterior hand washes, tire/wheel cleaning, and window treatments. Once a property manager feels comfortable enough with a team at one of our locations, we will add in our second level of offerings to customers. This will also help facilitate the marketing campaign, as customers will be able to see the quality and simplicity of service provided by Hope Car Wash.

Operational Space: Our second challenge will be establishing contracts with properties, as companies will likely want to see established legitimacy before executing contracts. However, this site will be our initial source of credibility. So will the soon to be executed contract with the Olympus Properties (because I won't give up until they say yes).

We also intend to approach local parking lot owners, who have lots in popular tourist areas (West End, Arts District), so that we can operate through the weekend.

It is important to understand that this company will benefit everyone involved. These challenges will be overcome with your help.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are numerous ways to assist the Hope Car Wash campaign, beyond cash donations:

  • Please share this page on social media and encourage your friends and family to take a moment to read our campaign.
  • Please don’t hesitate to reach out to us if you have any comments or ideas that could help us achieve our goal. We will all be learning together, and Hannah and I can't wait for you to join the Hope Car Wash team!

Thank you,

-Hannah and Alex Anderson
story_txt:
Hope Car Wash of Dallas/Fort Worth
Thank you for visiting our page. If you have
a moment, please give us some of your time and learn about Hope Car Wash!
My name is Alex Anderson and my wife and I
live in downtown Dallas. We have only been
residents of Dallas for a few months, but shortly after we arrived, we couldn’t help but notice the large homeless population in our city. 
After several encounters, we came to the conclusion
that a large portion of these people have desires and goals that far-exceed receiving
spare change. Several of the people we have met are more excited to talk about
job opportunities than they are to receive donations. These are the people that we want on our team.
We want to combine the explosive
service-on-demand market with civil service. We want to make our community a
more positive place for people of all walks of life, but most importantly, we
want to change lives by providing new opportunities to people who haven't given
up on themselves or their goals.
Hope Car Wash will allow these individuals,
who are able and willing to perform physical work, to improve their lives. We
will provide incentive based pay, work uniforms with complimentary laundry
service, and daily meals to individuals who want to work. Compensation will be a
direct reflection of productivity. This structure, along with one property manager (per site)
providing direction and leadership, will help to inspire these individuals to
improve their lifestyles. 
Structural Outline:

We
     will create partnerships with local commercial and residential properties
     that will allow us to rent space within their parking structures.
After
     a select few initial team members are operational, we will put our
     screening process in place. This will allow us to ensure that our new team
     members are capable of performing their operational duties, as well as
     help us establish a starting point from which to monitor their progress.

With
     an initial team of 2 to 4 individuals and one property manager per
     facility, customers would be able to drop their vehicles off at a
     designated location for pick up, or provide their vehicle's location and
     license plate number so that the team could perform a Quick Wash.


The
     cost of car washes will be determined on a per-facility basis to account
     for operational direct costs, as well as a flat revenue figure for the
     team member(s) washing the vehicle. Overhead will be applied depending
     upon the startup costs per site. The average cost per wash, based on
     industry and local market analysis, will be $20 for
     a basic exterior hand wash
     and wheel polish / $70 for
     a basic detail. Value-add items, such as window
     and tire treatments, will be included in the service offering list within
     our unique mobile application that will begin production after the
     successful launch of our indiegogo campaign. Please refer to the Risks and Challenges section to have your security concerns addressed.


Initial Requirements:


$4,000 - $5,000 for a strong marketing campaign. This will likely be outsourced to a professional marketing firm to
     optimize web presence and social media influence.


$12,000 - $15,000 for a work truck, trailer, and water tank/pump to
     haul equipment and employees to sites. (2008 Ford Ranger and used landscaping
     trailer)


$3,000 - $5,000 for startup fees, time, and
     resources required to set up meetings with property managers/commercial real estate owners (Lincoln Harris Properties, CBRE, Trammell Crow, etc..).


$2,000 - $3,000 for initial fees associated with
     recruiting, purchasing work clothing, lunches, and other miscellaneous
     thru steady state.


$4,000 - $5,000 for contract deposits. In the
     conversations that we have had with professionals in the Dallas/Fort Worth
     commercial real estate market, we are expecting to create monthly
     short-form contracts that provide us with a designated area at a set rate.
     The space allotted will be subject to change based on amendments to the
     agreements. 


$2,000 - $10,000 to provide operating capital to
     local homeless shelters that will ultimately be housing our employees
     until they are able to find a new living space.


Investor Return:
Our return profile will initially consist of
free car wash packages, as well as weekly updates on our employees. Keep in
mind that our main objective is to help people change their lives. We will show
you the progress that our employees are making every week, and will establish
channels of communication between employees and investors so that the people
that you are helping know who you are and are provided with personal incentive
to remain in the program.
The Impact:
Given the proper attention to detail, and
sufficient support to reach steady state, Hope
Car Wash has the potential to hedge the effects of poverty in our
beautiful city. After streamlining our process in Dallas, we intend to spread
our presence into every major city in the United States.
Risks & Challenges:
Trust: Our main challenge will be developing trust amongst our clients. To help alleviate
initial concerns, our initial offerings
list will only consist of exterior hand washes, tire/wheel cleaning,
and window treatments. Once a property manager feels comfortable enough with a
team at one of our locations, we will add in our second level of offerings to
customers. This will also help facilitate the marketing campaign, as customers
will be able to see the quality and simplicity of service provided by Hope Car
Wash.
Operational Space: Our second challenge will be establishing contracts with
properties, as companies will likely want to see established legitimacy before
executing contracts. However, this site will be our initial source of
credibility. So will the soon to be executed contract with the Olympus
Properties (because I won't give up until they say yes).
We also intend to approach local parking lot
owners, who have lots in popular tourist areas (West End, Arts District), so
that we can operate through the weekend.
It is important to understand that this company will benefit everyone involved. These challenges will be overcome with your
help.
Other Ways You Can Help
There are numerous ways to assist the Hope Car Wash campaign, beyond cash
donations:


Please share this page on social media and
     encourage your friends and family to take a moment to read our campaign.


Please
     don’t hesitate to reach out to us if you have any comments or ideas that
     could help us achieve our goal. We will all be learning together, and
     Hannah and I can't wait for you to join the Hope
     Car Wash team!


Thank you,
-Hannah and Alex Anderson

story:
The Troops Still Need Our Support

Almost 10,000 U.S. soldiers will remain deployed in Afghanistan through 2016. So there is still a need to support our heroes who are going the distance. And Morning In America™ orange citrus soap is the kind of uplifting little luxury that says they are not forgotten by all of us back home.

Dallas Hudson Natural Soap Co. is a startup seller of eco-friendly Castile bar soaps both men and women can enjoy. It's our mission to refresh and inspire strength with a little something good, clean and simple.

Our goal is to send at least 5,000 bars of Morning In America in care packages to the troops. But whether or not we meet that goal, the soap pledged here will be delivered as promised to Operation Gratitude.


What We Need & What You Get

We are off to a good start selling online after investing in product development and a website. But our personal resources and production capacity are limited.

To realize economies of scale and get Morning In America™ soap on store shelves, additional funding is needed for increased capacity and distribution. A family-owned factory located here in the U.S. has been lined up to make more soap using the same traditional process and natural ingredients. But we need to get the ball rolling with a relatively large order. And we intend for that initial order to include 5,000 to 10,000 bars of Morning In America™ for our troops in Afghanistan.

  • For just $10 we will send one bar of our popular Morning In America™ orange citrus soap to you + one to deployed U.S. soldiers.
  • For $25 we will also send you a classic black t-shirt emblazoned with our "Shower With Greatness" emblem to impress your friends.
  • For $50 you get 3 bars + the T-shirt + 3 bars for the troops.
  • For $100, you get a 6-month supply (10 bars) of Morning In America™  + 10 bars for the troops.
  • For $200 you get a 1-year supply (20 bars) + 20 bars for the troops.


Old School Quality

Dallas Hudson soaps are made using the traditional cold process with up to 85% organic ingredients (which is about as good as soap can get). They contain no SLS or other sulfates, parabens, phthalates, synthetic fragrances, dyes, DEA, EDTA, triclosan, synthetic preservatives, paraffin, tetrasodium etidronate, petrochemicals, or common allergens.

After mixing smaller batches of vegetarian oils and water with lye, a.k.a. sodium hydroxide (a USDA allowed ingredient in organic products), nature takes over to produce a mild, eco-friendly soap. Exfoliants, essential oils and other natural ingredients are added to leave you feeling and smelling great. But before it's ready for sale, Dallas Hudson soap must be aged 4 to 6 weeks. Depending on bathing habits, each fully hardened bar lasts about a month.

The smooth lather and uplifting aroma of our Morning In America™ soap makes it hard not to be hopeful. With the warm color of sunrise it reminds you that and each new day is full of possibilities. Ingredients include saponified vegetarian oils, including palm oil, sunflower oil, coconut oil and olive oil, as well as orange essential oil for color and fragrance.

Eco-Friendly & Cruelty Free

A recent study found that bar soap is much easier on the environment than liquid soap in many important ways, including carbon footprint, ecotoxicity, ozone depletion potential, and eutrophication potential. Liquid soaps require five times more energy for raw material production and nearly 20 times more energy for packaging production than bar soaps do. And on a per-wash basis people use more than six times the amount of liquid soap (by weight) than bar soap.

Because Dallas Hudson soaps are made the old fashioned way, no animal testing is needed to ensure they are safe. In fact, except for our goat milk soaps, all of our products are vegan, containing absolutely no animal by-products.

With Great Soap Comes Great Responsibility

Of course our goal is to earn a living – but not without doing some good while we’re at it. That starts with selling an American made, eco-friendly product as gentle on the Earth as it is on your skin. But it doesn't end there. A fundamental part of our business plan involves supporting important things like:

  • Military Families & Veterans
  • Job Skills Education
  • Mental Health

Our intent is to become a certified B Corporation, weaving social responsibility into the fabric of our organization. B Corps are certified by the nonprofit B Lab to meet rigorous standards of social and environmental performance, accountability, and transparency. Today, there is a growing community of more than 1,000 Certified B Corps from 33 countries and over 60 industries working to include societal benefit, in addition to profit, as a defining element of business success.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone who wants to contribute can do so. But that doesn't mean you can't help in other ways. Please use the share tools available on this page to tell all your Facebook friends and Twitter followers about this opportunity to support the troops using the hashtag #HardFolk .

We sure do appreciate your support … and so will the troops.

story:
Hi, we are CARES and your donations can make a real difference!

CARES is a voluntary organisation which helps and supports unpaid family carers throughout Sandwell. Our aim is to improve the quality of life for all carers living in or caring in Sandwell.  We see carers as people who care for relatives, friends or neighbours of any age with illnesses or disabilities.  We work to increase access for carers and those they look after to services, financial and emotional support and to improve their prospects in the wider community. 

 We are seeking financial support for a Christmas Cabaret event we are holding to celebrate the hard work and acknowledge the sacrifice family carers make  all year round looking after and caring for their family members, friends and neighbours.

The event will be an opportunity for carers and their families to enjoy an evening of entertainment and fun for the whole family, The acts will include singers, dancers, a comedian and musicians. There will be a story-teller and arts activities for the kids. Father Christmas will be coming along to hand out a small Christmas gift to the children.  A buffet and refreshments will also be provided.

To make this a really fantastic evening we need £500.00 towards the costs of hiring professional acts for some quality entertainment. We want to make it an evening to remember. The money will pay for flamenco dancers, a comedian, musicians and kids entertainment on the night. Take a look at the fantastic perks you can get if you make a donation!

We need you to help us make this a really fabulous celebration event!

If you would really like to help but just can't afford to contribute, then please just get the word out there by using the Indiegogo share tools and tell your friends and colleagues.


.

story:
To celebrate my 30-ish with you, we are trying to reserve half the courtyard of the Vestry on November 5th from 6.30pm.  

But I need a bit of help! To reserve the space, the Vestry is asking for a $300 deposit.

Sounds like a lot, but the good part is if you plan on spending at least $15 on food or drinks, then the money you give will go toward your purchases! You just have to let me know what you would like in advance so I can pre-order for you. The Chapel burger is my recommendation because it equals to the $15 fee and the pretzel potato bun is delicious. 

If you are vegetarian or anti-burger, attached is the full menu :)

story:
Us & Annie's

We are Susan and Brianna (or Sue and Bri!) and we're SO CLOSE to owning Annie's Book Stop, a small local book store in West Boylston, MA. This store has been around for 30 years, and as the current owners are looking to partially retire, they want to sell. We've already put a deposit down, and need a little lift to come up with the remaining balance by the 1st of October!

Susan has been working part time at the store for a few years now, and both of us have been customers for many, many years. Annie's is a little oasis for us, as well as many of its loyal customers, and we're going to do anything we can to save it!

As moms, with 6 kids between the two of us, it has taken a lot of time, money, and effort to get this far. We're hoping that you might help us fund this dream of ours, as the possibility of it slipping away is too close for comfort.

What We Need

We need about $5,000 to pay off our remaining balance on the store, and to help us pay rent for October.

If you help us fund this adventure, and we hit our goal, come visit us at the shop in October and we'll help you out with some store credit!

The New Annie's

We have such big plans for Annie's, and hope to bring it back to life and modernize it while still keeping its charm. Some of our most important plans:

  • Create a new children's area, and increase children's book selections.
  • Initiate a more organized, prevalent web presence so people can connect with us.
  • Update the inventory system, so we can more easily help our customers in-store.
  • Create recognizable brand for our Annie's.
  • Apply even more eco-friendly practices to the business.
  • Connect with our community!

Challenges

We've evaluated the risks and challenges of taking this on. There are already business practices put in place that make Annie's easy to run, even passively. We do not intend on being passive, and have very high hopes for increasing sales and making Annie's an even more sought out book store than it already is! We are ready to put in a ton of hard work and elbow grease to get Annie's where we want it to go!

How you can help

  • Donate to the campaign! (Spare change in your car? Willing to bring your lunch instead of buy, or skip pizza night this week? Anything helps, really!)
  • Donate to us in person! Chances are, if you're seeing this, you might know us in some degree. Donate in person and save us the funding site fees!
  • Can't donate? it's okay. Share this campaign! share it directly with people who might want to help! Share it on social media! Share it with your mom and tell her you love us!

story:
Can you fill it?

Arthur Watkins, President and Inventor of the Fill Station® Pillow Kiosk

About the inventor...

The Fill Station® Pillow Kiosk was designed by entrepreneur, retailer and philanthropist, Arthur Watkins.  Arthur spent years hearing complaints from his customers about their flat and uncomfortable pillows.  He was tired of not having a solution and decided it was time for a change. 

Arthur knew that there is no such thing as a "perfect pillow" unless it is designed by the person who is sleeping on it.  As a retailer he knew that other retailers in his industry were struggling.  This is when he decided to invent the Fill Station® Pillow Kiosk.   He invented the program as a way to better connect retailers with those suffering from lack of sleep. The Fill Station allows retailers to utilize the kiosk as a tool to build customized pillows for guests visiting their stores.  

Why it's important to have a custom pillow - Bob's Story:​

How to Build a Pillow:

Help us be a part of your community!

Fill Station® Pillow Kiosk - Map of Fill Station locations

Currently, there are over thirty Fill Station® Pillow Kiosk's stationed across the United States and one in Canada (coming October 16, 2017). Our current goal is to expand globally with the Fill Station Pillow Kiosk - Mobile Edition.  With your help we will be able to build pillows with you and your friends in your community. We are seeking to expand with a more mobile version of our kiosk which will allow Fill Station retailers to deepen their relationships within their communities through fundraisers, parties, home shows, corporate events and more.  

We need your support!

We are growing and asking for your support to push us to the next level in our growth.  We want to expand our fun and exciting pillow building program. With your support, we will have the opportunity to focus more on R&D.  This will allow us to add more exciting features to the mobile kiosk and allow us to expand our pillow-building product line.  With your support  we are looking to explore shredding machinery options for our fillers.  This will help us to keep our price points low for consumers.  It will also allow us to add more fun and exciting pillow filling options.   Additionally, your support will allow us to participate in more industry-related events so we can introduce our fun and exciting pillow-building program to retailers across the globe.  In order for us to have the opportunity to build pillows with you and your community we hope to gain your support for this fun and exciting pillow-building experience!  

Fill Station® Pillow Kiosk helps retailers connect with their communities.

Our passion is driven by helping others achieve a good night sleep and helping retailers connect with their communities.  Thank you for your support!  #Canyoufillit

Now you have the ability to make the perfect pillow!

So the question is...Can you Fill It?

story:
Out of the Abyss: Empowering Ideas to Beat Drug Addiction

Very short pitch: Drug addiction - isolation, shame, broken relationships and careers. I am a life coach for those suffering from addiction; I am launching a life coaching business and am producing an audio book to provide drug recovery insights.

Short pitch: Hi. I am Dr. Peter Grigg and drug addiction and alcoholism nearly destroyed my family and me in 2009.  I am in long-term recovery, which means that I have not used alcohol or non-prescribed medications, to affect the way that I think, feel or act, for 8 years.

Long-term recovery has given me hope and stability and allowed me to create a better life for my self, family and community and motivated me to found Pikes Peak Recovery Coaching. I have a heart for professionals such as doctors, dentists, lawyers and nurses suffering with addiction, thus PPRC's mantra "help professionals recover."  And, I will provide services to the LGBTQ community.

What's my secret sauce? My style and technique is a blend of lived addiction experience, life coach training and being a practicing physician for over 20 years. I am also a writer, actor and voice over artist with a creative drive to produce materials that entertain, inform and provide helpful strategies for those suffering with the disease of addiction.

Addiction leads to chaos, prison and death. If you are reading this you likely know someone...such as a family member, good friend or employer whose life has been ravaged by drug addiction and you wish you could do something to help.

Help support my campaign and you will help addicts recover locally in Colorado Springs as well as Colorado and nationally. One option PPRC will offer is a way to talk to a coach anonymously via a disguised voice, factious name and masked credit card.

Your support will also help produce materials that can assist with the recovery process.

Additionally, money raised during this campaign over $8,000 will provide some scholarships for coaching services.

I will do my best to pick, create and give away meaningful backer prizes and gifts. If they are too lame please let me know and I'll improve them.

What We Need & What You Get

Breaking down the funding request for launching a life coaching business and producing a one hour audio book:

Life Coaching Business will require one-time expenses as well as three months of operating expenses and a contingency fund. In the US, launching a life coaching business takes between $6,000 and $12,000. I can do a full launch of Pikes Peak Recovery Coaching for $5750.

One time expense: $2300 for rent deposit, website, office equipment such as used laptop; printer and other equipment required by HIPPA for security, and incorporation fees. I donated two old laptops but both have since died.

Three months operating expenses: $2700 ($900/mo) which includes rent, software and online coaching platform, phone, office supplies, marketing materials, insurance, book keeping and misc expenses.

Contingency fund of 15%: $750 for unexpected expenses.

Production of 1-hour audio book: $2,000

I will have research expenses, office, office supply, computer expenses and production expenses such as: a professional narrator, studio time required for recording, an audio producer, an audio editor for all post-production work, re-cuts as needed during the approval process, digital cover artwork design/re-design for audio version of script, mastering, encoding and delivery of the completed audio files as well as CD reproduction with cases.

The budget also includes the cost of promotional videos, photos and support to help the audio book reach as many hearts as possible.

Total Requested: $8,000

All raised funds will go to launching Pikes Peak Recovery Coaching and doing the audio book project. I will keep fund raising, working, donating from my retirement account until PPRC fully launches.

The Impact

Coaching services will reduce rates of relapse and help those suffering from addiction have and create a better quality of life.

We believe the audio book will have insights and truths to offer all types of backgrounds and walks of life. Addiction doesn't care about your profession, economic status, race, religion, or sexual orientation. The audio book and other digital products will be made available online and physical products will be made available to treatment centers, peer health programs and correctional institutions. 

I believe I can accomplish these goals because of my experience running a medical practice, publishing written works and successfully completing acting and voice over projects. I have access to a recording and movie studio and teams that will help me produce materials.

In addition, I have mentors from the business community and the Small Business Development Center.

Risks & Challenges

I am passionate to complete this project. I have successfully completed other writing projects and contributed to film/commercial products so I respect timelines and force myself to stay organized and work a plan. My wife helps me stay on schedule. I can get the audio book project done in 5-6 months post funding. One to two months’ research, one month to write a final production script, three months to produce two final products (CD and mp3 files for download.) I will be held accountable by my business mentors.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know economic times are tough and some people just can't contribute. My hope is that you can talk the project up with your friends and family. Please share my project on social media such as Twitter, Facebook and any blogs that you participate in. Please use Indiegogo share tools.

Pikes Peak Recovery Coaching LLC is a registered legal entity in the State of Colorado.
story_txt:
Out of the Abyss: Empowering Ideas to Beat Drug Addiction
Very short pitch: Drug addiction - isolation, shame, broken relationships and careers. I am a life coach for those suffering from addiction; I am launching a life coaching business and am producing an audio book to provide drug recovery insights.
Short pitch: Hi. I am Dr. Peter Grigg and drug addiction and alcoholism nearly destroyed my family and me in 2009.  I am in long-term recovery, which means that I have not used alcohol or non-prescribed medications, to affect the way that I think, feel or act, for 8 years.
Long-term recovery has given me hope and stability and allowed me to create a better life for my self, family and community and motivated me to found Pikes Peak Recovery Coaching. I have a heart for professionals such as doctors, dentists, lawyers and nurses suffering with addiction, thus PPRC's mantra "help professionals recover."  And, I will provide services to the LGBTQ community.
What's my secret sauce? My style and technique is a blend of lived addiction experience, life coach training and being a practicing physician for over 20 years. story:
I'm an enthusiastic nature lover, voluenteer, gardener, Scout Master. Thirty years of age, I always finding a way for self-employment and self-education. The past 17 years all of my free time I devoted to the Scout Group "Njegoš", educating children and youth, contributing to society and local communities.


I'm now on a mission to revive my root house in country side and open its doors for tourists, wwoofs, and primary/high schools. Want to make a green eco village with camp, organic food, wooden cabins, everything powered with renewable energy, green house, build chicken coop, wood hut (outdoor kitchen), showers, bathroom for winter, bring drinkable water to property.

The plan is to create a completely self sustainable property that can fund itself, welcome wwoof-ers, organize camps for primary/high schools for demonstration of green sustainability of one property, camps for learning scouting and bushcraft skills . 30% of camps profit is going to be invested in local community (green technologies, supplies, services)

Recently I received a philantropic award on Philantropy for Green Ideas with award amount of $10,000 for the best green business idea, so we are on a good path to being realized.  http://www.philanthropyforgreenideas.org/2017-winners/ 

You can see power point presentation on this link

My personal goal is to settle and grow old on this property but with same life principles as that I currently have, help others and bring them joy, peace and knowledge. 

So by backing my goal you will give to a lot of people enjoyment, fulfilment, skills and you'll help raise awareness to local community and people from cities that village can be good example for  green development. 

The direct impact of our idea is to thru time invest in the local community, implement green technologies, improve economic situation of the village and to be an example for youth in Montenegro for green sustainable development.  We hope to also be an example of other locations accross Montenegro and Balkans of how one can be self-sustainable and not destroy the environment. 

 

Scouts at visit


 

We want to make the property better, more attractive and accessible. Want to bring people from Montenegro and around the world to show them the village, and this local, green-sustainable property. Plan is to open our doors of our property to WWOOFers, tourists and kids from primary/high schools.  So we need your help!

 

What have we done

 

What we did so far and our plan:

- Changed roof and tile on house 

- Changed power installations in house

- We have rebuild part of house that was the meat smoking room into living room

- Renovated bedroom

- Planted more fruits on property 

We invested 10 000€ so far. Last four years were full of work, cycles of saving and investing.

You can check gallery on www.podostrog.me 

 

 

We need to do more:

 

Bring drinking water on property – solar powered pump and solar pump, water hoses, plumbing etc (wellspring is 700 meters downhill from house) - 2000 € - (HAVE FUNDS)

Make outdoor summer showers and traditional bathroom for winter - 2000 € (we already have 1000€ )

Build two wooden cabins with solar can and solar panel heaters (one on property one in forest) - 7000 €

Build wood hut (outdoor kitchen)  - 1000 € (We akready have funds)

Build two fire pits - 500 €

Electrify house and camp with renewable energy power (solar panels) - 2500 € (We have 700€)

Build workshop for woodwork  (from old stall) - 1500 €

Build chicken coops - 400 €

Plant more in orchard - 200 €

Build greenhouse for winter season (7x14m) - 1500 € HAVE FUNDS

Food for one year for WWOOFers and kids coming to camp - 1000€

Taxes and registration of property - one year -  2000€

Buy 10 bicycles - 2500€ -( We have funds for five 1275€)

Total Funds we need to implement idea are 17100,70€.

 We already have funds we won through Philantrophy for Green Ideas 7475.70€

So we need to fundraise 9625€ more

Main thing that dictate prices is position of property. Transportation costs always take 10-30% of investment. 


 

The Impact
 

I believe that positive example of property in manner of green development, renewable resources, informal educational will show young people that they can go back to their roots and live in balance with nature giving to everyone interested a place of rest, joy, fun.

Backing up this idea you will certainly contribute to people in Montenegro to realize that life out of cities is possible, healthy and enjoyable.

I'm currently project manager on project "Scouts Go Green!" (funded by Delegation of EU in Montenegro) where we are building a scout camp in "Garden of Ecologic" in Podgorica. Cubs have their own garden. Kids camp there, watch birds, learn and have fun. 
More info on https://oinjegos.com/

You can also chech www.netactive.me , portal we are running for Ngo's in Montenegro

 

Risks & Challenges
 

 

Not all funds are collected

Bad weather

Dealing with risks:

Raised funds are spent on priorities (water on property)

All activities are moved and implemented in better weather conditions

You Can Help Us With:

You can help for campaign to reach more people

You can come to us and help us build everything (scouts cook great food ;) )

story:
Breve reseña

Nuestro nacimiento como cooperativa es en el año 2012, dónde nos organizamos principalmente pescadores del rió Mixtequilla, ubicado en el Estado de Oaxaca al sur de México. Nuestra idea de proyecto surge de la problemática de escasez de peces en el medio natural del rió, cercanos a nuestra comunidad surgieron proyectos de acuacultura, dónde alimentaban principalmente a los peces con alimento balanceado industrial, el cual nunca tuvo aceptación por la gente de la comunidad, así nosotros nos propusimos criar peces en un ambiente natural, con alimentación orgánica para ofrecer a nuestra gente un alimento saludable y que conservara el mismo sabor, además que nuestra actividad no tuviera impacto negativo en el ambiente. 
  • Así fue como emprendimos este proyecto con recursos propios de los socios, durante 3 años consecutivos hemos solicitado financiamiento gubernamental sin resultados, bajo el argumento que nuestro proyecto no se alinea a los lineamientos del programa, nosotros creemos en que es posible otra forma de producir alimentos sanos ricos en proteína sin perjudicar el ambiente y sin comprometer la salud humana, a esto hemos llamado acuacultura natural, actividad sin agrotoxicos, ni piensos industriales. Nuestra base es la cooperación ética, responsable y no la competencia sin principios éticos. 
  • Durante estos 3 años hemos consolidado nuestra confianza en la cooperación de la gente, hoy creemos mas en la gente que en las instituciones de gobierno, gracias al apoyo decidido de muchas personas hemos logrado avanzar con este proyecto, hoy queremos continuar con la segunda etapa del proyecto, iniciar la reproducción de crías directamente en nuestra granja, agregar valor a nuestro producto y hacer que llegue a mas personas, Consolidar nuestro proceso de producción de alimento alternativo para la engorda de los peces. Por ello esta campaña es clave para lograr estos resultados en este año que comienza, confiamos en la gente como tú, sabemos que podemos financiarnos colectivamente con mayor autonomía sin comprometer nuestros sueños y nuestro ideal de una comida sana para nuestra gente.



Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes


    • Con el financiamiento obtenido se comprara equipo especializado para el aprovechamiento de residuos agricolas y convertirlos en nutritivos alimentos alternativos para nuestros peces. 
    • Se instalara y equipara un Laboratorio para la reproducción de crias y repoblar nuestros áreas de cultivo y engorda. 
    • Se equipara una pequeña nave agroindustrial para obtener filete y aprovechar los huesos para harina de pescado y cerrar el ciclo de producción. 

  • Te invitamos a que vengas a conocer nuestra granja, a vivir nuestra experiencia  como una de nuestras recompensas exclusivas o compartimos nuestra caminar para emprender nuevos proyecto. 
  • De no alcanzar la meta los recursos obtenidos se destinaran a los objetivos prioritarios: 
  • 1.- Adquisición de equipo para producción de alimento alternativo.
  • 2.- Instalación y equipamiento de una Unidad de Reproducción de Crias. 
  • 3.- Construcción y equipamiento de micronave agroindustrial para valor agregado. 

El impacto

De consolidar nuestro proyecto con tu financiamiento, será un ejemplo a seguir para muchos productores de nuestra región y el mundo, demostraremos que es posible alimentar al mundo sin destruir al planeta, brindado un alimento rico en proteina de manera natural, saludable. Es difícil encontrar experiencias similares, a diferencia de la agricultura, dónde la producción orgánica crece cada día y hay infinidad de experiencias, en la producción de peces no es así, son escasos. 

Hemos logrado obtener ya las primeras cosechas y ha tenido gran éxito, una gran aceptación por la gente de nuestra comunidad por el sabor, y bajo costo de producción. 

Riesgos y desafíos

Es la primera vez que realizamos este tipo de campaña de recaudación, al no contar con experiencia creemos que es nuestro mayor desafió para alcanzar nuestra meta, pero confiamos en la gente, en la solidaridad y seguro que lograremos superar haciendo uso de redes sociales, red de amigos, etc. 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Apoyarnos a difundir nuestra campaña, usa la función de compartir de Indiegogo, facebook, etc, alguien mas puede interesar.

story:
VERSIONE ITALIANA SOTTO

My name is Caroline Chirichella.

Those of you who know me know that food is my passion. I live, sleep, eat (quite literally) and breathe food. To me, food is so much more than it appears to be. It's a way to express myself creatively. It's an art. I love every aspect that goes into preparing a meal; writing up the grocery list, searching for the best possible ingredients, testing recipes until I feel they are just right, plating my creations and even searching for the perfect spoon to accent my signature salted caramel budino. From a young age, my fondest memories involve food. Whether it was my late grandma Nettie making me fried cauliflower or my mom taking me to a nice restaurant before seeing "La Boheme", I always associate food with fond memories. To this day, if I prepare my grandma Nettie's fried cauliflower, the scent and taste still bring tears to my eyes. If you're lucky, food can make you remember something wonderful. Food is family. Food is magic. Food is love. 

In 2013, I decided to turn my passion into a reality and launch Magic & Pasta Events. In the short time since launching, my supper club was named one of the eight best dining experiences in New York, up there with Gabriele Corcos of the hit cooking channel TV show “Extra Virgin." Now I want to bring that same type of dining to Guardia Sanframondi.

Guardia Sanframondi is a beautiful medieval village located in the South of Italy just an hour outside of Naples. When I came to Guardia for the first time in October 2014, it was love at first sight. I loved the feeling of community and I loved that it was just two hours away from where my great-grandfather was born. When I finally found my house, what immediately made it stand out to me was the beautiful cantina and backyard. I could see the bones of the space and knew that this would make an amazing spot for a restaurant. But, the cantina and backyard are in need of a complete restoration and I need some help to turn my dream into a reality. That’s where you come in...

In a short time, we have seen new businesses opening in Guardia Sanframondi due to a recent tourism boom. By investing in this restaurant, you’re not just investing in a business, but you’re investing in the future of Guardia. Further, my cantina is located near Piazza San Filippo Neri and I love the idea of there being a restaurant in this immediate area.

Coming from a background in theatre, opera and burlesque, my goal is to bring a feeling of “performance” into my restaurant. You will see me cooking in the kitchen, chatting with my guests and every now and then I may randomly burst into my favorite Puccini aria. I want my restaurant to have a casual and comfortable vibe, where everyone is welcome. Where you will feel like family. Guardia has welcomed me with open arms and now I want to do the same. By inviting you into my restaurant and cooking for you, I am asking you to be part of my family. I want my restaurant to be as much for you as it is for me. If you have a suggestion, I want to hear it. Here are some details I want to give you about my plan:

* Rome was not built in a day….just as this restaurant won’t be. It will take time but it will also be a group effort. From contractors, to painters, to electricians to handymen, this will not be realized without the help of local professionals.

* Locally sourced food and wine which will contribute to the local economy. What you see on your plate came from someone you most likely know. The wine you’re drinking is sourced from your favorite local cantina. The olive oil came from the vineyard just down the road.

* We will have an outdoor garden and seating area. You will be surrounded by fresh, beautiful herbs and know that the basil and parsley on your plate came from our own backyard.

* A different kind of cuisine: I want to say this clearly. I will not be serving traditional Italian food. The area already has some of the best Italian food I’ve ever eaten, so there is no need for me to serve you Italian dishes that you already have access to. My cuisine combines the best of what our international community has to offer: American, Spanish, Asian, Italian, etc. Imagine Spicy Tuna Tartare Tacos, Italian Fried Chicken & Waffles, Deconstructed Caprese Salad, Bourbon Pumpkin Soup with Honey Whipped Crème and Thyme Parmesan Shortbread and Pork Belly & Watermelon Skewers!

* We will be offering vegetarian, vegan and gluten free options. Don’t see something on the menu that you’re craving? Tell us. If we have the ingredients, we will prepare it especially for you. Our menu will change weekly to allow us to best use what is fresh and in season.

* Guardia has a burgeoning artistic community and I want to create a space to express yourself creatively. Open mic nights, poetry slams, artist showcases, music sessions, etc.

* Being so close to military bases in Naples we don’t want to forget those who fight for this great country and we will be hosting Military nights where our armed service men will receive special discounts thanking them for their great sacrifice.

* We plan on hosting Ladies Only nights to give women the opportunity to naturally be themselves and talk openly about what is on their minds. In addition, we will also be hosting women’s only events such as readings, natural cooking classes, etc.

* Take a book, leave a book: The world is fueled by words. Keeping in line with the creative theme of our restaurant, we invite our guests to bring a book that they no longer need and leave it on one of our communal book shelves and browse through our collection and borrow another book. This way, our books are recycled and can find new homes.

I want this to be a space for the community. Not just a restaurant. Not just a place to come and get a good meal. But a place for you. For your children, for your grandparents, for everyone. A space where creativity can flow. Every amount helps, even a dollar can go a long way. If you can’t contribute financially, even just sharing this on social media or sending an e-mail to your friends can help this campaign grow in more ways than you can imagine.

Everyone has a dream and I’m inviting you to be part of mine.

VERSIONE ITALIANA

Mi chiamo Caroline Chirichella.

Chi di voi mi conosce sa che il cibo è la mia passione. Io vivo, dormo, mangio (letteralmente) e respiro cibo. Per me il cibo è molto più di quel che sembra. È un modo per esprimere me stessa creativamente. È arte. Io amo ogni aspetto della preparazione del pasto: compilare la lista della spesa, ricercare i migliori ingredienti possibili, provare le ricette finché sento che sono perfette, impiattare le mie creazioni e addirittura cercare il cucchiaio perfetto che possa valorizzare il mio budino al caramello salato. Fin da quando ero piccola, i miei ricordi più belli riguardano il cibo. Che fosse mia nonna Nettie a prepararmi il cavolfiore fritto o mia madre che mi portasse in un bel ristorante prime di assistere a “La Bohème”, associo sempre il cibo ai bei ricordi. Ancora oggi, se cucino il cavolfiore fritto di mia nonna Nettie, l'aroma e il sapore mi fanno venire le lacrime agli occhi. Se sei fortunato, il cibo ti può far ricordare qualcosa di meraviglioso. Il cibo è famiglia. Il cibo è magia. Il cibo è amore.

Nel 2013, ho deciso di trasformare la mia passione in realtà e ho lanciato “Magic & Pasta Events”. Nel breve tempo trascorso dal lancio, il mio Supper Club è stato nominato tra le otto migliori esperienze culinarie di New York, insieme a Gabriele Corcos di “Extra Virgin”, famoso show televisivo dedicato alla cucina. Adesso voglio portare lo stesso tipo di cucina a Guardia Sanframondi.

Guardia Sanframondi è un bellissimo villaggio medievale che si trova nel Sud Italia, a solo un'ora da Napoli. Quando sono arrivata a Guardia per la prima volta, nell'ottobre del 2014, è stato amore a prima vista. Ho amato il senso della comunità e ho adorato che si trovasse solo a due ore dal luogo dove è nato il mio bisnonno. Quando finalmente ho trovato la mia casa, ciò che ha immediatamente colpito il mio sguardo sono stati la bellissima cantina e lo spazio sul retro. Riuscivo a percepire il cuore di questo spazio e sapevo che sarebbe stato un posto spettacolare per un ristorante. Ma sia la cantina che il retro della casa hanno bisogno di una completa ristrutturazione e ho bisogno di aiuto per trasformare il mio sogno in realtà. È  ui che entrate in gioco voi...

In un breve periodo, grazie ad un recente boom del turismo, abbiamo visto nuove imprese aprire a Guardia Sanframondi. Investendo in questo ristorante non investi semplicemente in un'impresa ma nel futuro di Guardia. Inoltre, la mia cantina è situata nelle vicinanze di Piazza San Filippo Neri e io amo l'idea che ci sia un ristorante proprio in quest'area.

Avendo dei trascorsi nel teatro, nell'opera e nel burlesque, il mio obiettivo è quello di portare una sensazione di “teatralità” nel mio ristorante. Mi vedrete affaccendarmi nella preparazione in cucina, chiacchierare con i miei ospiti e ogni tanto potrei casualmente cantare la mia aria preferita di Puccini. Voglio che il mio ristorante abbia un'atmosfera rilassata e confortevole, dove tutti si sentano benvenuti. Dove tutti voi sarete accolti come persone di famiglia. Guardia mi ha dato il benvenuto a braccia aperte e ora desidero fare lo stesso. Invitandovi nel mio ristorante e cucinando per voi, vi chiedo di far parte della mia famiglia. Desidero che il mio ristorante sia per voi ciò che è per me. Se avete suggerimenti, voglio ascoltarli. Ed eccovi alcuni dettagli sul mio progetto.

* Roma non è stata costruita in un giorno solo... e così sarà per questo ristorante. Ci vorrà tempo ma sarà anche un lavoro di squadra. Dai muratori agli imbianchini, dagli elettricisti ai tuttofare, non mancherà l'aiuto dei professionisti del posto.

* Il cibo e il vino saranno di provenienza locale, contribuendo all'economia del territorio. Ciò che vedrete nel piatto sarà qualcosa che viene probabilmente da qualcuno che conoscete. Il vino che berrete verrà dalla vostra cantina preferita. L'olio di oliva direttamente dall'uliveto in fondo alla strada.

* Avremo un giardino dove sederci. Sarete circondati da bellissime erbe fresche e saprete che il basilico e il prezzemolo nei vostri piatti provengono dal nostro cortile.

* Un tipo di cucina diversa: voglio dirlo chiaramente. Non servirò cibo italiano tradizionale. La zona già offre alcune tra le pietanze più buone che io abbia mai mangiato, quindi non c'è alcun bisogno che io vi serva piatti italiani che già potete trovare. La mia cucina combina il meglio di quello che la nostra comunità internazionale possa offrire: americana, spagnola, asiatica, italiana, ecc. Immaginate tacos di tartare di tonno speziato, pollo fritto italiano & waffles, insalata caprese decostruita, zuppa di zucca al bourbon con panna montata al miele e pasta frolla al parmigiano e timo e pancetta di maiale con spiedini di anguria!

* Offriremo scelte vegetariane, vegane e senza glutine. Non trovate nel menu qualcosa che desiderate? Ditecelo. Se abbiamo gli ingredienti lo prepareremo appositamente per voi. Il nostro menu cambierà settimanalmente per permetterci di utilizzare materie prime fresche e di stagione.

* Guardia ha una comunità artistica che continua a crescere e desidero creare uno spazio dove possiate esprimere voi stessi creativamente. Serate a microfono aperto, letture di poesie, mostre d'artista, sessioni di musica, ecc. 

* Siamo così vicini alla base militare di Napoli e non vogliamo dimenticare coloro che combattono per questa grande nazione. Organizzeremo serate militari, durante le quali i nostri appartenenti alle forze armate riceveranno sconti speciali per ringraziarli del loro grande sacrificio.

* Abbiamo in programma di organizzare serate per sole donne per dar loro la possibilità di essere se stesse, naturalmente, e parlare apertamente di tutto ciò che vogliono. Organizzeremo, inoltre, anche eventi dedicati alle sole donne come letture, lezioni di cucina naturale, e così via.

* Prendi un libro, lascia un libro: il mondo si muove grazie alle parole. Per rimanere in linea con il tema creativo del nostro ristorante, invitiamo gli ospiti a portare un libro di cui non hanno più bisogno e a lasciarlo in una delle librerie comuni e a cercare nella nostra collezione per prenderne in prestito un altro. In questo modo i nostri libri saranno riciclati e potranno trovare una nuova casa.

Voglio che questo sia uno spazio per la comunità, non soltanto un ristorante. Non soltanto un luogo dove venire a mangiare un buon pasto, ma un posto per voi, per i vostri bambini, per i vostri nonni, per tutti. Uno spazio dove la creatività possa fluire. Ogni somma può essere d'aiuto, anche un solo dollaro può fare molta strada. Se non siete in grado di contribuire finanziariamente, anche soltanto condividere sui social media o inviare una mail ai vostri amici può aiutare a far crescere questa campagna molto più di quanto non immaginiate.

Ognuno ha un sogno e io vi sto invitando a far parte del mio.

VERSIONE ITALIANA SOTTO
My name is Caroline Chirichella. 
Those of you who know me know that food is my passion. I live, sleep, eat (quite literally) and breathe food. To me, food is so much more than it appears to be. It's a way to express myself creatively. It's an art. I love every aspect that goes into preparing a meal; writing up the grocery list, searching for the best possible ingredients, testing recipes until I feel they are just right, plating my creations and even searching for the perfect spoon to accent my signature salted caramel budino. From a young age, my fondest memories involve food. Whether it was my late grandma Nettie making me fried cauliflower or my mom taking me to a nice restaurant before seeing "La Boheme", I always associate food with fond memories. To this day, if I prepare my grandma Nettie's fried cauliflower, the scent and taste still bring tears to my eyes. If you're lucky, food can make you remember something wonderful. Food is family. Food is magic. Food is love. 
In 2013, I decided to turn my passion into a reality and launch Magic & Pasta Events. In the short time since launching, my supper club was named one of the eight best dining experiences in New York, up there with Gabriele Corcos of the hit cooking channel TV show “Extra Virgin." Now I want to bring that same type of dining to Guardia Sanframondi. 
Guardia Sanframondi is a beautiful medieval village located
in the South of Italy just an hour outside of Naples. When I came to Guardia
for the first time in October 2014, it was love at first sight. I loved the
feeling of community and I loved that it was just two hours away from where my
great-grandfather was born. When I
finally found my house, what immediately made it stand out to me was the
beautiful cantina and backyard. I could see the bones of the space and knew
that this would make an amazing spot for a restaurant. But, the cantina and
backyard are in need of a complete restoration and I need some help to turn my
dream into a reality. That’s where you come in...
In a short time, we have seen new businesses opening in
Guardia Sanframondi due to a recent tourism boom. By investing in this
restaurant, you’re not just investing in a business, but you’re investing in
the future of Guardia. Further, my cantina is located near Piazza San Filippo
Neri and I love the idea of there being a restaurant in this immediate area. 
Coming from a background in theatre, opera and burlesque, my
goal is to bring a feeling of “performance” into my restaurant. You will see me
cooking in the kitchen, chatting with my guests and every now and then I may
randomly burst into my favorite Puccini aria. I want my restaurant to have a
casual and comfortable vibe, where everyone is welcome. Where you will feel
like family. Guardia has welcomed me with open arms and now I want to do the
same. By inviting you into my restaurant and cooking for you, I am asking you
to be part of my family. I want my restaurant to be as much for you as it is
for me. If you have a suggestion, I want to hear it. Here are some details I want to give you about my plan: 
* Rome was not built in a day….just as this restaurant won’t
be. It will take time but it will also be a group effort. From contractors, to
painters, to electricians to handymen, this will not be realized without the
help of local professionals. 
* Locally sourced food and wine which will contribute to the
local economy. What you see on your plate came from someone you most likely know. The wine you’re drinking is sourced from your favorite local cantina. The olive
oil came from the vineyard just down the road. 
* We will have an outdoor garden and seating area. You will be
surrounded by fresh, beautiful herbs and know that the basil and parsley on
your plate came from our own backyard. 
* A different kind of cuisine: I want to say this clearly. I
will not be serving traditional Italian food. The area already has some of the
best Italian food I’ve ever eaten, so there is no need for me to serve you
Italian dishes that you already have access to. My cuisine combines the best
of what our international community has to offer: American, Spanish, Asian,
Italian, etc. Imagine Spicy Tuna Tartare Tacos, Italian Fried Chicken &
Waffles, Deconstructed Caprese Salad, Bourbon Pumpkin Soup with Honey Whipped Crème
and Thyme Parmesan Shortbread and Pork Belly & Watermelon Skewers! 
* We will be offering vegetarian, vegan and gluten free options. Don’t see
something on the menu that you’re craving? Tell us. If we have the ingredients,
we will prepare it especially for you. Our menu will change weekly to allow us
to best use what is fresh and in season. 
* Guardia has a burgeoning artistic community and I want to
create a space to express yourself creatively. Open mic nights, poetry slams,
artist showcases, music sessions, etc. 
* Being so close to military bases in Naples we don’t want to
forget those who fight for this great country and we will be hosting Military nights
where our armed service men will receive special discounts thanking them for
their great sacrifice.
* We plan on hosting Ladies Only nights to give women the
opportunity to naturally be themselves and talk openly about what is on their
minds. In addition, we will also be hosting women’s only events such as readings, natural cooking classes, etc. 


* Take a book, leave a book: The world is fueled by words. Keeping
in line with the creative theme of our restaurant, we invite our guests to
bring a book that they no longer need and leave it on one of our communal book
shelves and browse through our collection and borrow another book. This way,
our books are recycled and can find new homes. 
I want this to be a space for the community. Not just a
restaurant. Not just a place to come and get a good meal. But a place for you.
For your children, for your grandparents, for everyone. A space where
creativity can flow. Every amount helps, even a dollar can go a long way. If you can’t contribute financially, even just sharing this on social media or sending an e-mail to your friends can help this campaign grow in more ways than you can imagine. 
Everyone has a dream and I’m inviting you to be part of mine.
