story:
• Short Summary

Billie Jo: I got my start with natural products by becoming a certified herbalist in 1996, and combined it with an enthusiasm for helping customers find solutions in a retail setting as the herbalist at the San Francisco Whole Foods Market.

After almost 7 years in retail, I saw an opportunity to enter the professional pet care business. Starting with a few dog-walking customers, over the next 13 years I grew my company into a six-figure business, with full-time employees and a wide menu of services for our clients, from pet-sitting and daily walks, to training classes.

During my years building the pet care business, I found that more and more people are seeking all-natural products for their pets - products that are creative, renewable, and fun - and that they want to rely on a store that serves them within a caring and friendly community. So, I'm starting Wellness Pet Supplies! The Wellness Pet Supplies store will be Ashland’s leading provider of homeopathic, herbal, vitamin-based, organic, hypo-allergenic food, toys and beds, with a core passion for the longevity and well-being of animals. I'm excited about using all of my entrepreneurial, retail, customer, and pet-care skills to build a happy community and a long lasting business.

 

What We Need & What You Get

As a contributor, you'll be helping us to offer a full spectrum of health support to Ashland's pets, in a holistic way, with a splash of fun and class. All in an area that currently does not have this kind of pet supply store.

I've saved $15K, and  I need an additional $50K to launch. Your contributions will pay for the build-out, products on the shelves, the store's opening, and the first few months of the lease.

Let's do this - for Ashland, for its great people, and for its precious animals!

We don't expect you to aid us for nothing, so I've got some fun PERKS in exchange for helping out.

These include:

  • Store discounts, store credit, and many different products.
  • Gift baskets that will include products and some fun items such as water bottles, wine and beer.
  • There are also some beautiful trip rewards, at the $5K contribution level, for you to enjoy Ashland Oregon and its culture. 
  • Furthermore, everyone who contributes gets an invite to our Grand Opening Party at the store. A great way to see your funds in action!

(If all of the contributions don't add up to the full $50K goal, I'll obtain a bank loan for the remainder, to ensure that I meet my opening day goal of Fall 2016.)



The Impact

I'm founding and cultivating a place for people to purchase products that support a healthy and happy life for their pets. I come to this project with experience and skills particularly suited to this area expertise, and I guarantee customer satisfaction.

I started a pet care business from scratch and turned it into a six figure, thriving business with a loyal clientele. I've also been a certified herbalist for 20 years. This new business will combine these two passions, pet care and natural product solutions, and offer it to a marketplace that's just beginning its steepest growth.

Your contributions mean that pets in the Ashland area will have the best chance to live longer, fuller lives, and will be able to be protected against factors that we humans well understand, such as environment, stress, injury, age, food issues, and allergies.


 

Risks & Challenges

Along the way I might struggle to find the right location in time for my planned Fall 2016 opening. Another challenge might be the need to acquire a bigger loan than earlier expected, and working out a plan for meeting the monthly payments right away. I'll also be faced with the learning curve of launching a business in a city where I'm still gaining familiarity, meeting people and finding my way around.

I am more than qualified to handle all of these challenges.

  1. I'm tenacious when it comes to my research, including my search for locations. I always find what I'm looking for. I start early, revisit leads often, and scour the marketplace until I find what I need.
  2. In my 13 years of owning a business, I've always made payroll, paid my bills on time, and paid my taxes. Even when things were tight, and I wondered how I would get it all done, making these payments was non-negotiable for me.

   3. I'm originally from Oregon, so I know how Oregonians think. I've spent a lot of time in Ashland, so I understand the vibe of the people and the culture of the town.

My plans for overcoming the challenges are:

  1. Working closely with property managers and realtors every day, until I find the absolute best available location in the city for this kind of store.
  2. If we don't make our entire financial launch goal, I'll personally make sure all of the bills are paid, including loan payments, while I'm cultivating new business and attracting customers. Also, my husband's job will help! I'll even take pet sitting work in the evenings. As always, I'll do whatever needs to be done.
  3. I plan on getting involved with the community. I'll be talking to, and teaming up with, local vets. I'll host lectures and classes to educate the public (pet owners) about products and pet-related issues. I'll hold adopt-a-thons, Vaccination Saturdays, and fund-raisers for the local shelters. I want my business to be an important part of Ashland's pet-people community.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to contribute, but still want to support us, please email my story to everyone you know. Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tool! You can also offer help if you have a special skill that might help get the store open on time, like contractor or electrical work. Let me know!
story_txt:
Short Summary

Billie Jo: I got my start with natural products by becoming a certified herbalist in 1996, and combined it with an enthusiasm for helping customers find solutions in a retail setting as the herbalist at the San Francisco Whole Foods Market. 
After almost 7 years in retail, I saw an opportunity to enter the professional pet care business. Starting with a few dog-walking customers, over the next 13 years I grew my company into a six-figure business, with full-time employees and a wide menu of services for our clients, from pet-sitting and daily walks, to training classes. 
During my years building the pet care business, I found that more and more people are seeking all-natural products for their pets - products that are creative, renewable, and fun - and that they want to rely on a store that serves them within a caring and friendly community. So, I'm starting Wellness Pet Supplies! The Wellness Pet Supplies store will be Ashland’s leading provider of homeopathic, herbal, vitamin-based, organic, hypo-allergenic food, toys and beds, with a core passion for the longevity and  well-being of animals. I'm excited about using all of my entrepreneurial, retail, customer, and pet-care skills to build a happy community and a long lasting business.     What We Need & What You Get
As a contributor, you'll be helping us to offer a full spectrum of health support to Ashland's pets, in a holistic way, with a splash of fun and class. All in an area that currently does not have this kind of pet supply store. 
I've saved $15K, and  I need an additional $50K to launch. Your contributions will pay for the build-out, products on the shelves, the store's opening, and the first few months of the lease. 
Let's do this - for Ashland, for its great people, and for its precious animals!
We don't expect you to aid us for nothing, so I've got some fun PERKS in exchange for helping out. 
These include:

Store discounts, store credit, and many different products.
Gift baskets that will include products and some fun items such as water bottles, wine and beer. 
There are also some beautiful trip rewards, at the $5K contribution level, for you to enjoy Ashland Oregon and its culture. 
Furthermore, everyone who contributes gets an invite to our Grand Opening Party at the store. A great way to see your funds in action!
(If all of the contributions don't add up to the full $50K goal, I'll obtain a bank loan for the remainder, to ensure that I meet my opening day goal of Fall 2016.)

     The Impact
I'm founding and cultivating a place for people to purchase products that support a healthy and happy life for their pets. I come to this project with experience and skills particularly suited to this area expertise, and I guarantee customer satisfaction.
I started a pet care business from scratch and turned it into a six figure, thriving business with a loyal clientele. I've also been a certified herbalist for 20 years. This new business will combine these two passions, pet care and natural product solutions, and offer it to a marketplace that's just beginning its steepest growth.
Your contributions mean that pets in the Ashland area will have the best chance to live longer, fuller lives, and will be able to be protected against factors that we humans well understand, such as environment, stress, injury, age, food issues, and allergies. 
    Risks & ChallengesAlong the way I might struggle to find the right location in time for my planned Fall 2016 opening. Another challenge might be the need to acquire a bigger loan than earlier expected, and working out a plan for meeting the monthly payments right away. I'll also be faced with the learning curve of launching a business in a city where I'm still gaining familiarity, meeting people and finding my way around.I am more than qualified to handle all of these challenges. 
I'm tenacious when it comes to my research, including my search for locations. I always find what I'm looking for. I start early, revisit leads often, and scour the marketplace until I find what I need. 
In my 13 years of owning a business, I've always made payroll, paid my bills on time, and paid my taxes. Even when things were tight, and I wondered how I would get it all done, making these payments was non-negotiable for me.
   3. I'm originally from Oregon, so I know how Oregonians think. I've spent a lot of time in Ashland, so I understand the vibe of the people and the culture of the town. My plans for overcoming the challenges are:
Working closely with property managers and realtors every day, until I find the absolute best available location in the city for this kind of store. 
If we don't make our entire financial launch goal, I'll personally make sure all of the bills are paid, including loan payments, while I'm cultivating new business and attracting customers. Also, my husband's job will help! I'll even take pet sitting work in the evenings. As always, I'll do whatever needs to be done.
I plan on getting involved with the community. I'll be talking to, and teaming up with, local vets. I'll host lectures and classes to educate the public (pet owners) about products and pet-related issues. I'll hold adopt-a-thons, Vaccination Saturdays, and fund-raisers for the local shelters. I want my business to be an important part of Ashland's pet-people community. 
      Other Ways You Can Help
If you aren't able to contribute, but still want to support us, please email my story to everyone you know. Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tool! You can also offer help if you have a special skill that might help get the store open on time, like contractor or electrical work. Let me know!

story:
THE MAPUCHE CHAPTER - SOLAR ENERGY FOR INDIGENOUS MAPUCHE COMMUNITIES


The Mapuche Chapter (MC) is an initiative for indigenous Mapuche communities in Southern Chile. The ethnic group of the Mapuche people has been marginalized and disadvantaged throughout history and is living in hugely unworthy living conditions. In addition to their struggle with economic grievances, their situation is currently being further aggravated because of environmental degradation and an intensifying water shortage.

In response to these latest developments, the MC project has been designed together with indigenous communities to bring about change: it will first, alleviate the most pressing grievances that are causing their suffering today, and second, support them in building up their very own capabilities to improve their current living conditions through their own strength.


Our Project:

In practice, MC will provide the following support:

       I) Solar panel equipment to generate electricity;

       II) Productivity enhancing tools, matched to the particular activities of the             different communities;

       III) Training sessions for the installation, use, and maintenance of the                        solar panels, as well as for micro-entrepreneurial activities.


When analysing the circumstances of the local communities, it was found that these precise tools are exactly what the Mapuche people need to tackle their current challenges. The tools will aid local Mapuche producers in their agricultural tasks and their small scale income generating activities. Furthermore, in the short term, the tools will provide direct relief for communities from their most pressing issues they are facing today: poverty, environmental degradation, loss of cultural identity, and water shortage.

           

What will be the impact for the communities?

Preserve the environment ~  MC will proliferate the use of renewable energies, especially solar technology, among Mapuche communities. This will decrease the use of kerosene, fuel wood, and CO2 emissions and thus ameliorate further degradation of the natural environment and biological diversity of the Chilean Central Valley.

Alleviate poverty ~ The selected tools strengthen the Mapuches’ entrepreneurial spirit, encourage diversification of production and income, and additionally allow them to reduce their high expenses such as energy costs. The latter is particularly important as Chile is among the countries with the highest cost for electrical power generation.

Provide fast relief to water shortage  ~  Because climate change has had a huge impact on Mapuche lands, many communities experience a huge deficit of water. Potable water is especially scarce, which is why the most affected areas depend on delivery via tanker trucks to cover their basic needs.

Revitalize the Mapuches’ cultural heritage and traditions  ~  Growing difficulties have forced Mapuche people to adapt their traditional way of life, causing loss in their cultural heritage and a fading identity. The MC will empower marginalized Mapuche communities to participate in the life of the nation without losing sight of their cultural heritage.

                        

                   

How can your contribution help?  

        

We are asking for your support so we can start this initiative in the first selected community in Lumaco. Our initial goal is to raise  USD 5,300. With your help, we can bring significant change to Lumaco and then, more Mapuche communities! By donating to the Mapuche Chapter Campaignyou will build the groundwork that the community needs in order to overcome their poor living conditions, empowering them to achieve a higher standard of living through their own work ethic and strength.

USD 10 covers the transport for a participant to attend a workshop session

USD 50 covers a training session on basic business skills for 20 participants

USD 120 buys a small productivity enhancing tool: sewing machines, fruit dehydrators, cooling devices, flour mills etc.

USD 230 buys a solar panel that will produce the electricity needed for the electronic devices

USD 350 purchases a large tool: rainwater filtration system, irrigation system, greenhouse etc.

USD 500 provides a 10 unit training session on the installation, use, and maintenance of solar equipment for 20 participants

In addition to your contribution, you can help us by telling your friends, family and colleagues about the Mapuche Chapter Campaign. You can also follow our blog and Facebook posts where we will keep you updated about all developments and achievements of the Mapuche Chapter!

                                                 Please spread the word!


Who we are

       Elena Fuhr

My name is  Elena Fuhr and I’m the project developer of the Mapuche Chapter. I'm a 24 years old German young development professional from Munich and recently gained a Master's degree in International Relations from the University of Bristol.

After a number of internships in different European countries and Africa which helped me to become acquainted with different cultures and beliefs, I got involved with development work for indigenous peoples. The first practical experience in this field, I gained in Ecuador. Here, I was given the chance to work with COAGRO, and indigenous led non-governmental organisation dedicated to the improvement of the livelihood of the communities at the Cayambe volcano.

Shortly afterwards, I learnt about the desperate situation of the indigenous population in Chile. As this was around the time when I was thinking about the topic for my master thesis, I took the opportunity to combine the theoretical knowledge I had gained in my previous studies with my interest for indigenous peoples. Hence, I got in contact with local Mapuche communities and field partners and searched for a strong implementation partner, which I found in Spanda Foundation.

Since my graduation in September 2015, the Spanda team and I have been devising the project’s implementation details.


      Spanda Foundation

Spanda Foundation ('Spanda') is a The Hague-based International Civil Society Organization (ICSO), established in 2005 under Dutch law which has the aim to catalyse long-term systemic change in culture, education, health & environment, economics and research for the sustainable advancement of a higher individual and collective state of consciousness. Spanda is a legally independent non-profit institution with its legal status corresponding to Section 501(c)(3) of the US IRS and maintains a Consultative Status with the UN Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC).

MC is a section of Spanda's Mantra Project and, accordingly, pursues a mission to ‘alleviate poverty and revitalize communities in developing countries by empowering people to lead lives of self-reliance, meet their own basic needs and attain economic self-sufficiency, in harmony with their culture and the environment’.

story:
Short Summary

Nanostead is a grassroots business that is more than just another (Small Scale) building company.  Yes, we provide top quality, energy efficient homes like plenty of other builders in Western North Carolina, but our vision is beyond the home envelope.  Nanostead connects clients to their land through thoughtful and educated home and land design.

Our houses are just the “RIGHT” size for each of our clients, but our focus isn’t only on the house. Our clients are interested in becoming more self-sufficient. With population on the rise and our environment in need of real love and attention, we advise our clients on all aspects of a small, yet functional footprint.  From the land they are thinking of buying or already own, to the most detailed aspects of their home design, we advise clients through the entire process to create the right-sized homestead of their dreams.


Our goal is to create and distribute all of the necessities for small scale homesteading by developing the One Stop Homestead Shop, including a model small scale homestead, a Nanostead! 

The One Stop Homestead Shop of Nanostead will showcase a tiny home, greenhouse, small outbuilding, gardens, fencing, solar packages for power, water catchment, livestock housing, and a play structure to provide a real example of small-scale homesteading, along with a retail store for the supplies you need.  We will also provide education and consultation for people who want to do it themselves.  

Nanostead is based in beautiful rural Madison County, NC.  We have acquired a wonderful commercial space between a major highway and historic downtown Marshall.  There has been a lot of attention to this area as Asheville’s housing prices soar and more people move to this rural area to get back to the land and start their own small scale homestead (Nanostead).  

We have reached out to other businesses in our community to create partnerships focused on sustainability. Our initial partner companies that we are working with include Southeast Ecological Design, Ramble & Root - edible landscapes, Symbiosis Design Build, and Sugar Hollow Solar company.

We are very passionate about Nanostead and want to take it to the next level. Having an all-weather building facility, shop, office space, and retail showroom will allow us to become a more efficient business where we can demonstrate to clients the best options for their Nanostead dreams. 

Our goal is to be as affordable as possible, by using all of our best resources and working with clients to make appropriate decisions so projects can run smoothly. Creating this showcase space will strengthen our ability to design and manufacture homes and outdoor installations in a faster and more financially conservative way for both Nanostead and our clients, while demonstrating to the community what they can realize on their own land. 

We want to build a sustainable business and help as many people achieve the dream of affordable homesteading! Our vision for the future is to work with organizations that offer transitional housing for the homeless, Veterans and low-income families. It will take time, but with your help we can get a good jump start as we develop the service side of our business!

We are seeking funding for the creation of our establishment in a commercial space.  There is plenty of room to grow at our new space but it will take a long time without investing in these few crucial things:

  • Cover the cost of the lease and utilities for at least a year to lower our overhead and focus on our amazing clients and seeking new clients.
  • Office and shop supplies
  • Build a large Pole-Barn that can provide the space to build portable homes, store materials and eventually Pre-Fab small home production
  • Certifications from RVIA so clients can insure and finance their portable Nanostead homes.
  • Create a demonstration of a Nanostead homestead with a model tiny house including solar, water catchment, raised bed gardens,outbuilding, livestock housing, greenhouse and even a play structure for the kids while you tour the facility.

The use of the proceeds will go as follows:

Rent and Utilities =$9,200.00

Under Roof building facility = $7,000.00

Office/Shop Needs = $2,000.00

RVIA certified = $2,000.00

Tiny homestead model = $40,000.00 + material donations

Total = $60,200.00

We understand not everyone can contribute.  

This Doesn’t Mean You Can’t Help! If you can get a friend to donate, that is excellent!!  Spreading the word and understanding the mission are essential to this campaign. We want to do the best we can, and just knowing we have your support will keep us working diligently and build confidence with our contributors. If you support our mission and want to see this come to life, sharing this information will work wonders! Please use the Indiegogo share tools that are available!

Our partner companies that are helping us grow:

         

      South East Ecological Design

story:
It's cold up here in Alaska and we are tired of sitting on blocks of ice... we need some damn 'benches' already.


The 'Nuts & Bolts'... (low down)

In May of 2015 we were awarded a Challenge Grant from the Anchorage Park Foundation to design, fabricate, and install three sculptural / communal seating elements in three of Anchorage's public parks or at three points along our world-class urban trail system.  APF has agreed to match $21,700 in funding for the project and we are seeking to raise the matching funds through the generous support of community minded individuals and organizations.


Who We Are & What We Do...


We are Intrinsic Landscapes, a husband and wife team that leads a landscape design/build practice based in Anchorage, Alaska.  Since our partnership began in 2002, we have been continually evolving our practice in the hope of creating a device for the merging of Design, Ecology, Social Landscapes, Psychology, and Art.

We view landscape design as a social enterprise and the construction of landscapes as a craft.

We are preoccupied with investigating how people experience space, how they perceive space, and how they relate to space while maneuvering through it. We strive to create environments that celebrate the personal connection to the landscape by utilizing timeless materials in seemingly effortless ways, thereby perpetuating a sensorial-rich atmosphere and experience.



Our initial projects were intimately scaled and attempted to foster a new connection to the landscape with our clients.



As time has passed, our desire to create urban interventions and temporary sculptural installations has begun to take shape.


With the desire to translate the process and design intent of some our temporary works into more permanent site-specific installations that are an asset to the community, we applied for a Challenge Grant from the Anchorage Park Foundation. 


The Project...

As one of the 16 Challenge Grant recipients for 2015, we have the opportunity to collaborate with the Anchorage Park Foundation and the Municipality of Anchorage Parks and Recreation Department on creating three seating elements that serve as social condensers along popular trail routes or in parks that would benefit  from having a site amenity as destination point.

 Our desire is to create engaging, playful, and insightful communal gathering points at the scale of a park “bench”.

While infrastructure, facilities, and amenities for active recreation receive the majority of planning and funding focus, often times amenities for passive recreation are overshadowed and the only financially viable and most efficient option is to specify typical solutions. Anchorage is truly blessed with a world class trail and parks system and it is our stance that Anchorage should possess congregational nodes in the form of seating that is of the same caliber, creating captivating destinations to relax and absorb the view, have a trailside snack with a loved one, or have a random encounter with a complete stranger, all the while challenging what the notion of what a “bench” can be.

Having site-specific seating solutions can help amplify the inherent qualities of a site, expose new interpretations of the landscape, and foster a sense of destination that lingers in the mind.



Current Project Partners



Project Schedule Summary

Site Selection / Design / Estimation :  March - April 2016

Fabrication :  April - May 2016

Site Preparation : June 2016

Installation : July - September 2016


Project Budget Summary

$43,400 Total Budget for (3) Site-Specific Installations

 - $21,700 Anchorage Park Foundation Matching Challenge Grant

$21,700 Match - raised via generous crowd-funders like you, with the help of additional private donations and grants.

While $43,400 is our base minimum budget for the three installations, we would ideally be able to raise a total of $54,000 - $60,000 (which includes the $21,700 from APF).  This additional funding would ensure that the installations could be sited with great care and additional scope with site preparation and landscape integration could be accomplished to a more refined level.

The total project budget covers :

Site Selection / Design / Public Hearing Facilitation / Estimation / Material Procurement / Prefabrication / Site Preparation / Equipment Rentals / Transportation / Installation / Project Signage



Thanks for your support!

(So - what do you get in return???)

As a way of expressing our gratitude for your generosity, we have set up a variety of perks as a way of saying thanks for your participation. As a local or global community member, you can be a partner in the realization of a project that is for Alaskans and visitors to our inspiring landscape.

From tokens of appreciation that are project specific to works of art from Alaskan artists, to custom one-of-a-kind furniture pieces that we create for you, there is something for everyone and we thank you for your contribution.


So... What happens if we don't reach our funding goal?


The final scope and outcome of this project will be dependent upon a successful funding campaign.  In the event we are unable to meet our goal, we will apply what funds are raised to the project and scale appropriately, accomplishing what we can.

With past projects we have been relatively successful in garnering partnerships with local companies for in-kind donations of materials and intend to do so at some degree with this project in order to help offset some overall project costs, but also strengthen the community involvement aspect of the project.

Why are we doing this?

(The Impact)

Your support of this project will help facilitate the creation of spaces and objects that :

  • Expand ways in which locals and visitors alike can enjoy the Anchorage park and trail system.
  • Place design emphasis on passive recreation elements that cater to a wide crossection of our community and create destinations for people of all ages and abilities.
  • Strengthen socially conscious design initiatives and projects in Alaska.
  • Create engaging, all inclusive seating elements that ensure everyone has acess to enjoying our great parks and trails.
  • Create a sense of destination and iconographic wayfinding points for trail and park users.
  • Promote creative interventions in an urban 'wilderness' of unparalleled beauty.
  • With Alaska being such an expansive landscape, having ways that instigate the creation of shared experiences and fostering intimate perspectives of the landscape is beneficial for all.
  • Expand the notion of what a 'bench' can or should be.



What's our track record with similar projects?

Over the last three years, we have begun to broaden our project scope and have been involved with several public oriented projects in the Anchorage park system.  Within those projects, we have attempted to integrate as many place-specific and project-specific elements as possible.  Within the same time-frame, we have been involved in a number of creative urban interventions that celebrate life in the North. We have also had the great pleasure in collaborating with the Anchorage Museum on several temporary sculptural installations.

This project provides an unprecedented opportunity for us to meld together our passions and create socially activated sculptural installations that will be permanent fixtures in our parks for everyone to enjoy for years to come.



What Challenges Lie Ahead?

Our largest hurdle with this project is raising the $21,700 matching funds that the Anchorage Park Foundation has agreed to sponsor.  We have proven time and again that we are able to complete similar projects, yet fundraising is brand new territory for us and an entirely different process for us to embark on.  However, something that works in our favor is that we love being challenged!

In the event that we are successful in raising the matching funds and meet the $43,400 Challenge Grant total, the next hurdle to overcome is the raising of an additional $16,600 to achieve our desired goal of $60,000 for the entire project.

We are well versed in overcoming challenges and hurdles as it applies to projects with minimal or strict budgets.  Past projects like our ALPAR project or the Engine 556 project have.  Alaska is a very big place, filled with big-hearted individuals that are no strangers to sharing and pitching in to lend a hand.  We continue to reach out into the community and foster connections that reinforce community engagement within our process and projects.



Thank You!

We appreciate your time and consideration.
If you are able to contribute to our campaign - we sincerely thank you!

In the event you are unable to contribute - that is OK - if you could just help us spread the word about our project and campaign - that would be fantastic!
story_txt:
It's cold up here in Alaska and we are tired of sitting on blocks of ice... we need some damn 'benches' already.









The 'Nuts & Bolts'... (low down)

In May of 2015 we were awarded a Challenge Grant from the Anchorage Park Foundation to design, fabricate, and install three sculptural / 
communal seating elements in three of Anchorage's public parks or at 
three points along our world-class urban trail system.  APF has agreed 
to match $21,700 in funding for the project and we are seeking to raise 
the matching funds through the generous support of community minded 
individuals and organizations.


Who We Are & What We Do...


We are Intrinsic Landscapes, a husband and
wife team that leads a landscape design/build practice based in
Anchorage, Alaska.  Since our partnership
began in 2002, we have been continually evolving our practice in the hope of
creating a device for the merging of Design, Ecology, Social Landscapes,
Psychology, and Art. We
view landscape design as a social enterprise and the construction of landscapes
as a craft.
We
are preoccupied with investigating how people experience space, how they
perceive space, and how they relate to space while maneuvering through it. We
strive to create environments that celebrate the personal connection to the
landscape by utilizing timeless materials in seemingly effortless ways, thereby
perpetuating a sensorial-rich atmosphere and experience.



Our initial projects were intimately scaled and attempted to foster a new connection to the landscape with our clients. 




As time has passed, our desire to create urban interventions and temporary sculptural installations has begun to take shape.






With the desire to translate the process and design intent of some our temporary works into more 
permanent site-specific installations that are an asset to the 
community, we applied for a Challenge Grant from the Anchorage Park 
Foundation.  


The Project...As one of the 16 Challenge Grant recipients for 2015, we have the opportunity to collaborate with the Anchorage Park Foundation and the Municipality of Anchorage Parks and Recreation Department on creating three seating elements that serve as social condensers along
popular trail routes or in parks that would benefit  from having a site amenity as destination
point. Our desire is to create engaging, playful, and insightful communal gathering
points at the scale of a park “bench”. While infrastructure, facilities, and amenities for active
recreation receive the majority of planning and funding focus, often times amenities for passive
recreation are overshadowed and the only financially viable and most efficient
option is to specify typical solutions. Anchorage is truly blessed with a world
class trail and parks system and it is our stance that Anchorage should possess
congregational nodes in the form of seating that is of the same caliber,
creating captivating destinations to relax and absorb the view, have a
trailside snack with a loved one, or have a random encounter with a complete
stranger, all the while challenging what the notion of what a “bench” can be.Having site-specific seating solutions can help amplify the inherent qualities
of a site, expose new interpretations of the landscape, and foster a sense of destination
that lingers in the mind. 




Current Project Partners




Project Schedule Summary

Site Selection / Design / Estimation :  March - April 2016
Fabrication :  April - May 2016
Site Preparation : June 2016
Installation : July - September 2016

Project Budget Summary

$43,400 Total Budget for (3) Site-Specific Installations
 - $21,700 Anchorage Park Foundation Matching Challenge Grant
$21,700 Match - raised via generous crowd-funders like you, with the help of additional private donations and grants.
While $43,400 is our base minimum budget for the three installations, we would ideally be able to raise a total of $54,000 - $60,000 (which includes the $21,700 from APF).  This additional funding would ensure that the installations could be sited with great care and additional scope with site preparation and landscape integration could be accomplished to a more refined level.

The total project budget covers :


Site Selection / Design / Public Hearing Facilitation / Estimation / Material Procurement / Prefabrication / Site Preparation / Equipment Rentals / Transportation / Installation / Project Signage




  Thanks for your support! 



(So - what do you get in return???)

As a way of expressing our gratitude for your generosity, we have set up a variety of perks as a way of saying thanks for your participation. As a local or global community member, you can be a partner in the realization of a project that is for Alaskans and visitors to our inspiring landscape.
From tokens of appreciation that are project specific to works of art from Alaskan artists, to custom one-of-a-kind furniture pieces that we create for you, there is something for everyone and we thank you for your contribution.

So... What happens if we don't reach our funding goal?

The final scope and outcome of this project will be dependent upon a successful funding campaign.  In the event we are unable to meet our goal, we will apply what funds are raised to the project and scale appropriately, accomplishing what we can. With past projects we have been relatively successful in garnering partnerships with local companies for in-kind donations of materials and intend to do so at some degree with this project in order to help offset some overall project costs, but also strengthen the community involvement aspect of the project.     Why are we doing this? 



(The Impact) Your support of this project will help facilitate the creation of spaces and objects that :  Expand ways in which locals and visitors alike can enjoy the Anchorage park and trail system.
 Place design emphasis on passive recreation elements that cater to a wide crossection of our community and create destinations for people of all ages and abilities.
Strengthen socially conscious design initiatives and projects in Alaska.
 Create engaging, all inclusive seating elements that ensure everyone has acess to enjoying our great parks and trails.
Create a sense of destination and iconographic wayfinding points for trail and park users.
Promote creative interventions in an urban 'wilderness' of unparalleled beauty.
With Alaska being such an expansive landscape, having ways that instigate the creation of shared experiences and fostering intimate perspectives of the landscape is beneficial for all.

Expand the notion of what a 'bench' can or should be. 
    



What's our track record with similar projects?
Over the last three years, we have begun to broaden our project scope and have been involved with several public oriented projects in the Anchorage park system.  Within those projects, we have attempted to integrate as many place-specific and project-specific elements as possible.  Within the same time-frame, we have been involved in a number of creative urban interventions that celebrate life in the North. We have also had the great pleasure in collaborating with the Anchorage Museum on several temporary sculptural installations.
This project provides an unprecedented opportunity for us to meld together our passions and create socially activated sculptural installations that will be permanent fixtures in our parks for everyone to enjoy for years to come. 






What Challenges Lie Ahead?
Our largest hurdle with this project is raising the $21,700 matching funds that the Anchorage Park Foundation has agreed to sponsor.  We have proven time and again that we are able to complete similar projects, yet fundraising is brand new territory for us and an entirely different process for us to embark on.  However, something that works in our favor is that we love being challenged!In the event that we are successful in raising the matching funds and meet the $43,400 Challenge Grant total, the next hurdle to overcome is the raising of an additional $16,600 to achieve our desired goal of $60,000 for the entire project.We are well versed in overcoming challenges and hurdles as it applies to projects with minimal or strict budgets.  Past projects like our ALPAR project or the Engine 556 project have.  Alaska is a very big place, filled with big-hearted individuals that are no strangers to sharing and pitching in to lend a hand.  We continue to reach out into the community and foster connections that reinforce community engagement within our process and projects.


Thank You!

We appreciate your time and consideration.If you are able to contribute to our campaign - we sincerely thank you!In the event you are unable to contribute - that is OK - if you could just help us spread the word about our project and campaign - that would be fantastic!

story:
Short Summary

Well hi there! I'm Ginger, & I own Nest 615 Antiques & Vintage currently located in East Nashville, TN. I restore, refinish, repurpose, & generally make stuff people don't love anymore into things people fall in love with when they see them. I moved into my current location in June of 2015 & with the help of crowdfunding, friends, & good old neighborhood help, I took a space nobody wanted and made it into a cute little shop. 

What We Need & Why

So why do I suddenly need to move you ask? On Christmas Eve of 2015 I found a roof leak in my shop. And then found another. And another. And another. Not little roof leaks that had been there a few days, big ones that had been there for years. The kind where I could see daylight, complete with wood so rotten it was just crumbling, and mold. Lots and lots of mold, even in the air ducts. I had no idea any of it was there, as I wasn't allowed on the roof or in any of the areas with issues due to clauses in my lease. The only reason I found them was because part of the ceiling fell in, and that's how I started finding things. 


I did what anybody would do, I called my landlord and asked for help and that they fix the problem. Well...they wouldn't fix it. They told me to 'put some ceiling tiles over it' and pretend it wasn't there. I asked for help over and over and over, and couldn't get them to even acknowledge there was a mold problem or major damage to the building. I tried to hire somebody to fix it myself and wasn't allowed to do so because of clauses in my lease. 

I have lupus and fibromyalgia. I've been progressively getting 'sicker' the past 8 or 9 months...since I'd moved into the building. I'd been breathing in toxic mold for 9 months and didn't even realize it. I'm on steroids, multiple inhalers, breathing treatments, numerous allergy meds, & have been told not to even be in the building anymore. And yet, my landlord still refuses to fix it.

Then I suddenly, 9 months into a 3 year lease got a notice to vacate. No reason given, just that I had to get out. Nobody would tell me why, nobody would even answer my emails, texts, or other forms of communication. So I've gotta move ASAP, while sick, after not being able to work more than a day or two a week for almost 2 1/2 months.

That's where y'all come in. 

I found this place (mold and rot free!) 10 minutes up the road from my current shop. It needs stuff like paint, lights, a ton of commercial grade flourescent bulbs, sealing up a few things, and general cosmetic stuff...plus moving expenses to get from the yucky building into this new one...like, yesterday. Safety deposits, moving costs, having things like an alarm installed, then getting the new place in Nest 615 style shape costs are adding up majorly quick, so here I am, asking y'all to help a small business owner out.

The Impact

For the sake of my business, and for my health/general welfare, I'm here asking for some help. This means more than I can put into words, because honestly, my little shop is my life. I've worked so hard on it, & never in a million years would I have thought 9 months into a 3 year lease I'd have to be doing this right now, but my landlord just won't fix my current place no matter what I do, so any and all help is going to be appreciated on so many levels.

Risks & Challenges

The worst I can do is fail. But failing at the 'new' location is better than 'succeeding' at my current location in a 'sick' building. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • WAIT... Some people don't have money. Not even $10. And that's ok! You can still help me get the shop ready to open to the public. Do you have gently used or new supplies, furniture, building materials, or well...what do you have? I just may have a use for it. (I'm that girl that steals old windows from the side of the road, I have all kinds of uses for all kinds of things.)
  • Post, retweet, reshare and email it to everyone you know. You can still make a difference. 
  • Or do you have something else that I'm totally missing but you know I'm gonna need it? Give a girl a shout, & I'll give you a listen. 
And that's all there is to it!

story:
Frames in Motion is a small business concept centered around the idea of promoting the natural beauty and culture of the California Coast by providing quality photo and framing services to the public. By using a camera phone, tripod, and Bluetooth photo printer our idea is to set up at local events/popular tourist destinations along the coast to provide people the chance to get a professional looking photo while on the go!

     After each photo is printed instantly with high quality photo printer, all customers may browse through our selection of one of a kind frames. Customers will also be given the option to send their own photos via smartphone and have them printed and framed instantly (great gift idea). Picture editing services will potentially be provided as well. 

    *All frames are unique and handcrafted, so merchandise will vary. All shell frames are made with shells found directly in Monterey Bay. Themed frames will also be created for special events and regular announcements will be made on social media to keep our followers informed. We will be using Etsy as an additional selling platform.

    This is a passion project that can be described as a collaboration between photography service and artisian frame making. Our goal is to preserve your memories in a fast, convenient, beautiful way. In order to reach this goal, we are asking for support. All contributions towards our startup are appreciated beyond belief. Thank you for your interest, and we hope to see you at our local bay events in the future. 

-Frames in Motion

Louis Perez & Smokey Heisey

www.etsy.com/shop/framesinmotion

story:
We are ICOD Action Network; We are an East Africa based nonprofit.

In Spring of 2010, together with our Chicago based partner organization Project Focus, we created and implemented a solar powered Internet Center that provides free Permaculture and Information Technology (IT) training to local farmers and youth in Uganda. Our center serves as a resource for information and training in areas of need such as agriculture, education and health to local farming communities.  Our work has benefited over 120,000 people since 2008. Our pitch video above gives you a brief insight into some of our projects.

In 2015,  Vancouver based Lush Manufacturing gave us a $5000 SEED grant that supported  training 7621 farmers in 2015 alone.   177 individual donors also supported our different projects across the country in 2015.  We love permaculture and farmers who do the dirty work, that's why our permaculure trainings are free for all small-holder farmers


WHAT WE NEED


  • We want to work with 11000 more farmers and make our program efficient and sustainable. 
  • We want to train more 10000 farmers in permaculture,  1000 farmers in Information Technology and work with 1000 school children to plant 10000 food trees in their schools, homes and communities.
We need over $50000 to do this and support our multiple-year food security projects! Since its the start of the year, we thought it would be an excellent opportunity to secure $5000 of our total goal. 

WHY IT MATTERS

  • We all need food and farmers to grow it. We're supporting farmers and school children to grow food in an ecologically sound manner.
  • We're creating a community where people can reconnect with their food source. We’ll be offering hands-on learning at farm events throughout the year.
  • We're focused on regenerative agriculture and restoring the land to a healthier state. We are conserving for our  future food and environment systems


IMMEDIATE IMPACT

Thousands of farmers will be able design their own environments and build increasingly self-sufficient food production systems and regenerate the ecosystems that provide for their communities. 

School children will be trained and given fruit trees (mangoes, papaya, oranges, jackfruit, bananas and even coffee) to plant in the schools, homes and communities. They will have control over what they eat!

Farmers will use their training in Information Technology to retrieve relevant information (focused on, but not limited, to agriculture - such as market access and prices, disease and pest control methods, weather patterns, etc) from the training center and use the information to improve their production, lives and communities.
 


HOW WILL MONEY BE USED?

The estimates are to the best of our knowledge given our experience to-date. All funds will be for farmers’ utilization, training and extend permaculture and environmental conservation training to youth, teachers and school children.

We are an  incredibly cost-effective organization and we strive to ensure that all funds are put to intended purposes. So, every dollar you donate will be used only on purposes included in this campaign.

-$1 provides a farmer with a banana tree

-$6 provides a farmer with one coffee tree.

- $70 gives a group of 30 -70 farmers a bicycle they can use to train more farmers

- $80 donation will help pay for a 30 minutes radio show through which farmers can share personal stories with thousands of listeners.

- $120 – gives 250 farmers garden-based training

- $130 - Will help Flavia, one of our most progressive female farmers get 60 trees of coffee to plant in her farm. We have worked with Flavia since 2008 and she has helped organize and train many women farmers in her community. Your donation will give her 60 coffee trees to plant in her farm where trains other farmers.


IT'S ONLY FARMERS, IT'S COMMUNITIES!

Your contribution will not only benefit farmers!

David Magala, the Coordinator of an organization of People Living with HIV/AIDS stated that “Lack of access to sustainable food sources  affects our  health and lives.  I believe that this kind of project will help more People Living with HIV/AIDS live healthier lives and live longer since they will have access to healthy food" 

Our project benefits will spread across different sections of our communities.

Be part of a farmer's story.


THIS IS WHY WE NEED THE MONEY

90% of all rural women in Uganda  work in agriculture and women make up the majority of the agriculture groups that we work with. By training  these women in sustainable agriculture principles, they can build increasingly self-sufficient agriculture systems.

Since 2008, we have been using community organizing and agriculture as a catalyst for social change by bringing people together across social, economic, and cultural barriers. We want to continue doing this year and beyond. Support our work to build food secure communities.


SOME OF OUR STAFF

MICHAEL AHABWE MUGERWA - Executive Director

ALLENAH NINSIIMA -  International Programs Director


See how our community Information Technology Center was launched back in 2010!


WHAT HAPPENS IF WE FAIL TO RAISE THE MONEY?

Over 33000 people that are directly or indirectly benefiting from our food security and Information Technology projects will loose out, farmers will no longer have access to training and our center that you've watched in the video above will be closed. We don't want to see this happen! Every bit help, make a small donation.


BEYOND MONEY - WE NEED YOUR HELP SPREADING THE WORD

We are a grassroots organization driven by staff and volunteers who work hard everyday to ensure our works sustainably  benefits communities we work with. Be part of our team and help spread the work and encourage friends to contribute.


WHAT HAPPENS IS WE RAISE MORE THAN OUR $5000 GOAL

If we very lucky to raise more, we will use extra funds raised to reach out to more farmers and save money to expand on the program in 2016 and beyond.

With your financial support, we will be able to train more farmers in information technology and  permaculture and work with schools and students to regenerate their environments.


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

- Contribute today! Give generously and in an amount that is meaningful to you.

- Spread the word about our campaign. Ask your friends, family and co-workers to contribute too. Tell them you love this!

- Stay connected through our website, facebook or twitter

we very lucky to raise more, we will use extra funds raised to reach out to more
farmers and save money to expand on the program in 2016 and beyond. 
With
your financial support, we will be able to train more farmers in information
technology and  permaculture and work with schools and students to regenerate their
environments.



OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

-
Contribute today! Give generously and in an amount that
is meaningful to you. 
-
Spread the word about our campaign. Ask your friends,
family and co-workers to contribute too. Tell them you love this!
-
Stay connected through our website, facebook or twitter

story:
Short Summary

Hello. My name is Robert Blakley and I am the founder of Velocity Hunting. Being an entrepreneur is a new experience for me, but hard work is not. I have spent the last decade in education as a coach and teacher and loved every minute of it. I plan to harvest my passion for a social environment and connect it with hunting, something my five boys and I can enjoy for many years to come...we know you will too.

Velocity Hunting is an online hunting lease network striving to be the first to serve all 50 states with international aspirations. The Idea to build such a network came about last year on a friends lease, while hunting with my oldest son. It was on the ride home that we started to question why it was so difficult to find a lease.

If you are not a hunter this may be difficult to understand, but those that hunt know finding a good lease is nearly an impossible task. If you don't have land of your own or know someone that knows someone...GOOD LUCK!

*We will offer special memberships to the brave men and women in the military who are often stationed outside of their home town, making it easier for them to find their own special hunting lease.

The donations you give will help this concept come to life, without it... this field of dreams, never gets built.

What We Need & What You Get

To build the Velocity Hunting brand we plan to start with a minimal viable product and phase in as growth and revenue allows. Every penny of the $10,000 will be squeezed to it's fullest marketable value.

$6,000 will be used to build the website.

$3,000 will be used for marketing. We plan to make the most out of every social media outlet. Will will create a youtube channel and podcast a hunting variety show, so a good camera, mic, mixer, pop filter, headphones, laptop and software will need to be purchased.

$1,000 Will be used to pay for the first year of hosting and all the addons needed to get started.

If the $10,000 is not reached, the funds will still be used to fuel Velocity Hunting and its startup, we may just have to scale down a bit further.

The Impact

The hunting industry is 15 MILLION people strong just in the United States. Hunters contribute over 35 BILLION back into our economyeach year, with just over 7 BIllion of that coming from land leasing and ownership...which is my focus!

What I will provide is a network where landowners can list their property for lease, outfitters can advertise their guided services, and hunters can search by a variety of filters. 

*Once we are up and running, VelocityHunting wants to give back to the community by sponsoring our 4-H Gun & Archery clubs. 

Risks & Challenges

While I am not inventing the wheel for this type of  business, I am planning  to put a lift on it and some nice rims.

People quite often overlook the value of the customer/consumer. If you have been through a drive thru of a fast food chain lately, you understand. I plan to put customer service at the top of the list, adding value as often as I can to those that use my services. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand times are tough and it may not be feasable to donate. I totally get it!! 

We all know a few hunters or in my case several dozen. Please pass this along to them, there are perks for all levels of donations that they may enjoy.

Share it with them and anyone else who has an entrepreneurial heart.

DON"T FORGET TO USE THE INDIEGOGO SHARE TOOLS!!

story:
Short Summary

Hello!

My name is KerryAnn Ash.  Mother of three, 2 girls and 1 boy.  I had this idea floating around in my head for about a year.  However, I decided to kick it into high-gear and get it out of my head and into the streets, the more I watch my son grow.  

Although only 5 years old at this point, he is very high on personal grooming and his appearance.  He likes getting his nails clipped, head massaged, feet rubbed, you get the picture!

With the idea in mind and the influence of my son, I started asking the males I knew and women about their husbands, and if they got manicures and pedicures.  Some said that they do.  Others said they would do it more, if they didn't feel "girly" going to the nail places that are around town.  Some men said not a chance.  But when I mentioned what I wanted to do, their eyes lit up!  Then their answer changed, to "Yes, I would go to a place like that."

What We Need & What You Get

The majority of the funding is going into the truck.  It is going to cost about 100,000-110,000 to get customized to the specifications we require.  The remaining of the funds raised in this campaign will go to the insurance, licences required, marketing, supplies, and the 1st month salary of the technicians.  Any overage and/or additional funds raised, will be saved and go towards the brick and mortar location at a later time.  (Not too much later, hopefully!)

We hope to be on the road by July.  If you back this campaign, and you live in the Raleigh/Durham area, we will receive an invite to the ribbon cutting ceremony!!  

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge for us at this point, is getting the funding required to get the mobile vehicle built to customization of the theme.  We do not foresee any other major hurdle(s) once we receive the funds to get the truck on the road.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this link with all your family and friends to make this a reality!!

Thank you!

story:
Zee & the Penthouse

This poor penthouse cafe with a million dollar view is in need of a facelift.  Local business owners Chris Zahn and Sarah Cunningham have taken on that challenge.  They are asking our Boise community to assist in helping them raise the funds needed to creating a top-notch top tier event venue (inspired by The Perch) for everyone to enjoy for years to come.  If you purchase one of our offered PERKS now we will be able to complete ALL of the items on our remodeling list.

We have designed this crowdfunding campaign to give YOU something for supporting us.  Purchase one of our perks and it is like we are giving you money.  In order to complete our wish list during the remodel we need to raise more funds so we are offering what we do best at a discounted rate - food and events.  Take a look at the perks and see if there is one that matches your needs.

BEFORE

AFTER

We are asking for support to raise an additional $80,000 in funds to complete the full extent of the remodel. This includes a kitchen privacy wall, kegerator, new cooler, and modern lighting to create a unique and inspired space for our guests to enjoy for years to come.  Without the additional support of our community we will not be able to fully complete the entire vision we have for the CW Penthouse as the premier wedding/event venue overlooking our much-lauded downtown within the remodeling schedule of February/March 2017.

WISH LIST:

  • Privacy Wall between the food prep area and front of the house to include sound quality
  • New Modern Lighting 
  • Update Bar Area with Faux Finish
  • Kegerator and Wine Cooler

What We Need & What You Get

To assist with the costs of a quality remodel we are offering Exclusive Event Packages available for purchase at astronomically discounted pre-remodel prices as well as additional perks.  These discount prices are being offered to support this campaign and will not be available once we reopen - this is your chance to pre-book a future event to be held in the newly remodeled CW Penthouse space.  We will utilize all funds raised to improve the value of the CW Penthouse venue for you, our customers.  Our project manager will make the tough decisions as to what we can do within our budget.  We already have over $40,000 to complete this ambitious vision but will need an additional $80,000 to see it fully to completion.  Remdels are very expensive - but totally worth it.

Our PERK events may be customized with prior approval - just email and ask.  Chris@zeechristopher.com  

The Impact

By investing in our space you are an integral part of the growth of downtown Boise as the hub of cultural and social activity.  

Bringing the CW Penthouse into the 21st Century with a clean, neutral remodel will allow us to break ahead of other venues and stand tall atop the city - with unobstructed views of the downtown, foothills, and gorgeous Idaho sky.

Risks & Challenges

We are committed to the remodel and re-introduction of the CW Penthouse to our Boise community.  If we are unable to reach our goal of $80,000 we will downsize our vision and postpone some of the wonderful details we would like to complete in the first round of remodeling.

With the help of our design partners at Ethos Design + Remodel & Real Estate  we will prioritize what design elements our clients would like to see done in the first round and begin to build capital for round 2 of the remodel. (We are planning to add roll up doors to marry the patio and the interior dining area, creating more options for our clients, in 2018)  We will begin round 2 of the remodel once we are fully funded and have completed the initial list of tasks.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone can contribute directly to our funding requests.  If you would like to help us out in other ways please consider liking us on Facebook and writing a review of our cafe, event venue, or catering services.  You can also follow us on twitter, instagram and pinterest.

And come visit us often at Zee's Rooftop once our doors reopen!  Thanks for the support.

About Chris and Sarah

Christopher Zahn is the owner, chef, brain child, and florist at Zee Christopher, LLC which is comprised of  Zee’s Rooftop Café, Zee  Catering Company, Zee Christopher Floral. He is also president and founder of the non-profit Corks 4 A Cure, LLC the largest cork recycling company in Idaho and Montana. Chef Zahn has been recognized since 2008 for his excellent work throughout the Treasure Valley. His commitment to purchasing local produce weekly at the Saturday Farmer’s Market and utilizing local vendors shows he has planted deep roots in Boise that he nurtures by supporting and staying involved with his community.

Sarah Cunningham of Ethos Design + Remodel & Real Estate, has designed a beautiful NEW event space in the dated 9th floor Penthouse of the CW Moore Plaza in downtown Boise.

  • View from the Top photo courtesy Allison Corona Photography

story:
Help Savor Strategies Help

Restaurants and Hotels Succeed

Savor Strategies is a consulting and business coaching firm specializing in organizational and professional development for the hospitality industry. We help restaurants, hotels, and other hospitality-related businesses become more successful and profitable; in an industry where nine out of every ten new hospitality businesses fail within the first five years.

 

We're Ready! Help Us Hit The Ground Running 

After three years of planning and development, Savor Strategies opens its doors for business on July 1. This crowdfunding campaign is designed to help us to hit the ground running, by providing us with the working capital needed to cover our first six months of operational expenses, including labor, office and conference room rental, online and video content marketing, promotional and educational materials, technology, transportation, professional memberships, online business subscriptions, accounting and legal fees, and insurance.

 

The Problem We Solve and Why It's Great to Support Us!

Most independently owned restaurants and small hotels (such as B&B's) are started by families, friends, and passionate entrepreneurs.  Owners and their managers typically sacrifice, work long hours, and often invest thousands-upon-thousands of dollars in fulfillment of their dreams. Many of them are instant hits, becoming neighborhood favorites, social and business centers, travel destinations, and employers.  They're also sources of tax revenue for local and federal municipalities, and often add tremendous value to the communities in which they are located.

Such businesses also ultimately provide a great sense of financial independence, professional fulfillment, accomplishment, and prestige for their owners.

So why do most fail?

Unfortunately, most owners and consequently their managers underestimate the scope of expertise, training, attention-to-detail, resources, decision-making, and moment-to-moment supervision required for hotels and restaurants to succeed. Even those who start out fully funded or who buy previously profitable establishments often find themselves overwhelmed by the many variables involved in the day-to-day operations of running a hospitality business.

While research on businesses failure in hospitality once focused primarily on economic and quantitative factors, more and more studies now attribute failure to deficiencies in more qualitative areas: planning, conceptualization, service standards, management, marketing, brand implementation, familial or partnership relationships, staff training, regulatory compliance, bookkeeping, security, location selection, talent retention, alcohol beverage control, technology integration, health and safety, customer relationship management...

The list goes on.

Many of our family and friends - and many of yours -  have been affected by this failure rate, either as owners, employees, investors: even customers. The sad truth is, hospitality businesses don't fail because owners and their employees don't work hard or are underfunded; they fail because most restaurant and hotel owners simply do not know what they're doing. While this may sound like a harsh assessment of folks we love or admire as family, friends, employers, or even the person in the mirror, the emotional distress and economic impact of such failure is ten times harsher. It's a lesson many hospitality owners unfortunately learn the hard way.

That doesn't have to be the case. We can help.

 

How We Help Our Clients

Savor Strategies provides the expertise needed to help more hospitality entrepreneurs succeed. Our team has spent the whole of their careers acquiring the education, experience, skill sets, credentials, and capacities needed to maneuver successfully within our industry.

We've spent the past three years developing a firm that helps our clients succeed in several ways; through:

  • consulting engagements designed to target and resolve specific issues
  • business coaching designed to improve professional and workplace performance
  • workshops designed to produce specific outcomes like business plans and training
  • being a resource for hospitality entrepreneurship in our community through our website, social media, and through Savor Strategies YouTube channel.

Failure often comes to the hardest working among us. It can also become a tremendous source for learning and can be quickly remedied with the right professional intervention. Savor Strategies looks forward to serving our clients and community through our brand of professional resources, and through sharing the hundreds of success stories we plan to create and gather in the years ahead.

 

Our Story(s)

Savor Strategies, like the clients we help, is a collaborative effort and is therefore the story of several people. It's the story of the firm's founder and managing partner Carl Sumter, who is passionate about restaurants and hotels, business, education, and helping others succeed. It's the story of Carl's nephews, Jaleel Sumter and Louis Miller, who decided to become interns for their uncle's firm to explore their shared familial passion for business, finance, and technology. It's the story of our consulting associates, many of whom have provided their special areas of expertise to our development and client work to date. It's the story of our family, friends, clients, former employers, and educators who have believed in and supported our vision throughout the three years following our conception.  And we trust it will be the story of many of you, whom we look forward to meeting, and to thanking for your interest and support during the 30+ days of this campaign.

We look forward to sharing these stories with you in detail during the course of the campaign.

 

We Have Great Perks for You!

Our campaign perks range from obvious (which many of you are into):
 
 
 

...to transformative:

...to mysterious and novel:

For a limited time only, clicking the hotel front desk bell below will reveal our Secret Perk.

Other perks will be featured and created as the campaign progresses. Enjoy!

 

Other Ways You Can Support Our Campaign

Some of our supporters can't contribute financially, though can help in other meaningful ways. Everyone can help ensure our success further by:

  • Spreading the word about our Indiegogo campaign through Facebook 
  • Using the "share" tools provided by Indiegogo
  • Following Savor Strategies on Facebook (and of course "Like' us!)
  • Visiting our website at savorstrategies.com
  • Subscribing to Savor Strategies You Tube Channel
  • Following Savor Strategies on LinkedIn
  • Becoming or referring a client! Contact us through our website for information.

That's all there is to it!

This crowdfunding campaign on Indiegogo is an incredible opportunity for us. We look forward to sharing this experience with you during the weeks ahead! Thank you!

It's the story of our consulting associates, many of whom have provided their special areas of expertise to our development and client work to date. It's the story of our family, friends, clients, former employers, and educators who have believed in and supported our vision throughout the three years following our conception.  And we trust it will be the story of many of you, whom we look forward to meeting, and to thanking for your interest and support during the 30+ days of this campaign.

Our campaign perks range from obvious (which many of you are into):

...to mysterious and novel:
For a limited time only, clicking the hotel front desk bell below will reveal our Secret Perk.

Other perks will be featured and created as the campaign progresses. Enjoy!
 
Other Ways You Can Support Our Campaign

Spreading the word about our Indiegogo campaign through Facebook 
Using the "share" tools provided by Indiegogo
Following Savor Strategies on Facebook (and of course "Like' us!)
