story:
Check out some of our Purrks!

A Brief History of Cat Cafes

The first cat cafe opened in Taiwan in 1998, and became a very popular tourist attraction. The concept grew, and gained traction in Japan, where the living spaces are cramped, and most do not allow pets. Cat cafes became a popular destination for young workers looking for companionship and comfort.

Mews & Brews

Mews & Brews Cat Cafe is a proud member of the Cat Cafe Embassy (http://www.catcafeembassy.com/), whose mission is to get more cats good homes, provide quality drinks and snacks, and be an educational resource for our communities on cat care. We accomplish this by communicating on best practices and providing cozy atmospheres for our cats and customers. We hope to settle ourselves in the Downtown Glendale, Arizona area, specifically Catlin Court.

We will be partnering with Shelley's Desserts to provide high quality, homemade tasting desserts, including gluten free items. From the cafe, you will be able to order tea, coffee, lattes, and smoothies.

Events

Yoga with Cats

Mewvie Nights

Beer/Wine Tastings

Paint Nights

Crocheting/Knitting with Cats

Chair Massage Events

Author Readings/Play Readings

Art Showcases by Local Artists

Student Finals Week - discount on weekly membership during finals week for students who wish to come in and study for any amount of time, free WiFi included

Private Events - If you would like to hold an event such as a birthday party, bridal or baby shower, or other event, you may reserve the entire cat space (there will be a limit on the amount of persons depending on how large our space will be and how many cats will be present)

Memberships and Discounts

Monthly Pass - Unlimited visits for one monthly fee

Student Discount - Discounted one-time entry and memberships for students who show student ID

Veteran and Senior Discounts - Discounts on one-time entry and memberships

Yeah, but who benefits from a cat cafe? The answer is: Everyone!

Cat Cafes benefit shelter cats - Our cat cafe will partner with Sun Cities 4 Paws Rescue who will provide us with cats that will specifically be able to thrive in a free-roam environment where people can come visit and socialize with the cats. This free-roam environment allows the shelter cats to have more freedom and not be stuck in a cage, who would otherwise only be brought out when their cage is cleaned or when someone might be interested in adopting them. It’s a more comfortable environment where they can be themselves, and socialize, if they so choose.

Cat Cafes benefit cat shelters - Most no-kill shelters are at full (if not over) capacity at all times, and have to turn away surrenders. This leads to cats being dumped, sometimes on the street (which contributes to the ever-growing feral population), and other times at shelters that may not be no-kill. Our cat cafe will help relieve the burden of our partner shelter being over-capacity, and also allow the shelter to accept more surrenders.

Cat Cafes benefit people - When you come in after a long day at work, grab a nice hot drink (whether it be tea or coffee), and sit down with our cats, you are allowing the calming effects of cat purrs and snuggles to soothe your inner soul. It’s also scientifically proven that cat purrs are good for your health!

Cat Cafes benefit local businesses - Our cat cafe will be partnering with Shelley’s Desserts, downtown Glendale’s local bakery. When you purchase a baked good from our cat cafe, you aren’t just supporting us as a local business, you are supporting other local businesses too!

Where Will My Money Go?

1. Location, location, location! We have a couple places in mind in the Downtown Glendale area that we're very excited about. However, we need funds to secure them. We don't want to deal with landlords (since they're usually not too keen on having animals in their space), so we are planning to buy the property we want, which will require more money upfront, but it means we can do more with the space, and won't have to ask permission to do it!

2. Build-out/construction. With any location, we will need to have two separate areas, one for the cafe and one for the cat zone. And each part will be required to have separate ventilation systems (due to health regulations) as well as an "airlock" between the two areas (two doors between the spaces, so cats can't escape, or accidentally mix with the food-stuffs). There will also be maximum amounts of catification to think about, making sure that there is a separate area for cats to hang out away from the humans, and hiding places, climbing places, and lots of things to scratch/sniff/rub against. We want to create the ultimate kitty haven.

3. Licensing/Permits. In order to do construction work, and serve food/drinks, we need to have permits to do so.

4. Cafe equipment/Supplies. If you've ever been to a coffee shop, you know they have lots of shiny, stainless steel equipment. We'll need all of that too, to make sure you get the best quality beverages. We'll also need coffee, tea, cups, lids... well, you get the picture.

5. Furniture/Supplies. We didn't forget about the humans! We want to make sure you have comfortable places to sit and snuggle with all of our adorable cats! We also plan to have a quiet library room for students and bookworms, with desks and chairs, so they can study or read in the calming presence of fluffy cats. 

6. Indiegogo fees/Perk fulfillment. Indiegogo takes a little of what we make (they have to make money too!) and it also costs us money to give you guys all this awesome stuff (cost of the shirts, shipping/handling, etc)

Sun Cities 4 Paws 2015 Statistics and Background

In 2015, our partner shelter, Sun Cities 4 Paws, took in 927 cats and adopted 882. We are hoping to increase that amount by allowing cats that best fit our model of a free-roam area to come live at the cafe until such a time that they are adopted by their furr-ever family. Our partner shelter is currently capable of housing about 100 cats/kittens at any given time at each of their main locations, and 8-12 at any given time at both of their partner PetSmart locations. During kitten season, they have upwards of 150-200 kittens in foster between both locations.

Currently, 4 Paws has about 10-12 FeLV+ cats between both locations. Unfortunately for FeLV+ cats, there is a very low chance of getting adopted due to the stigma around cats with FeLV (feline leukemia). As part of our mission at Mews & Brews Cat Cafe, we hope to diminish the stigma around feline leukemia and get more of these cats adopted as they deserve a home just like any other cat. People think that all FeLV+ cats will not live very long. In fact, shelters that are not no-kill will usually put these cats down if they test positive for it. Sun Cities 4 Paws has taken in cats that have tested positive for feline leukemia, rather than put them down. Unfortunately, at this time, they are unable to take in any more unless they can adopt out the ones they currently have, since they require their own separate space away from cats that do not have it.

In 2015, 4 Paws only had 28 cats euthanized (see the chart in our photo gallery!), and those cats either had terminal illnesses or were in the senior foster program. Their Asilomar rating is generally in the 96-98% range. In just the last 3 years, close to 3000 cats have been saved from euthanasia and the streets.

The main challenge of a no-kill shelter is the plight of over-capacity. With people constantly dumping unwanted cats on their doorstep, and a waiting list that extends out for sometimes more than a month, 4 Paws does the best they can. Being a small, no-kill shelter means little to no state/county government funding, excessively high vet/medical costs, dwindling donations, and the difficulty to get grants due to the overabundance of rescues trying to get funding.  

But we can help. YOU can help.  

How?

1. Donate. Support the start-up of our business so we can help our partner shelter. Our cafe will assist in fostering adoptions, as well as raise awareness to the importance of spaying/neutering your pets. Any amount will help.

In our photo gallery, you can find a pie chart breaking down where exactly the funds that you donate will go to help us open!

2. Adopt. Help us get more cats out of the shelters that are ready to go home, so that the shelters can better assist the cats in need of more specific care. We will host adoptions on-site thanks to the training provided to us by our partner shelter.

3. Spay/Neuter. Has your pet been spayed/neutered? Kitten season happens because so many stray/feral cats are not spayed/neutered, and end up contributing to the overall population of strays/ferals by constantly reproducing. If your pet has not been spayed/neutered, please consider doing so. There are a wide variety of free/low-cost spay neuter clinics available. Reach out to us if you would like more information. All of the cats we will have available for adoption will already be spayed/neutered.

4. Volunteer. Whether you would like to volunteer at Mews & Brews, or directly at Sun Cities 4 Paws, there is ample opportunity to get your hands dirty. Contact us for more information.

5. Foster. If you don’t want to have cats long-term, or you’re willing to become a crazy cat lady with 22 cats living in your house with you, consider fostering. This helps open up the shelters to take in more cats. Contact us for more information.

6. Want to help, but none of the above look interesting? Contact us. We will need people to help us design and build out our cafe, catify our space, make sure we’re stocked with the right materials, etc. We will do our best to find a place for any willing volunteer who wants to help us out.

For more information on Feline Leukemia, see this article: http://www.peteducation.com/article.cfm?c=1+213...

For more information on the effects that spaying/neutering can do for the overpopulation of ferals, specifically TNR (trap, neuter, return) programs, see this article: https://www.abqjournal.com/895490/city-tnr-cuts...

For more FAQ's, visit our website FAQ's page! www.mewsandbrews.com/faq

Sun Cities 4 Paws Bio & Memberships

4 Paws is no kill, non-profit, volunteer, tax-exempt organization. Our mission is to rescue cats in the Sun Cities area; to provide temporary care either in foster homes or in a permanent shelter for such animals, while facilitating their adoption in appropriate homes; to cooperate with other organizations dedicated to the rescue and care of homeless animals, and to work for humane solutions to the problem of pet overpopulation.

Income is derived from adoptions, memberships, thrift store sales, fundraising events, and bequests.

story:
Wait, WHAT?

Some of you have followed us from our very first days at our stall in the former Marketplace on Ridge Avenue.  Many of you have joined the journey since we moved to our current home on Conrad Street.  After 6 incredible years here, we’ve outgrown our 900 sq ft and are ready for the next step – a big move, a new name, and a CAFÉ!

We purchased the building in June 2015 and spent the last two years raising funds and designing a beautiful space for our customers and staff to enjoy together, while continuing to keep Falls Flowers running at full steam.  Now, we’re in the home stretch as the building nears completion: we’re gearing up to purchase equipment and fixtures to fit-out the space, hire and train additional staff, build relationships with more local artisans, and get everyone excited.

Proposed storefront

We’ve been listening as our neighbors have wished aloud for a modern gathering space to serve as a cornerstone of the community, and we’ve always believed that community involvement has been the key to a successful business.  We’re proud to call East Falls our home and we’re eager to do our part in making our community shine.  But WE NEED YOUR HELP.  We’re asking you to show your support for this project and get us to the finish line.

You’ll be supporting a local business run by one of your neighbors.  You’ll be helping us to bring in another local favorite, High Point Coffee.  You’ll be helping to build a community gathering space.  AND you’ll be voting with your dollars that THIS is something that you want in East Falls.

Why Vault + Vine?

As a business owner and resident, I am 100% committed to serving East Falls first.  My hope is that we provide a valuable enough service to that you will continue to support us through the name change.  However, most of our business currently comes from outside the neighborhood, with events and deliveries making up the majority of our revenue.  With our new, expanded business model for 3507 Midvale Avenue, “Falls Flowers” was no longer big enough to express it all.  I sought a name that would give people a sense of what they might experience when they come to our new space.  We’re growing from flowers and some plants and some gifts, to flowers and a greenhouse, and a café, and an event space, and more gifts (stationary, home goods, textiles, bath and body, the list goes on), and, eventually, a small nursery. It is bittersweet to be changing names but, after much contemplation, I strongly believe that it is the right thing to do.  But, if you want to keep calling us Falls Flowers, we won’t mind one bit!

The JOURNEY

In 2008, my husband and I were looking for a new neighborhood to call home.  Cambridge (MA) was great, but we couldn't afford to buy a home, and there didn't seem to be room for growth. We eventually bought a house in East Falls because it was close to my family, and felt like a neighborhood where we could set down permanent roots and create the life we were seeking.  The following year, I decided to jump in with both feet, opening Falls Flowers as a stall in the former Marketplace at East Falls.  When the Marketplace closed the following year, rather than shutting down with it, we moved everything into the basement and in February 2011 opened up shop in our current home on Conrad Street.

Our 1st location inside the Marketplace at East Falls, 2010
 

Our current home at 3421 Conrad Street, 2017

 

Over the past 7½ years, Falls Flowers has grown from a single employee (me!) to employing a staff of five.  While both our retail and events business has grown considerably, our event work has often taken a front seat over retail operations, despite always knowing that there was much more room for retail growth. By 2014 we’d nearly reached maximum capacity for growth in our current space and were in desperate need of a larger location that could also accommodate my dream of incorporating a café.

Moving Falls Flowers outside of East Falls was not an option.  I'd had my eye on 3507 Midvale from the day we moved into the neighborhood, and jumped at the opportunity to purchase the building in 2015.  I've launched an Indiegogo campaign for this project in order to bring the community into a project for which you have been vocal advocates. From day one of Falls Flowers, I have always believed that the secret to successful small business is community involvement.  As neighbors, we support each other, which is why I'm reaching out and asking for your support. After two years of tirelessly working towards bringing our new retail and cafe space to life, I'm asking you to step up to the plate and show us that you believe in this project too.

The NUMBERS

Your financial support will give us a much needed boost to finish this project without taking on additional debt.  Thus far, we've received a combination of traditional and non-traditional loans to finance the purchase and renovation of the property. Your contribution towards our $50k goal will go towards purchasing the equipment needed for the cafe and help us to complete the interior fit out of the retail space.  While we do have additional avenues of funding available to us, your support here will allow us to move more quickly without the burden of interest or repayments (other than the great perks we're offering!).

For those of you who love to crunch numbers, here's where things stand:

  • Building purchase (cost + legal fees): $440k
  • Building renovation (permits, consultants, plumbing, hvac, electrical, new 2nd floor event space, greenhouse structures, parking lot updates): $650k
  • Interior fit out (counters, light fixtures, shelving, display structures, etc): $75k
  • Cafe equipment (espresso machine, grinder, coffee maker, fridges, sinks) : $25k
  • Inventory (plants for stocking the greenhouses, coffee and pastries from High Point for the café, more of everything we currently carry, new merchandise such as home textiles, bath and body):  $15K
  • Outdoor seating and plant nursery: TBD (on the horizon…)

That’s a grand total of $1.2 million.  Whoa!  But, we’re 100% positive that this is a worthwhile investment. Regardless of whether or not we reach our goal, every dollar we receive during this campaign will go towards getting our doors open in time to celebrate with you this Spring.

The GOODS

As a token of our gratitude, we're offering a number of perks that will only be available through this campaign.  Whether you’re in it for the coffee, or have been dying to take a design workshop with us, we’re certain that there’s something for everyone here. Need to see it with your own eyes? Check a few of these goodies out below:

Postcard ($10) or 12x18 Poster ($30), photo credit: Shannon Collins Photography

 

Smell good: our custom Flower Shop scented candle ($40), hand poured into a limited edition vessel (TBD!) by our friends at Olliver

 

Adopt a Plant: you'll have the opportunity to choose a plant and we'll plant it up in a limited edition planter ($75)

 

Floral trifecta: 3 months of flowers for your home  ($250)

 

Lifeline: A year's worth of drip coffee and a special edition mug ($500)

There are many more great perks of all shapes and sizes! Make sure to check them out on the right.

The IMPACT

Currently, if you live in East Falls and want to purchase unique gifts for yourself or loved ones, the nearest options are to travel to Manayunk, Mt Airy, or Chestnut Hill. While we enjoy visiting, we think that East Falls deserves a retail hub of its own!  Our new location will also give Midvale Avenue a much-needed boost, bringing some fresh landscaping to break up the expanse of pavement between Chuck’s and MAT.

Your contribution will also help us to keep doing what we do best.  Every year, we donate our time and money towards supporting and growing our neighborhood, working with community groups such as: East Falls Community Council, East Falls Development Corporation, the Sports Association, Historical Society, Friends of Falls Library, Friends of Laurel Hill, and many more.  This community commitment averages out to 18% of our annual profits! 

And you can rest easy knowing that you’re supporting a genuinely good business.  We’re a part of a growing movement of businesses around the world certified as a B-Corp. B-Corps are for-profit companies certified by the nonprofit B Lab to meet rigorous standards of social and environmental performance, accountability, and transparency. We were the first florist (in the world!) to make this commitment, striving to do what a good business should do: support our community, buy and source locally, pay our employees well, and follow high standards of sustainability.

The RISKS

We’ve been doing what we do for a while now, but it doesn’t keep us from the many risks and challenges that come with this project. Investing such a large amount of money in a building and business plan the way we have is a really BIG risk! There are a lot of pieces that must fall into place perfectly for all of this to work out.  However, we’ve been doing our homework, talking to experts, and working around the clock to minimize these risks for ourselves and for you.  Two things to consider:

  • Starting Falls Flowers during a major economic recession was no joke. It was hard and the business lost a lot of money in the first year.  Nevertheless, persistence and a willingness to ask for help got us through those critical first years.
  • I have café experience! Yep, the café concept isn’t coming out of left field – I’ve spent 3 years working in cafés of different shapes and sizes, with 1 year of management experience.

Journeys like this aren’t without their share of mistakes and failures. The key to success in our particular story is that we’re ALL IN, 100% committed to doing whatever it takes to make it work.  It doesn’t hurt that we’ve cultivated a community of experts to advise and help us along the way!

The WORD

Whether or not you’re able to make a donation, you can help us spread the word. Use Indigogo’s share tools (up top, below our goal), use the hashtags #EastFallsIsGrowing, and #3507Midvale, and don’t forget to tag us!  We’re on Facebook and Instagram @FallsFlowers.  Tell your friends and family, neighbors and coworkers about the awesome perks they can receive for their support of a great local business.

 

With love and gratitude,

Peicha

business owner and resident, I am 100% committed to serving East Falls first.  My hope is that we provide a valuable enough service to that you will continue to support us through the name change.  However, most of our business currently comes from outside the neighborhood, with events and deliveries making up the majority of our revenue.  With our new, expanded business model for 3507 Midvale Avenue, “Falls Flowers” was no longer big enough to express it all.  I sought a name that would give people a sense of what they might experience when they come to our new space.  We’re growing from flowers and some plants and some gifts, to flowers and a greenhouse, and a café, and an event space, and more gifts (stationary, home goods, textiles, bath and body, the list goes on), and, eventually, a small nursery. It is bittersweet to be changing names but, after much contemplation, I strongly believe that it is the right thing to do.  But, if you want to keep calling us Falls Flowers, we won’t mind one bit!The JOURNEYIn 2008, my husband and I were looking for a new neighborhood to call home.  Cambridge (MA) was great, but we couldn't afford to buy a home, and there didn't seem to be room for growth. We eventually bought a house in East Falls because it was close to my family, and felt like a neighborhood where we could set down permanent roots and create the life we were seeking.  The following year, I decided to jump in with both feet, opening Falls Flowers as a stall in the former Marketplace at East Falls.  When the Marketplace closed the following year, rather than shutting down with it, we moved everything into the basement and in February 2011 opened up shop in our current home on Conrad Street.Our 1st location inside the Marketplace at East Falls, 2010 Our current home at 3421 Conrad Street, 2017 Over the past 7½ years, Falls Flowers has grown from a single employee (me!) to employing a staff of five.  While both our retail and events business has grown considerably, our event work has often taken a front seat over retail operations, despite always knowing that there was much more room for retail growth. By 2014 we’d nearly reached maximum capacity for growth in our current space and were in desperate need of a larger location that could also accommodate my dream of incorporating a café.Moving Falls Flowers outside of East Falls was not an option.  I'd had my eye on 3507 Midvale from the day we moved into the neighborhood, and jumped at the opportunity to purchase the building in 2015.  I've launched an Indiegogo campaign for this project in order to bring the community into a project for which you have been vocal advocates. From day one of Falls Flowers, I have always believed that the secret to successful small business is community involvement.  As neighbors, we support each other, which is why I'm reaching out and asking for your support. After two years of tirelessly working towards bringing our new retail and cafe space to life, I'm asking you to step up to the plate and show us that you believe in this project too.The NUMBERSYour financial support will give us a much needed boost to finish this project without taking on additional debt.  Thus far, we've received a combination of traditional and non-traditional loans to finance the purchase and renovation of the property. Your contribution towards our $50k goal will go towards purchasing the equipment needed for the cafe and help us to complete the interior fit out of the retail space.  While we do have additional avenues of funding available to us, your support here will allow us to move more quickly without the burden of interest or repayments (other than the great perks we're offering!).For those of you who love to crunch numbers, here's where things stand:

Building purchase (cost + legal fees): $440k


Building renovation (permits, consultants, plumbing, hvac, electrical, new 2nd floor event space, greenhouse structures, parking lot updates): $650k


Interior fit out (counters, light fixtures, shelving, display structures, etc): $75k


Cafe equipment (espresso machine, grinder, coffee maker, fridges, sinks) : $25k


Inventory (plants for stocking the greenhouses, coffee and pastries from High Point for the café, more of everything we currently carry, new merchandise such as home textiles, bath and body):  $15K


Outdoor seating and plant nursery: TBD (on the horizon…)

That’s a grand total of $1.2 million.  Whoa!  But, we’re 100% positive that this is a worthwhile investment. Regardless of whether or not we reach our goal, every dollar we receive during this campaign will go towards getting our doors open in time to celebrate with you this Spring.The GOODSAs a token of our gratitude, we're offering a number of perks that will only be available through this campaign.  Whether you’re in it for the coffee, or have been dying to take a design workshop with us, we’re certain that there’s something for everyone here. Need to see it with your own eyes? Check a few of these goodies out below:Postcard ($10) or 12x18 Poster ($30), photo credit: Shannon Collins Photography Smell good: our custom Flower Shop scented candle ($40), hand poured into a limited edition vessel (TBD!) by our friends at Olliver Adopt a Plant: you'll have the opportunity to choose a plant and we'll plant it up in a limited edition planter ($75) Floral trifecta: 3 months of flowers for your home  ($250) Lifeline: A year's worth of drip coffee and a special edition mug ($500)There are many more great perks of all shapes and sizes! Make sure to check them out on the right.The IMPACTCurrently, if you live in East Falls and want to purchase unique gifts for yourself or loved ones, the nearest options are to travel to Manayunk, Mt Airy, or Chestnut Hill. While we enjoy visiting, we think that East Falls deserves a retail hub of its own!  Our new location will also give Midvale Avenue a much-needed boost, bringing some fresh landscaping to break up the expanse of pavement between Chuck’s and MAT.Your contribution will also help us to keep doing what we do best.  Every year, we donate our time and money towards supporting and growing our neighborhood, working with community groups such as: East Falls Community Council, East Falls Development Corporation, the Sports Association, Historical Society, Friends of Falls Library, Friends of Laurel Hill, and many more.  This community commitment averages out to 18% of our annual profits! And you can rest easy knowing that you’re supporting a genuinely good business.  We’re a part of a growing movement of businesses around the world certified as a B-Corp. B-Corps are for-profit companies certified by the nonprofit B Lab to meet rigorous standards of social and environmental performance, accountability, and transparency. We were the first florist (in the world!) to make this commitment, striving to do what a good business should do: support our community, buy and source locally, pay our employees well, and follow high standards of sustainability.The RISKSWe’ve been doing what we do for a while now, but it doesn’t keep us from the many risks and challenges that come with this project. Investing such a large amount of money in a building and business plan the way we have is a really BIG risk! There are a lot of pieces that must fall into place perfectly for all of this to work out.  However, we’ve been doing our homework, talking to experts, and working around the clock to minimize these risks for ourselves and for you.  Two things to consider:
Starting Falls Flowers during a major economic recession was no joke. It was hard and the business lost a lot of money in the first year.  Nevertheless, persistence and a willingness to ask for help got us through those critical first years.
I have café experience! Yep, the café concept isn’t coming out of left field – I’ve spent 3 years working in cafés of different shapes and sizes, with 1 year of management experience.
Journeys like this aren’t without their share of mistakes and failures. The key to success in our particular story is that we’re ALL IN, 100% committed to doing whatever it takes to make it work.  It doesn’t hurt that we’ve cultivated a community of experts to advise and help us along the way!The WORDWhether or not you’re able to make a donation, you can help us spread the word. Use Indigogo’s share tools (up top, below our goal), use the hashtags #EastFallsIsGrowing, and #3507Midvale, and don’t forget to tag us!  We’re on Facebook and Instagram @FallsFlowers.  Tell your friends and family, neighbors and coworkers about the awesome perks they can receive for their support of a great local business. With love and gratitude,Peicha

story:
Summary

I'm Gregory, a Frenchman who has traveled Europe and the world, passionate about other culture and their wonders. I'm married to my fantastic Italian wife Claudia. Her family comes from a small village located in the hills of the Aurunci Park, about 100km south of Rome. It is called Esperia. She has always talked to me about that village where she grew-up, the peacefulness of the place, the kindness of its' inhabitants and all these great moments she had crisscrossing an area full of stories (from the turbulent medieval times to the WW2 epic battle of Monte Cassino:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monte_Cassino) and legends (Ulysse traveled the nearby waters). When going there for the first time I was hooked by the fantastic unspoiled hills where wild horses live, the kindness of the people living the area, the incredible taste of the food, the vicinity of a mind-blowing seafront. 

Esperia is a village with narrow cobblestone streets and stairs, build on the flank of the mountain, under the protection of a XII century castle (http://www.icastelli.it/it/lazio/frosinone/espe...). While being only few kilometers away from the Rome-Naples highway, and less than 30' drive from main cities like Cassino and Gaeta/Formia, the village slowly slowly loses its' appeal to families. The few local shops struggle to stay open. Still, the locals are really bind to their community, their history and put a lot of effort in keeping their traditions alive. One of these traditions is the infiorata, a religious celebration during which tapestries made up of petals are realised in the streets (http://www.diocesisora.it/pdigitale/clicca-linf...). Other celebration include the local summer festivals like the Festa dei Vicoli (https://youtu.be/sXalsLF2okE). The local council also invests a lot in their local museum, the refurbishment of old city quarters and just created the infrastructure around the newly found dinosaurs footprints (see below picture). The village is also ideally located for visiting the famous Monte Cassino Abbey, the ancient city of Gaeta (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaeta) with its old fish markets natural sea grotto (www.tripadvisor.com/Attraction_Review-g187790-d...) , its' medieval cathedral and also for day trips to the Royal Palace of Caserta (http://reggiaofcaserta.altervista.org), the Amalfi coast (http://www.amalficoast.com) or Pompei (www.britannica.com/place/Pompeii).

The efforts made by the Esperian community are not really visible to tourists and their visit is not made easier considering the limited accommodation options the village has to propose.  Our love for this community, the richness of what it can propose fueled us to make this project of transforming an old traditional 300sqm house into a vacation home for whoever in search for peaceful and unspoiled places. This vacation home would accommodate easily 10 to 15 people with its' 4 bedrooms, 2 living rooms and 4 bathrooms. By having regular visitors in Esperia we would support the local businesses and also help uncover an area easily reachable from the international Rome airport. The house has just been bought with the idea of the vacation house in mind and it is even more meaningful to us as it was a house where my wife has spent a part of her childhood.

Our project is not only about repairing a house and refresh it back to the level of comfortable and modern facilities, but also to improve the village touristic capacity and foremost help visitors getting in touch with the local community. The work will be performed by local builders, plumbers and electricians to support local economy. In parallel we will build privileged connection with the local authorities, shops, restaurants and artists in order to involve each and everyone in welcoming our visitors.  

In order to be able to welcome visitors, the house would need a full renovation from house wiring, plumbing, heating system, insulation as well as some building upgrades. The workload is quite important and would mean activity for the local workmanship for some months. Although this could be performed step by step, a slow-pace upgrade would postpone the opening of the house to tourists. The impact from your contribution would mean giving a decisive boost to this community in terms of short term building activity. The second long term effect, welcoming tourists and visitors, is foreseen to start by end of spring 2017. Their arrival would give another support to the local community.     

What We Need & What You Get

What we need:

  • Renovating the huge surface of the house would cost 90.000 EUR, divided into:
    • Heating system: 15.000 EUR
    • Electrical wiring: 10.000 EUR
    • Changing windows: 30.000 EUR
    • Plumbing: 15.000 EUR
    • Building and painting: 20.000 EUR

What you get:

  • As it is also about sharing our love for this place the perks are obviously all about it:
    • All participants will get their names on our Gold book and a big thanks on our Facebook page
    • 25 EUR: an aperitif for 2 with a sunset view on our terrace. The event will have to be booked in advance to ensure availability

  • 50 EUR: a walking tour of the Aurunci Mounts and Esperia for 2 to get an inside experience of this magical place. The tour will finish with an aperitif on our terrace. The tour will have to be booked in advance to ensure availability.

  • 150 EUR: you'll get the chance to have the house for yourself for a full week-end (1 night). This will be the perfect opportunity to enjoy the quite and relaxing life of Esperia, from the inside. The house will have to be booked in advance to ensure availability.
  • 300 EUR: you'll get the chance to have the house for yourself for 3 days (2 nights). We will also take you for a hiking tour in the natural park of Aurunci mounts with a top view of the Gulf of Gaeta/Naples. The house will have to be booked in advance to ensure availability.

​

  • 1.000 EUR: you'll get the chance to have the house for yourself for a full week (6 nights). This will give you the time to relax, visit the region and meet the locals in their daily life. We will also take you for a hiking tour in the natural park of Aurunci mounts with a top view of the Gulf of Gaeta/Naples. The house will have to be booked in advance to ensure availability.
  • 1.800 EUR: you'll get the chance to have the house for yourself for 2 full weeks (13 nights). This will give you the time to relax, visit the region and meet the locals in their daily life. We will also take you for a hiking tour in the natural park of Aurunci mounts with a top view of the Gulf of Gaeta/Naples. The house will have to be booked in advance to ensure availability.
  • 2.400 EUR: you'll get the chance to have the house for yourself for 2 full weeks (13 nights). This will give you the time to relax, visit the region and meet the locals in their daily life. We will also take you for a hiking tour in the natural park of Aurunci mounts with a top view of the Gulf of Gaeta/Naples. We will also organise a 2 days sailing trip to the Pontine Islands (Ventotene, Ponza or Palmarola). The sailing trip is for maximum 4 people, with a night on-board. Depending on the weather conditions and your preference we may cross from Gaeta or San Felice Circeo. The crossing takes 5 to 8 hours before we can land or enjoy a swim. We shall sail back the day after. The house and the trip will have to be booked in advance to ensure availability.

 

What if...?

If we do not reach the entire goal, the money will still entirely be used for the house renovation. The final scope may be postponed but it is all about getting there and sharing the best of this place.

On the other hand, if the goal is exceeded we can already think about investing in other homes in Esperia and improving the accommodation options in the village. 

The Impact

The impact of such project is huge on small communities. First, making sure local manpower is working gives it more reasons to believe that the living locally is sustainable and helps the community being alive. Secondly, creating an infrastructure to attract visitors and generate more sustainable local activity is creating long term reasons to invest more and make locals live better.

My wife and I are used to dealing with activities that require planning and organizing work with contractors and founding funds to finance these works, although our careers are focused on high technology activities. We have personally invested in smaller project in northern Latium in the beautifully renovated village of Salisano where we have bought and renovated a 50sqm house. After replacing the roof, upgrading the heating and electrical system the house was lend to a person who wanted to leave the stress of a capital city and integrate a small and quiet community. The experiment has been a success!    

Risks & Challenges

Restoring a house can obviously face lots of hurdles but let's say it can always be overcome. We have renovated several houses and we think that options can often be found. However, the main hurdle for this project will be to spread the word out and attract people to Esperia. By creating a nice place to go to will be an asset for our advertisement but it won't do everything. 

So, once we have our place ready we will create our web and Facebook page presenting our place, Esperia, the region and central Italy. We'll share this with activities that are already famous locally (shops, beach clubs), tripadvisor and seek publication on travel magazines.  

Other Ways You Can Help

By giving but if you cannot just get the word out through your social media networks or pay a visit to Esperia.  (Remember to use the Indiegogo share tool.)

story:
Short Summary
(for paypal donation send to: filipehvinhas@hotmail.com)

The community is already built. So, there are a lot of people ready to jump in when this project is ready. You may be asking why they don’t fund us. Well in Portugal the minimal wage barely pays your bills, also most of our community are students, so most people can't help because of the expenses with college and basic needs.

The location is on one of the most beautiful cities of the north Portugal, Aveiro, known as the Portuguese Venice. Due to have train terminal and relatively new highways this city seems to us a perfect location not only because of its accessibility, but also sunny and warm weather, and its great views, touristic sites and beaches (just in case we get tired from gaming).

We already have all the consoles that we need, this includes PS2, PS3, PS4, Xbox 360, Wii, PC. But we are struggling to pay the furniture and the TVs.

What We Need & What You Get

Half of the money will be mainly used to get the furniture that we need and the electronic equipment. 

To be more precise, around 30 chairs, 10 bean bags, 10 tables, surround sound system, 10 televisions or monitors, 5 shelfs, fridge, customizable wall mural, 1 video projector1, a bar counter, pinball machine and a air hockey table. 

The remaining will be used to paint the walls, create a small food and drinks stock, install wi-fi and save some funds  as a reward for future tournaments.


The rewards are the following:

  • 1€ - A special and unique video, to each donator, showing our gratitude. You can choose the gender of the person doing it.
     
  • 5€​ - You will receive a deadpool keychain. Also we do some photoshoots over the year, we can give you full acess to them, usually most cosplayers are girls. 
  • 10€​ - Get a League of Legends Teemo cosplay hat. 
  • 25€​ - Receive everything above and a badass looking T-Shirt from your favorite anime. All T-shirts are posted in the gallery, to choose the style, all t-shirts in the gallery are marked with a code, example "Naruto #3". Few examples. 
  • 50€​ -  Sadly the T-Shirts are not on this pack... but you will get an amazing Akatsuki Cosplay Cloak instead!... and you can join, free of charge, every tournament done in our community. CS:GO, LOL, Overwatch, Magic The Gathering, etc during a year. 
  • 100€ - You win everything above, expect the akatsuki cosplay. And you can choose one fo the following figures: (Android 18 - Scultures Budokai 06 | S.H. Figuarts - Bruce Lee | Goku SS2 - Scultures Budokai 06 | S.H.Figuarts - Bowser | Gotenks - Master Stars Piece) *More images in the gallery*
  • 250€ - Win the keychain, Teemo hat, a T-shirt and this Batman - Gotham Knight (Sixth Scale Figure) from Sideshow Collectibles. Or you may choose one of those bundles (Bowser + Bruce Lee) or  (Android 18 + Goku SS2 + Gotenks) 

 

The Impact

This will be an amazing spot, for geeks, gamers and otakus to meet. There isn’t much around to do. Portugal is still in a stone age when we think about entertainment. We just want to create a great place for people to hang out, have fun, chill, relax, maybe meet the "gamer girl" of their dreams, who knows! If you have the same geek heart as we do, you'll understand how awesome this will be. You are probably from a foreign country and may not visit it, but you'll feel great making our project come true.

Risks & Challenges

Well, to be honest, the only challenge we must face so far is the lack of money to start up; Buying the equipment and furniture needed. Other than that, we have the project all planed and ready to go. There are no risks, since we are ready to support this even if it’s not profitable, but self-sustainable.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t support us financially, would be amazing if you could share this to your friends and family, maybe someone doesn’t mind helping :D

The rewards are the following:


1€ - A special and unique video, to each donator, showing our gratitude. You can choose the gender of the person doing it. 

5€​ - You will receive a deadpool keychain. Also we do some photoshoots over the year, we can give you full acess to them, usually most cosplayers are girls. 


10€​ - Get a League of Legends Teemo cosplay hat. 


25€​ - Receive everything above and a badass looking T-Shirt from your favorite anime. All T-shirts are posted in the gallery, to choose the style, all t-shirts in the gallery are marked with a code, example "Naruto #3". Few examples. 


50€​ -  Sadly the T-Shirts are not on this pack... but you will get an amazing Akatsuki Cosplay Cloak instead!... and you can join, free of charge, every tournament done in our community. CS:GO, LOL, Overwatch, Magic The Gathering, etc during a year. 


100€ - You win everything above, expect the akatsuki cosplay. And you can choose one fo the following figures: (Android 18 - Scultures Budokai 06 | S.H. Figuarts - Bruce Lee | Goku SS2 - Scultures Budokai 06 | S.H.Figuarts - Bowser | Gotenks - Master Stars Piece) *More images in the gallery*

250€ - Win the keychain, Teemo hat, a T-shirt and this Batman - Gotham Knight (Sixth Scale Figure) from Sideshow Collectibles. Or you may choose one of those bundles (Bowser + Bruce Lee) or  (Android 18 + Goku SS2 + Gotenks) 


 

The Impact
This will be an amazing spot, for geeks, gamers and otakus to meet. There isn’t much around to do. Portugal is still in a stone age when we think about entertainment. We just want to create a great place for people to hang out, have fun, chill, relax, maybe meet the "gamer girl" of their dreams, who knows! If you have the same geek heart as we do, you'll understand how awesome this will be. You are probably from a foreign country and may not visit it, but you'll feel great making our project come true.

Risks & Challenges
Well, to be honest, the only challenge we must face so far is the lack of money to start up; Buying the equipment and furniture needed. Other than that, we have the project all planed and ready to go. There are no risks, since we are ready to support this even if it’s not profitable, but self-sustainable.

Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can’t support us financially, would be amazing if you could share this to your friends and family, maybe someone doesn’t mind helping :D

story:
About the Owner 

My name is Tiffany Richardson and i'm a US Navy Veteran and soon to be college graduate majoring in Business Administration. I've always had a passion for hair but not until recently understood the disconnect between beauty supply stores and consumers. Utilizing what I've learned in school, I began to think of ways I could possible begin to change this disparity, of very few Black owned Beauty Supply stores in my area and the country. I began to connect with resources throughout my community to see if it was possible for me to open my own store. It was like opening the flood gates as i dove more into the history of the beauty supply industry and just how blind i was to what was going on. I researched for days until one day I thought, why can't I open my own Beauty Supply Store...that's mobile! 

This is our first fundraiser. The vision I have for our business is something I would've never thought was possible for me to achieve. This fundraiser will be the first stepping stone to making this store more than just a beauty supply business. I would like there to be periodical events hosted by Headz Up Beauty Supply that focus on educating women about their hair and the products they put in it as well as DIY sessions that show women how to maintain their hair while in certain styles. Instead of just selling products to the consumer, I would like the customer to know that we are genuinely interested in knowing you AND your hair journey. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 We are proud to be a Veteran/Woman/Black Owned business in Hampton Roads and we're honored to share this experience with you. Unfortunately, there aren't a whole lot of financial opportunities for start up businesses such as ours, so that's where you come in! 

Your donations will go towards purchasing inventory, basic marketing, and the purchase of the truck, which will be our mobile store. We want to ensure that everyone understands that we realize what a huge industry this is and that success doesn't come overnight. This is exactly why we follow our motto, the 3 S's: Stay Focused, Start Small, and Seek Stability. We understand that as a small and new business, we can't do everything we want all at once. This is why we are currently focusing on building inventory to shorten shipping time, consistently performing market research to keep up on our competition, advertising our business daily through social media, flyers, and word of mouth, and continuing to stay on top of new trends and products in the beauty supply and hair industry. 

Your contributions mean more to us than you know, SO when you make a donation,at the end of the campaign we will send you a gift! Now, if you're scratching your head wondering, "What am I going to do with some free weave?(If you're a guy)" Don't fret just yet! We have some pretty awesome items that even the guys will love! Check it out!:

  • $15 Donation: One T-shirt with the Company's Logo on the front
  • $25 Donation: One Mug with the company's Logo
  • $50 Donation: One T-shirt with the Company's Logo, Tote Bag, and a 5% discount off of products online (excluding Wigs and cannot be combined with an existing sale)(Please contact us before you use your discount)
  • $100 Donation: One Hooded Sweatshirt with the Company's Logo on the front and a 10% discount off of products online (excluding Wigs and cannot be combined with an existing sale)(Please contact us before you use your discount)
  • $250 Donation: One Hooded Sweatshirt with the Company's Logo on the front, Tote Bag, and 25% discount off of products online (cannot be combined with an existing sale)(Please contact us before you use your discount)
  • $500 Donation: One Hooded Sweatshirt with the Company's Logo on the front, Tote Bag, One Mug with the company's Logo, and a 30% discount off of products online (this discount can be combined with any sale going on between 06/15/17 to 09/01/17)(Please contact us before you use your discount)
  • $1000, Official Sponsor: One Hooded Sweatshirt with the Company's Logo on the front, Tote Bag, One Mug with the company's Logo, A Feature on Our Website, and 45% discount off of products online (this discount can be combined with any sale going on between 06/15/17 to 09/01/17)(Please contact us before you use your discount)

The Impact

We truly value your support and contributions and your donations show us that you believe in our vision. Your support not only shows genuine concern for the problems in the industry and our community, but also for the confidence that if Headz Up Beauty Supply can succeed and inspire, that inspiration can be a seed in our community that will one day turn those problems into solutions. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share this page with someone who can! We appreciate any and all help.

 

Again, we are greatly humbled to have your support and hope that one day we show you the amount of our gratitude!

story:
Origin Story

The OmniSom Pillow is the love child of two primary objectives: better sleep and better community. The revolutionary shift prevention design was developed by a narcoleptic to optimize quality of sleep. Upon successfully crafting the first prototype of the tri-compartment pillow design, the narcoleptic thought everybody should be able to feel this well rested every morning. Countless modifications later, the OmniSom Pillow was presented to friends and family, achieving rave reviews.

To satisfy the resultant demanding horde, several production options were considered. The most recommended approach is to outsource manufacturing and operate akin to a retailer or wholesaler. That approach does not sit well with the OmniSom Pillow team for several reasons, but first and foremost because the lack of control over the sources of materials and practices of production facilities results in just another mass produced, environmentally irresponsible driver for inhumane labor conditions. Since we believe in the awesome power of better sleep from the OmniSom Pillow, the only option, to ensure quality and environmental friendliness of materials and have a positive impact on the community at large and local labor force, is to manufacture the OmniSom Pillow ourselves. 

     ALL PERKS GUARANTEED, regardless of goal achievement! The delivery date of the pillows was set to reflect all potential outcomes of this campaign, such as the additional  time required to handcraft the pillows if underfunded, or to transform a local eyesore into our manufacturing facility if overfunded.  So, view the delivery date as the absolute latest you can begin to benefit from the OmniSom Pillow experience, but keep in mind it will most likely be much sooner. 

The Plan (What you’re really doing with your money)

  The lowest cost startup plan for the OmniSom Pillow can be achieved for $90,000. The funds would provide for six full-time local manufacturing jobs at an actual living wage with full benefits, equipment (for cutting, sewing, filling, weighing, and packing on site) for a production capacity of 100 pillows per day (or 2,000 pillows per month), leased industrial premises, all other initial expenses, and only one month of operating expenses. This is incredibly high risk due to the lack of operational funding beyond the first month. Two risk mitigating factors to consider; an anticipated exclusive supplier contract with an international retailer and blind faith in the power of consumers for good. We’ve included several stages of our five-year plan  to expand local labor force, output capacity, and philanthropic activities, should you, the almighty consumer, choose to exceed our initials goal (color us optimistic).  

  Profits and social responsibility are not mutually exclusive. The OmniSom Pillow team is taking a collective leap of faith in pillow buyers to support better sleep and better community by funding our project. Leap with us and make your money count. We’re not sure our backsides can handle landing on anything other than an OmniSom Pillow.

Risks and Challenges

As with any business model, generating a reliable revenue stream is the foundation for all other aspects of successful operation. Applied to manufacturing the OmniSom Pillow, early high-volume sales are crucial to continued success beyond the initial project funding. The OmniSom Pillow team has developed a sales strategy to utilize relationships with local retailers across the southern United States and a broad range of national retailers, in addition to a targeted online marketing campaign to maximize realization of potential revenue, both long and short term.

The qualifications of OmniSom Pillow’s business manager include professional and educational experience in small business success, environmental law and ONG, and restoration and custom furniture.

story:
For the past decade, Peace Boat US, a non-profit organization based in New York, has developed strong ties of friendship and support with a Kuna indigenous community in Panama that is struggling to keep its 960 members safe from preventable diseases and accidents without external support.

This October, in concert with Peace Boat US’ Music & Art Peace Academy (MAPA), and four other amazing non-profit organizations: Universal Models for Peace, Mythic Bridge, Parties4Peace, and Downtown Community Television (DCTV), we will not only help the community with its sustainable development goals, we will also give inner city youth from New York the opportunity to travel to the community and make a documentary about their experiences. The youth will also have the opportunity to sail with Peace Boat’s 88th Global Voyage between Mexico and Panama (October 24-29, 2015), and take part in study programs, cultural exchanges, educational workshops  and videography training while onboard.

Peace Boat visits Panama every year, and in 2014 the leader of the Kuna indigenous community requested international support for their community to improve its living conditions. Knowing well the incredible diligence of this community, we immediately agreed, and are currently helping them seek funds for the construction materials they need to build a better septic system and safe pathway.

We’ll do the work of organizing this program, but we need your contribution to see it through. Please join us in fostering sustainable development, international friendship and cooperation, and support for inner city youth who otherwise would not be able to travel and study overseas!

Our plan to visit the Kuna indigenous community

Late October will be our next trip to Panama to visit the Kuna community and we would love to make a big impact ! Our aim is to raise at least $5,000 before our next trip so that we can purchase the materials needed to build lavatories, septic tanks, sustainable water sources, and safe sidewalks. The entire process will be documented by two participants funded by the Music & Art Peace Academy (MAPA). 

The Impact

We cannot help the Kuna people without you! Even $10 will go a long way in collecting the necessary materials we need for the construction of the improved toilets and sidewalks in the community. We believe that everyone should have basic resources and healthy living conditions. A successful campaign will show other organizations, as well as the communities we are supporting, that international cooperation and grassroots fundraising efforts can support local sustainable development.  

Thank you for all your help!

Risks & Challenges

We have been visiting the Kuna indigenous community for more than 10 years and we have a great relationship with the leaders of the village. It is always a challenge to do enough when we visit, so we would like to bring as much support as we can during this visit on October 29-30th to support their sustainable development projects including the construction of a community toilet, safe sidewalks and materials for their fair trade clothing program. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to provide a monetary contribution but still would like to be a part of the campaign, put your fast texting fingers to work and spread the word about the project. Invite your co-workers, friends and family to donate online! Please share our link on social media and help us raise awareness through your connections.
